reviews.text: Went on Saturday night after shopping at the mall with my husband and two kids (2yrs and 9m old). We were seating immediately at a big booth, with a high chair on the end for my little one. <br><br>Our server came over and introduced herself (I&#39;m sorry I forgot her name but she was very nice). We put in the mini corn dogs for my 2 year old before anything else. The menu is huuuuge! It&#39;s a lot to look at so it took us a while to decide. When my son&#39;s food came we ordered our meals. <br><br>We ordered the calamari which was so delicious. Very tender and not tough at all. The breading was the perfect texture, not too hard. I got the pasta carbonara and I forget the exact name of my husband&#39;s dish, but it was breaded chicken with mashed potatoes and asparagus. My pasta was creamy and flavorful. They could&#39;ve gone a little lighter on the pepper but I loved it anyway. My husband&#39;s chicken was really yummy. The breading was very light and crisp. We also got a side of Mac n cheese and it&#39;s so good! <br><br>The portions are very decent, so we took the rest of our meals to go. We also ordered two slice of cheesecake to go - the banana cream and Oreo. Those things got devoured so fast when we got home that I didn&#39;t even have time to take a picture lol. Absolutely delicious and we definitely want to try more. <br><br>The waitress checked on us and offered us refills. Service was great. This was all of our first time trying this place and we were very pleased!
The wait is very long but the service is good and so it the food must try their cheesecake my favorite it the strawberry cheesecake but they are all good.

I usually enjoy a good meal at a Cheesecake Factory! I ordered a seared tuna salad which was delicious! No complaints on my food, my strawberry lemonade or the bread! <br>Our server was friendly but could have been a bit more attentive since we were such a large party.<br>The bathroom however needs some help. The women&#39;s restroom needed to be cleaned. The soap dispensers were broken. The restaurant provided bottles hand soap but it was so cheap that it didn&#39;t even sud! It was a no name brand soap that was red. Need to do better on this! Soap is imperative for hygiene of your staff and guests!<br>The rest of the restaurant looked clean and the staff were all friendly.

Came here for a quick meal and it was decent. Nothing too special. I got the flatbread and some parts were a bit burned. My friend got the southern chicken sandwich and it was ok--a bit spicy. The server was friendly but did not check on us often. Moreover, the line in the bathroom was backed up because there was only one stall with toilet paper and it was a little messy so I guess they don&#39;t clean it frequently. Overall it was an average experience. Their cheesecakes looked really good though.

In the area one afternoon &amp; we figured why not come in here &amp; give this place a try. We came in &amp; were seated right away, drinks just had some ginger ale, not bad. <br>They start u off with the Bread Basket not bad good bread nice &amp; warm , Appetizers we gave the Simosas a try these were very good great with the dipping sauce. <br>Main dish I had the Chicken Piccata this comes with pasta the chicken itself was not that great it didn&#39;t have any flavor just tasted like butter.  The pasta was good in the sauce.  My company had the Truffle Honey Fried Chicken comes with mash potatoes &amp; asparagus chicken itself was good nice taste but didn&#39;t really taste like truffle at all could use more truffle taste , decent mash potatoes. So many cheesecakes to try but no room left, maybe next time. <br>Restaurant itself is a good size typical Cheesecake Factory decor, service was not bad but a bit slow.. our waitress seemed to have way too much going on &amp; forgot to bring stuff out. <br>Price wise ok &amp; normal to the chain, overall decent meal there&#39;s always room for improvement.

Not bad but not amazing.<br><br>We decided to come here for lunch while we were at the mall. It took us asking 3x and 20minutes to get a bread basket. The dark wheat oat bread is bomb! Probably the best item we ate.<br><br>We ordered a flatbread which was half basil with parmesan and half basil without parmesan. It took another 20minutes to get this out and the order was wrong. Instead we got half basil with parmesan and half plain cheese slice. Whatever. No biggie.<br><br>I ordered the pizza style parmesan chicken with heavy cheese. My company ordered one of the pastas with all the fixes. Both were pretty good and large portioned! The chicken did taste a bit overcooked though. We actually ended up swapping plates (but thats just because I&#39;m not that much of a breaded chicken gal). <br><br>For desert, we had the celebration cheesecake. Not bad but I don&#39;t think it&#39;s worth $10 and worth writing home about. <br><br>Overall, our bill came out to about $35 per person. I could probably go somewhere better and spend that but it&#39;s awfully convenient when you&#39;re at the mall.

Came here thinking it was going to be a fast in-and-our but definitely wasn&#39;t. It was a 40 minute wait for a Friday night around 6 pm, which I get it since this place is pretty popular and inside a mall, but still I wasn&#39;t expecting to wait so long. The beeper also doesn&#39;t extend too far into the stores, so you&#39;re pretty much stuck waiting next to the pretzel stand. <br><br>Inside is crazy dark. I&#39;ve been to four different Cheesecake Factories through NYC/Long Island and this has got to be the darkest one. And also the most cramped. The booths for four were a lot smaller than usual booths. <br><br>We ordered drinks and they were decent, but not sure if it was worth the price. I probably wouldn&#39;t order drinks the next time I&#39;m here. We got the chicken nachos to start, which is always amazing. The rest of the food was ehh, nothing to rave about. It took a while to get the food out as well. <br><br>I usually love all of their cheesecakes, but decided to go out of the ordinary this time and order the lemon meringue. A mistake I think. The lemon was waaaaay too tart. We also ordered the chocolate mousse, a personal favorite of mine, which is always good.

The food was horrible!! I had ribeye steak and mash potatoes . The mash was not creamy but was like play doh and my steak was hard . $45 for garbage . Do not go here post covid they must have a new chef this experience was by far the worst ever .

Now the worst thing happened to me .... Cheesecake Factory opened up literally 4 blocks from my house .... my diet is now officially dead . I love this place the choices are endless and the food is always well cooked and delicious. I&#39;ve done brunch , lunch and dinner here and every time the customer service and dining experience has been superb. I can&#39;t get into how amazing their food is ..... as I&#39;ve had too many dishes and I can&#39;t describe them all ... just go check them out and get some shopping done while you&#39;re at it . Enjoy !

Fun atmosphere. Great happy hour menu and deals. The menu is overwhelming - many to chose from! The food is okay, pretty basic. The Cheesecake menu is awesome! I would recommend coming here for the cheesecakes.

The customer service here has never really been an issue, but after today I would never go back.  Amidst eating my Sheila&#39;s cashew chicken salad, I saw a bug upside down.  When I moved it to see what it was, I saw it was a ladybug.  I am so disgusted that I am at a loss for words!  For the times that we are in, and the prices at restaurants, they should really inspect their kitchens.  This was truly a horrible and disgusting experience.

Reservation 7:30pm. Waited 5 minutes to be seated not bad. (Birthday night hoping the place is good) NO Water/bread/utensils, requested 3 times finally came at 8:15pm. Nothing on table 40 minutes No water, utensils, breads!!! Not good at all.<br>Food finally come appetizer was good. Now 4 out 5 entrees tonight not eatable it&#39;s horrible. Filet mignon was BURNED on all sides. (Chinese takeout taste better, now that is sad) Jamaican shrimp was almost untouched due to over cook. Hamburger well the bacon inside taste like metal sheets. Regular meats was way over cook but kid was hungry and had no choice but eat. Now my dish of curry chicken and shrimp was near perfect except the brown rice was so hard taste like jumbo beach sand. Our table of 5, we eat and not picky but the entrees are unacceptable and giving us water, bread, utensils after requesting it 3 times and after 40 minutes is totally unacceptable. Our bill was $300 bucks. Ridiculous. Singing happy birthday 2 times in an hour to the table behind us was hilarious.<br><br>Food: 0 out 5 (Fired the cook)<br>Service 0 out 5. Dont know how to do reservation. Have to direct me to manager, seriously. To tell me I have to do it online not phone. Only manager knows which app to do reservation( my minds still laughing)<br>Management: Your fired. <br>Decor: comfortable but too dark. I cant read my menu. All 5 of us having to use phone light. SMH...<br>Parking: NONE <br>Result: You are warn, it is totally disappointing from the get go. Stay away.

Came here for my best friends fathers birthday. We waited 20 minutes to be seated.  We ordered 3 entrees and an appetizer I had the stuffed mushrooms, my best friend had tomato basil pasta and her dad had the carne asada. We also shares tortilla with spinach dipS. We all enjoyed the food.. it did take a while for everything to come out but it did eventually.  Our server Jocelyn was very pleasant.  I told jocelyn about the birthday for my best friends dad and we awaited a surprise for him.  Service was very slow we finished our food and waited a while for the birthday dessert... and had to tell the server a second time... a second server because our first server went on break. We were literally sitting at our table on our phones. The coordination here is very poor and quite honestly there would be no wait if this place had everything together. Servers were great, food was good.. but we did wait a bit too long.

I usually come here when my family gets a gift card. The best parts of the meal usually are the whole wheat bread and cheesecake. The waiters/waitresses are hospitable and nice but seem to rotate a lot... I&#39;ve never seen a waiter or waitress on more than one visit. Recently we visited and had a 1 hour wait on a Saturday for table of 3. I usually get the bread for free with butter and both whole wheat and white bread. Maybe it was because the waitress was new and was not trained well, but we did not get the bread until we asked for it, and there was no whole wheat bread at all... and it was cold and hard. Even the table next to us had both breads. We had pork belly sliders which were hot and delicious. I believe it had a sweet barbecue sauce. We also had the filet mignon which was standard and the evelyns favorite pasta that was recommended by the waitress. There was a problem with my tuna poke dish for some reason. It had to come a little later than the other dishes. So it took like 35 minutes after the appetizer (sliders) came. I believe it was a manager who came to apologize to us and explain that I will get a free salad or soup to make up for the wait. It seemed like it was optional though because the waitress came back 2 minutes after dropping off my tuna poke and asked if I still wanted the salad or soup. Of course I did. I came here several times and had such issues from the kitchen at least on 3 different visits... I&#39;m not sure what&#39;s going on but maybe they need more staff in the kitchen/better system in place.

I love the cheese cake factory it is one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. And the one in Miami beach.when I went to this location it was nice the atmosphere was cool and the staff was nice. I had gotten a couple of pieces of cake ,the chocolate cheese cake and a strawberry cheesecake. Along with a regular piece of cheese cake,and I can say I enjoyed it.I would definitely go back ,I recommend it when in queens nyc stop by for some cake or some good food

Service sucks! After sharing my concerns with the MANAGER: ANDREW - he said: I&#39;m sorry and didn&#39;t try to offer anything in return. BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE! <br><br>When I arrived, I sat at an empty bar for 10 min before anyone even acknowledged me. And come to find out that - the &#34;Hispanic&#34; women who FAILED to acknowledge my presence WAS in fact A MANAGER! <br><br>I was then taken care of by a black bartender, who was ok with his service, but not on top of it enough to get tipped generously. He gave me my check before I asked for it and was eating fries on the side, while I was sitting...waiting for him to take my card, in order to pay. <br><br>Backing up, my LETTUCE WRAPS took waaaaaaayyyyy too long to come out and the glasses that I sampled wine in - were DIRTY! <br><br>The BEST thing about my experience was the S&#39;mores Cheesecake! I&#39;m mad that I even left a tip!

I love the cheesecake factory<br>You have the option for healthy food, or no that healthy, portions are big, so u can even share. <br>I love a salad that has like an Asian dressing . <br>For dessert, my 2 to go are key lime and macadamia nut one. <br>Good cocktails too.<br>Enjoy!!

Hmmm this was a tough one to rate. There was a wait on a Monday in the middle of the day so I would say they are popular. They seating was tight but they sat two of us at a 4 seater so no complains there. Very very busy, a little noisy and the prices are not to crazy $10 appetizers and small lunch items and then it goes up to like $40 for like steak or some other Italian signature dishes they had. I peeped the floor manager tell two bartenders to get trays and not carry drinks in their hands which I thought &#34;damn he&#39;s on point&#34;. My waiter was great, had like 4 tables in a cluster and did his little 360 shuffle every few minutes until we left. The cheesecake is TO DIE FOR. Comparable to Juniors crazy variety, fresh - just perfect. I mean if I had the a shitty experience and then the cheesecake I probably would have forgotten (that&#39;s how good it is). The waiter brought out extra whipped cream for my son which I thought was like two thumbs up  .
Ordered Filet Mignon medium. Was soft  like ****<br>First time ever that steak tasted horrible ! 100000% never goes back again. Bye bye

I absolutely love this Cheesecake Factory. The only downfall of this location is that is located in queens center mall so you have to pay to park and walk through the mall to get to the restaurant. The service is quick and employees are friendly and welcoming.<br><br>I came here on a Saturday afternoon and have a skinnilicious salad and crab bites. They have a entire skinnylicious menu which is nice if you are trying to watch calories or such. <br><br>Prices are pretty good! About $11 for a cesear salad and 7 for crab bites. Let me tell you these crab bites were sooo good that we ordered a second order to take home for later. It was paid with a garlic mayo sauce and I wanted to take a jar of it home if I could. Salad was also delicious and wasn&#39;t so heavy that I was terribly full all day. There is free refills on soft beverages.<br><br>Our servers name was Anthony and for how big the location is he was great and quick. Was around to bring us bread, take our order, and refill our beverages very efficiently and quickly. <br><br>Decor inside is beautiful and this afternoon we actually sat on the patio side where windows can raise to make it feel you are sitting outside. It was raining the day we went so windows were closed.<br><br>Especially weekend nights, you can wait long time for a table and they do not take reservations. But if you have to wait it is still worth it. Anything and everything I have tried at this location is great and it is definelty a great place to check out!

You would think that they would know what to do. The veggies were cold and raw. My steak I asked for medium rare. It was well done. The server was not attentive at all. He brought my bread when I was almost done.  My banana cheesecake was supposed to come with sliced bananas...he said they didn&#39;t have any. I was never asked how my meal was. This was dissatisfying. I won&#39;t be back.

We came here for my birthday party and had a horrible experience. I asked the waitress to recommend some dishes for 5 people. She recommended the spaghetti with meatballs, and told us the lunch special has two meatballs but the big portion has three. We then ordered other dishes. Then, later, she brought us a plate of spaghetti with meatballs and told us we ordered it. I never ordered this dish and she wouldn&#39;t take it back. Even if she thought I wanted to order it, how could she know which size I wanted? She just wanted to add the dish to our bill!<br>Then afterwards, we went to the front and ordered some cheesecake to go. The bill came to $28.14, but later, I checked my credit card statement and they charged us $29. This is ILLEGAL! The staff is not honest here.

I&#39;m never disappointed with the food - the menu is diverse and it&#39;s hard to get through all the great choices. My one go-to though is the beet, avocado, and orange salad. It&#39;s topped with a yogurt dressing and crunchy quinoa bits. It&#39;s a must try. I&#39;ve also tried the chicken reisling, white chicken chili, and angel hair pasta. The lighter dishes are just as enjoyable as the heavier meals.<br><br>Service is uneven and depends on who you get - they&#39;ve all been friendly enough, the difference has been attention span and  tending to the table (i.e. timing of beverages so that everyone is served at the same time); one time, my party ordered a dish  of ice cream and a cheesecake slice; only the ice cream came and then I waited, and waited for my cheesecake, and finally had to remind the waiter who responded with, &#34;Oh, you ordered cheesecake? Ok.&#34;<br><br>I will say that they&#39;re very food at handling gluten free and nut free requests and accommodate accordingly - it&#39;s why I&#39;m a repeat customer. <br><br>One last thing - bathrooms are not always clean and I wish they&#39;d tend to it more frequently - I&#39;ve gone in there and seen some nasty stuff.

This is one of the best CCF in the NYC area. What they lack in speed, they make up for with service and quality.  Our server, Ariana, was super friendly and personable.<br>I ordered the tomato basil chicken pasta in the Carle Place location and though it tasted good, it was dry and less seasoned. This location? The opposite!  It was well seasoned and even had olive oil with basil sprinkled about the dish.  <br>We tried mojitos, a pineapple &amp; a passionfruit, and they so were tasty, but expensive for the location at $12.75.  I was soooo full, and still had to pack half of my dinner to go (was even better the next day).  We&#39;ve only had cheesecake here before, but I&#39;m certainly glad we stayed for dinner.

I personally love cheesecake factory. This month theyre doing a limited edition collaboration with Cinnabon. The cake has a minimal cinnamon taste (not too powerful) and some crunchy bits thats soooo good in the middle with cheesecake. UGH to devour for IG: @eatsumbap<br><br>We also ordered the chicken riesling which had a generous amount of meat and the best aldente noodles. YUM<br><br>Lastly we ordered the chicken pot pie which was actually deliever on a dish with the filling at the bottom topped with mash potatoes (not the usually potpie you picture) <br> They were all generally good. The potpie was slightly salty for my tasting but all the food we order from here always makes me happy.

Couple hours ago I went there to have lunch. I went to olive garden but was told I have to wait 15 to 20 min so I had a choice to go cheesecake factory or longhorn  steakhouse. Choose to go cheese cake factory instead.<br><br>Thank God I didn&#39;t have to wait again. What a relief. <br>I was greeted by two ladies at the receptionist &amp; one of them took me to the table. <br>Again I was greeted by nice American girl. <br>Didn&#39;t get a chance what was her name or I would have wrote her name here. But she was tall, smiled and refilled the drinks before it got emptied.<br><br>Why was only 3 stars? The food &amp; wait time! <br><br>Ordered avocado egg roll, California cheese steak, lasagna Verde.<br><br>Avocado egg roll it came with fried white noodles on the bottom. It also came with some sauce but it were just too sweet. Besides the sauce it was good.<br><br>Lasagna Verde it was salty. <br><br>California cheese steak that came with salad I didn&#39;t touch it. I will explain why!<br>Also the cheese steak sandwich when it came out it felted like why did I ordered this I could get them in Subway (LOL)<br><br>After I ordered I waited nearly 15 min for 1 appetizer to come out <br>And for the main food that had to come I waited over 30 MINUTES! <br><br>My partner asked me  where were other foods at. I just told him it will come out soon so wait! But I didn&#39;t know it would take this long! <br><br>I went there because I was hungry! After bringing my food out late I lost my appetite after taking too long for my food to come out! <br><br>Avocado egg roll came out at 4:30pm<br>For just a sandwich &amp; lasagna it came out at 5:20pm<br><br>I gave them 22% gratuity instead of 15% because the girl who served me was nice girl until I left that restaurant. She gave us her smile till the end.  <br><br>It needs an improvement! I been to Applebees, uno pizzeria etc but it never took 40 min for my food.<br><br>Idk if I will come here to dine again if I have to wait nearly over 30 min again for my food.

I don&#39;t know if their cheesecake quality went down the drain over the years or if my standards/tastebuds have changed but back like 15 years ago their cheesecake tasted so much better.  When I went recently, I couldn&#39;t eat anymore cheesecake after the first bite because it just tasted like below average cheesecake.  I have tried home-made cheesecake made from about 7 different friends who love to bake/cook and their cheesecake is like a 10/10 while Cheesecake Factory&#39;s cheesecake is like a 2/10 in comparison.
Great varieties choose of foods<br>Many specialties and lunch menu<br>Love the crab bites and fresh free bread

We enjoyed the outdoor dining experience.   The tables were far apart.  The chicken Madeira and steak and salmon combo was delicious.   The servers were very friendly and accommodating.  We went around 430 and the timing was just right.   Highly recommend if you want to dine outside!

[COVID pick up order] Everything was ready at the time stated and the food was delicious. I recommend the jerk chicken and shrimp! Yummy! and of course any and all the cheesecakes! but i got the caramel cheesecake with EXTRA WHIP CREAM. :) yummy!!! my kids loved it!
In the cooked lettuce, the bugfly was dying.<br><br>I was really surprised and uncomfortable. I want you to pay attention to the hygiene idea.

I paid almost $8 for a slice of cheesecake tHat looks like this. What a rip off. Very poor quality con<br><br>Update: looking for answers rather than being told to reach out for the second time by giving me directions to your website.

I had no idea Cheesecake Factory is a restaurant and not a dessert place. I didn&#39;t get a memo! My friend and I decided to meet for lunch somewhere around the Queens Mall. We don&#39;t know the area well but found this restaurant inside the mall. The reviews were not that great but I just had to try it myself, especially when they serve food and not just the cheesecake. It&#39;s a beautiful restaurant. We both ordered fish tacos. It came with rice and beans. The fish taco was quite good. The beans was pretty good too. I would like to come back with Hubby and order this fish tacos when I feel like having it. I think he would like it too. My friend said she knows about the Cheesecake Factory but never crossed her mind to try it. Our waiter, James(?), was pretty helpful with our orders. I don&#39;t know about other dishes but the fish tacos was quite amazing. The fish was fresh. The seasoning was just perfect, not too overpowering, very nice fish tacos!
Visited here yesterday. Great food! I had the Tex-Mex egg rolls as an appetizer, my fave entree (the Tuscan chicken meal minus the capers), and a Cinnabon cheesecake for dessert. Delicious!

Walking into the Cheesecake Factory you are greeted by a hostess. Ours wasn&#39;t particularly nice but maybe she was having a bad day. <br><br>She then leads us over to our table that is right off of the kitchen. No big deal. The booth was nice and cozy. The lighting was very dim though. <br><br>We waited a good 10 minutes before our waiter came by. He might of been busy as the restaurant was pretty packed. <br><br>I ordered the Chicken Lettuce Wrap Tacos. (220 calories) He ordered french fries. We then waited for a while and I heard another table across from us say to another waiter that the food that was just placed on their table want theirs. That server left the food on their table and called over our waiter to let him know the food was delivered to them instead of our table. Our waiter then picked our food up from their table and walked into the kitchen with our food. About 5 minutes later comes out with the same plates and dropped them off to us.  I asked him if the other table touched the food and he got a little flustered and said no they didn&#39;t and apologized. <br><br>So we were given food that was dropped off at another table. I saw the manager near us so I called him over, explained the situation and asked him for a condiment. I wasn&#39;t looking for anything free I told him. I was just annoyed that this situation had happened. <br><br>After I ate my tacos (that were given to another table by mistake) I wanted a slice of cheesecake being that we were in the Cheesecake Factory. I ordered a slice called Andy&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple. (1280 calories!!) It was worth every single calorie. <br><br>Very long review short (sorry about that), while I loved the food, I will not be going back to the CCF as I think the situation could of been handled better. If anything the manager could of had the food be remade. It could of been put as an immediate fire and delivered to us in less than 5 minutes. <br><br>Sad because the Cheesecake was absolutely the beat I have ever had. <br><br>Thanks CCF.

Walking by some kids on the street today. Guess what they are shouting?  &#34;ooh.... Cheesecake Factory,&#34; apparently, I am not the only one who has a liking for cheesecakes!<br><br>I avoid the sit-down area because it&#39;s always crowded by the Queens Center Mall and not worth the wait for dessert only.  Since it&#39;s Easter today, it&#39;s already packed at 5:30PM. <br><br>Have some patience since the take out person handles several tasks.  Kudos to the female cashier for serving us (the order to go customers), the ringing phones, and pick up orders.  Picked up a slice of white chocolate caramel macadamia nut.  Always forget how sweet it is and stop after eating half.  The fresh cream is always a treat.<br><br>Many choices of cakes and cheesecakes to choose from.  Happy Easter!

The hostess on Saturday NIGHT, January 4th needs to be replaced. I understand that there are certain protocols but her attitude and frigidness does not help the restaurant. I arrived at 745 and asked for table for 8. She told me  &#34; well it would be 2 and a half hours. Theres&#39; a table of 7, 6, 8, 2, 5, 8 (some other numbers) in front of it&#34; I gave her my number and waited. I watched at 815 a table for 7 was seated and asked how long they waited. They said the hosted said 2 hours but they only waited 45 minutes. So I was kinda hopeful. <br><br>AT 845 I made sure there was a crowd in front of her. And then I asked her how much longer do you think it would be...She said well.... with her terrible facial expressions &#34;Theres a table of 7, 5, 3, 8 and 2 ahead of you. So what did I tell you before? 2 and half hours?&#34; <br><br>I walked away.  I swore she named maybe 7 different groups ahead of me .... and she mentioned a table of 2. BUT how does a table of two affect my seating for a table of 8?<br><br>I swore they maybe had like two table that fit a group of 8. <br><br>Anyways they didn&#39;t call me till 945. So yes i waited almost 2 hours. <br><br>END OF STORY <br>DO NOT COME if you have a party of 7 or more. They don&#39;t take reservations and the wait is horrible.
There was hair in my food. Disgusting and unacceptable. Do better Cheesecake Factory!

This review is solely based on the food. The service by the waiters are ALWAYS A+. The stewardess needs a lesson on hospatality. E.g I asked for a table for 2 and was told 50mins. My girlfriend comes in 15 mins later and she is told 30 mins wait for a table for 2. Why not direct the parties of two or less to the bar for seating? That would be way too easy. Smh!<br><br>On to the food. The waiter Ken was so helpful with what I was crazing, firecracker salmon appetizer it was an amazing choice. I also added the passion fruit mojito and a single serving ceasar salad. Everything was to my liking.<br><br>With all that being said please go and risk a long wait or seating by close to the bar. (Bar seating is table seating too. You&#39;re seating high table bar style)

On this here 1st day of 2019 after a late night of celebrating no one wanted to cook. So we venture out. <br><br>I was super particular in what I wanted becuase I had it the week before at the other cheesecake factory location, cheeseburger egg rolls and fried cheese (Don&#39;t judge my life).  So the diner that my companion  was heading to was vetoed. <br><br>It&#39;s the cheesecake factory, one the finer chain spots to some. The one that always seems to have a crazy wait no matter what state you&#39;re in. Luckily  we were able to snag a high top bar table as soon as we got there. Ordered coffee, because its life.<br><br>Why the 3 stars, becuase they didnt have my fried cheese... boooooooo... or the Cuban sandwich that my partner wanted...booooooo to the second power. I dont get why that happens. I get it, but when your mouth is ready for fried cheese...it&#39;s ready for fried cheese. So instead of the sandwich, the smokehouse burger was order and Nashville nuggets replaced the fried cheese. It was all tasty... its cheesecake factory; consistent. <br><br>I will give 5 stars to our waiter... the awesomest!

3.5 stars <br><br>Ok I was done, but we received a lot of gift certificates so we didn&#39;t have much of a choice but to come back. We arrived in time for Happy Hour and we got the last 2 seats at a table. Seriously no wait for us on a Friday evening?? <br>The place was packed. Still confused why it&#39;s so popular...last time we were here the food sucked. It was so heavy and salty. This time, the food was much better but we didn&#39;t order much since we ate a late lunch. <br>For drinks, we started with a Long Island Iced Tea and a Mojito. They were kinda weak, so next round we asked for stronger Long Islands and the bartender made it right. <br>Our server, Brian, was great. We were given bread as we waited for our appetizers. The bread was warm and even the butter was melted. I love spinach dip and their version kinda tastes like creamed spinach at a steakhouse. Really oily though...chips were a bit too thick. Pico de Gallo was very fresh. Also had their corn tamales. Better than last time. It was very sweet but at least it wasn&#39;t too salty. Ingredients tasted much fresher than the last time I was here. Sharing 2 appetizers was enough to fill me up I didn&#39;t need dinner that night. <br>I&#39;ll be be back soon for HH!

I went there with my friend today. Food was good but i wanna talk about service.<br><br>We didnt get spoons and forks even after the foods were served. The server didnt notice until we ask. People next to us had same situation. <br><br>We waited at the front to be seated, but the table wasnt ready. <br><br>Funny and surprising service ever.

Back in the day there was not a week that would go by that I would not dine at a Cheesecake Factory restaurant. I had not been to one in 5 years. My buddies Invited me for convenience to one and I accepted remembering days of Cheesecake past. Instead of getting a table, we all Sat at the bar. Ordered the Korean Fried Califlower and the chicken sliders. Both were ok and very high In caloric content.  Now um not hating on the food, it just seems they depend on lots of rich sauces to enhance in which it does. The place was almost full on a Monday night so they have a good recipe to attract people.<br><br>Ordered more fried small plates including the fried loaded tater tots, the fried Reuben spring rolls, deep fried salmon balls, and the fried firecracker salmon in crispy wrapper. I did not order these but the were all not the best in flavor. Again more about the sauce. One of my buddies ordered the Hibachi steak with mashed potatoes and fried battered asparagus.  I have to admit the steak was quite tender and with good flavor and the mash potatoes were very good loaded with butter and the asparagus was good too. Almost 1400 calories... The guys who took care of us at the bar were good and quick to refill our beverages. Lots of beers.  I would have given them a 3.5 stars overall. Yes, you should continue to go. For Me, I would go and be more choosing of their menu and probably go more for the entrees and select appetizers.<br><br>Finally got cheesecake. Got a low cal regular one with a strawberry chopped up in multiple pieces to qualify for the 620 calories. We also got a chocolate chip cheesecake  as well. Both were good.

I love the cheesecake factory. They always find a way to fill me up. I hate it when I&#39;m handed a menu, and I look through it, figure out what I want, then told they ran out. It&#39;s frustrating. I wish they just told me when they handed me the menu lol

One word.....ghetto. The takeout counter is beyond slow. Walked in and the girl behind the counter stayed on the phone for 5 minutes. 2 other ppl were chit chatting by the  hostess desk and told me they could not help although I have been waiting for an order that was placed online for 15 minutes. Should&#39;ve just sat down and ordered.....<br><br>Stay away

I&#39;ve said it before and I&#39;ll say it again, I love cheesecake. So it&#39;s a no brainer that I like The Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve had the pleasure of going to several different Cheesecake Factories now, and for the most part, it&#39;s been a pleasant experience overall. However, it&#39;s so sad to say, that this specific Cheesecake Factory, one that just opened a few months ago, failed on so many levels. <br><br>Upon arriving, we were promptly seated, and IMMEDIATELY approached by the waiter asking if we wanted anything to drink. We didn&#39;t even have a chance to put down our phones yet, forget even looking at the menu. We ordered some basic drinks. It took quite some time for the waiter to return with the drinks, at which point we were ready to order. We ordered the Truffle Bacon Grilled Cheeses for appetizer and Fish &amp; Chips / Cuban Sandwich for entree. At some point, the waiter came up to the table, grabbed my half empty lemonade and walked away without saying a word. Came back 10 minutes later with a full cup. Appreciate the service, but why take my unfinished cup, and make me wait 10 minutes without saying a word?<br><br>The appetizers came out about 20 minutes after placing the order. Nothing special about it, but it was the best part of the meal. About another 30 minutes later, the entrees came out. We asked for new utensils (because the ones provided were not properly cleaned), but the server never returned with ones. The food was disappointing. Barely seasoned, and felt like they were sitting on the counter some time before being brought out, as they felt just warm. <br><br>The table next to us wasn&#39;t pleased with their experience either. Additionally, when they asked for their check, the waiter brought them an empty check holder, he forgot to put the check in it. <br><br>Service was non existent. No welcome, no small talk, just what do you want and here&#39;s your check. <br><br>Very disappointing from The Cheesecake Factory and from a newly opened restaurant. Won&#39;t be back.
I&#39;m always a fan of Cheesecake Factory. They have great salads. Like their factory burrito, fish tacos and oreo cheesecake among other items.

The atmosphere was nice and the server was very good buy the quality of the food was not so good. I order a strawberry short cake they gave me some biscuit type of things with ice cream and cute up strawberries it was not good, I would not recommend this it. But the pizza chicken Parmesan was good.

I am now writing about my visit last Friday, must&#39;ve been 7ish pm. Close to full house.<br><br>My neighbors ate there this evening. Their french fries were served cold so they sent it back. Came back, still not hot. Coincidentally when I was dining there, I saw a woman sent back her fries too.<br><br>On my visit, I ordered Grilled Fish Tacos. The fish were light golden in color, but cold in my mouth. The rice and black beans were hot. When I saw my waitress, I sent it back. It came back 5-8 mins later and still, cold. I just ate it. The veggies were wilting and guac was browning so I ate everything on the plate &#39;as is&#39;. <br><br>Also, I ordered s skinny cocktail: think it was Moscow Mule. That was refreshing and just as good as full calorie version. <br><br>Maybe I&#39;ll return for cheesecake and coffee.

Lackluster again. I honestly don&#39;t know what&#39;s going on here, but corporate needs to look in to this place. Of all the Cheesecake Factory locations I&#39;ve been to, this is by far the worst. Everybody has a smart mouth and attitude problem. I asked for another table because the table was wobbly and the hostess gave an attitude and deep sigh. Excuse me ma&#39;am, but relax. This is your job. Again, water and bread took forever to get there. Actually it came right before my apps which was about an overall 40 minute wait from being sat to it being in my table. 40 mins without water while ppl that were sat after me received their entrees and second drinks. I did however notice some ppl next to me that were upset about not being offered any bread either and saying that&#39;s the main reason they come in here is for the bread. Asked for a manager and was told they&#39;ll be here shortly. Waited 10 mins then left a $20 under my plate and exited, didn&#39;t even ask for a bill. Anyways, 0 for 2 at this location. I&#39;ll stick to the one by Roosevelt Field. <br><br>Anybody that does dine here, may the odds ever be in your favor.

THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE TAKE-OUT<br><br>Came here on a Monday night at 5:30pm. I ordered a pasta carbonara without chicken ($16.50) and a slice of cheesecake (7.95). It took about 20 minutes for me to get my order. When I got home I found that there was barely any sauce on my pasta. WHERE IS THE SAUCE? (See picture below) It was so bland and dry. I used to love their carbonara but I didn&#39;t expect to receive this kind of treatment when ordering take-out. <br><br>The lady who helped me was extremely rude and probably hated her job. I couldn&#39;t decide between cheesecakes and I ended up wanting a different one after placing an order. When I asked to change, (the cheesecake was the same price) she rolled her eyes at me, changed the order and handed me the cheesecake without even properly bagging it. I&#39;m sorry did I offend you? Please take your misery out somewhere else. Disgusting.

One star is on this experience and the food preparation<br><br>Wait staff service and General Manager response was a 3 star. <br><br>My golf buddy is a Cheesecake Factory fan and goes to the one out in White Plains and wanted to try this one. I been here like when it first opened 9 months ago and so much has changed.<br><br>No lines at all on a Sunday at 12 PM? The place was relatively empty. It was not busy at all and no wait time whatsoever. The hostess sat us in a small table for two and we wanted a booth. She found us another table which was a booth by the entrance to the bathroom.<br><br>**Tip #1**-Watch out walking towards the bathroom for it is very slippery. Walk slow do not run. <br><br>Couple of things happened which is why I gave this place a One star.<br><br>My friend ordered the Bruleed French Toast which came out hot on the outside but the inside was cold. Was it just reheated or left over from the day before? The waitress was really good and said she will get another one. It took a while for the order to come cause it was being prepared.<br><br>The other Bruleed French Toast look like it was freshly made and had sprinkled powder.<br><br>I ordered the French Chicken &amp; Waffles Benedict. There was a piece of hair. I am mortified. Then flagged down the waitress and she was busy with other tables for her area was busy. She looked at me and said it was being prepared. Did not come over from the other table. Guess she coming over when the food was ready to brought over to the table. So I waited till she came over with the French Toast. Informed her about the hair, she went to get the General Manager who apologized that these type of things do happen. Said that they can make another one or I can order something else. I lost my appetite after that and stuck with coffee and water.<br><br>Even heard plates dropping and stuff smashing at the kitchen which made me think of not getting anything. The waitress came back and asked if I wanted a piece of cake and I said no Thank You.<br><br>Maybe I watch too much Hell&#39;s Kitchen and you would imagine they would check every plate before it goes out to the table.<br><br>**Tip #2**- Regarding you bill. They will post a suggested tip amount. BEWARE- Read carefully. The Tip is added to the whole bill after taxes. It is not on the food/drink bill alone. <br><br>Will not be back again.<br><br>The novelty of this place has worn off after 9 months.
30mins waiting for table ,20mins waiting for food ,15mins finish the food ,but they got best cheesecake in the world

To be completely honest, when I first heard about the Cheesecake factory I didn&#39;t know what to expect. I thought that this restaurant&#39;s specialty was with desserts and not particularly food. I have to say, I was happy to be proven wrong! During a night out with my gals for one of my gal&#39;s birthday, we came to the Cheesecake Factory. Although we had to stand and wait for two hours which wasn&#39;t entirely enjoyable, we were blown away by the delicious food, and nice staff. I do have to stress the importance of having more seating areas for those who just arrive and have to wait for a table. Also, this restaurant should allow for people to make reservations. <br><br>The restaurant is clean, fancy, and well-kept. For anyone looking for a place to go in Queens that wont break the bank, the Cheesecake Factory is for you! The nachos are to die for, and the Americana burger is delicious! In my opinion, the fries are much too salty, but still well-done.<br><br>Now, one thing to be aware of is that the food is very filling and come in big portions so you may not have room for dessert. But for the love of everything that is good, do not leave that restaurant without ordering a cheesecake. Too full? Well than grab a to-go bag and take it with you for the road!

We walked in and we were seated right away. Usually the start of great service right? Wrong! <br>A waitress came to us and informed us that our real server was off the floor and she&#39;s be assisting us until our real server returned back to the floor. No big deal right? Everyone deserves a break. However, when the waitress asked for our drink orders my friend had said just a water and then she completely ignored my drink order! The waitress walked away without taking my drink order! Completely rude! <br>When she came back I asked for a drink. When she came back with my drink she took our orders, and then asked if we wanted bread for the table. We said yes. <br>Our real server comes back at this point, 10 minutes later, we have no food, just drinks and she asks us if everything&#39;s Ok. No, lady it&#39;s not. We were promised bread for the table and it hasn&#39;t arrived. The 1st waitress comes back and tells us our food will be out shortly. Okay, why do we have two servers trying to serve this table? <br>Once our food arrives, it was hot. Which I was happy about, with the lack of service and the confusion between staff I was worried our food would have been cold I would have been angry. <br><br>But the real topper is, I&#39;m a new mom, and it was my FIRST outing with my new baby. I wanted to sit in a booth, and have my child next to me in the stroller, one of the women from the front desk comes over to us as were eating and tells me I can&#39;t have the stroller next to me because it&#39;s a fire hazard, that&#39;s why she removed the chair. How is this a fire hazard? It&#39;s only me! And on top of that there&#39;s no one else seated around us! The place was quiet! I have a newborn with me as a new mom. I wanted her next to me. The girl at the front desk was rude about it too. She could have said it in a nicer way. And why would you wait to say something when we&#39;re halfway through eating our meal? At that point you could have just let it slide. The place was slow at that point anyway! <br><br>My friend ended up giving them a tip anyway for horrendous service and rude workers. I would not have given a tip if that was me. I would have just paid my bill and left. <br><br>I should have spoken with a manager at this point, but I just wanted to get the hell out of here. Needless to say, I will NOT come back here again. <br><br>First time out as a new mom, first time to this location to eat and do some Christmas shopping and this is my experience? No thanks. <br>I&#39;d pass if I were you, there are plenty of other places to eat around there. If I could give zero stars for the service I would.
Sorry is not enough, I paid $148 plus tips above %20and it was my 30th anniversary, very disappointing sir

Lmfbooo. ONE HOUR deeez nuts<br><br>More like 97 mins. No Ebro. <br>Service is worse than a rub and tug at a paraplegic center. <br>I decided to order something different for once, waiter comes back and tells me they can&#39;t make it, so he offers the pasta and chicken dish in sandwhich form. <br>Yea thanks, but I&#39;ll pass on the angel hair dropping out my fucking baguette. <br>They ALSO forgot bacon for my best friends child&#39;s burger. <br>I&#39;d rather crip walk at a blood meeting than eat at this location again. <br>LONG ISLAND OR DIE.

This place left the lot to be desired. Very busy location one of the only restaurants actually attached to the mall so it dries in a large crowd. If you are hungry than this might be a spot for you. The kitchen must&#39;ve been overworked, because the food was substandard, my first round of pasta came out cold, And every other dish just was bland as compared to other cheesecake factories. <br><br>I must give a shout out to the bartenders working though, they were the only great part about this whole experience. There were only two of them for the whole restaurant and they never stopped moving the whole time I was there. I appreciate the hustle but unfortunately the rest of the experience really brought down my view of this place.

I rarely eat at chain restaurants but my teen boys wanted to come here in celebration of one of their birthdays. I will say that we all left super stuffed and had to take doggy bags to take away. <br><br>My boys both had fried Mac and cheese appetizers which are fried into little balls that resemble slight large munchkins from Dunkin&#39; donuts. Us adults shared the spinach dip app and we all ended up getting burgers. The burgers were not bad at all for a chain restaurant. I couldn&#39;t finish mine but it was good, I ended up with the Mac and cheese burger which was a bit disappointingly executed. They basically just put one of the fried Mac &amp; cheese balls on your burgers. I was expecting a burger smothered in creamy dripping Mac and cheese. Still tasted decent but I probably wouldn&#39;t go back there unless it&#39;s my kid&#39;s request. Unfortunately I didn&#39;t have space to even think about cheesecake so there&#39;s that. Maybe next time I&#39;m in the mall, I&#39;ll stop in and pick one up to take home and try out.

I don&#39;t often do chain restaurants but there is something I really like about the Cheesecake Factory perhaps, it&#39;s the plethora of desserts, noooo the food is pretty decent too, and usually the dishes are so grand that you will have leftover for lunch the next day. You definitely will get your monies worth. <br><br>This time we arrived during happy hour, oh what a way to unwind with half price apps and delicious cocktails. I believe happy hour is from 4-7 don&#39;t quote me on the exact time. My husband and I were actually hungry so we kept our appetizer basic. We ordered the cheesy garlic bread that was paired with seasoned olive oil and marinara sauce. It had a  perfect crunchy yet chewy texture. We had cocktails as well, the cosmopolitan here is on point so is the mojito. Shout out to whoever is the mixologist. <br><br>Following our dishes arrival, my husband had the taco meal that was accompanied by rice and beans. <br><br>I had the 4 cheese pasta with chicken and I swapped out the angel hair pasta for linguini. It was not bad it was a mixed linguini, I believe It was a basil mixture. <br><br>The staff is attentive and sweet. <br><br>We were so full, we opted out of dessert. Now that&#39;s crazy, no cheesecake, maybe next time cheesecake to go.

Terrible experience dining there. The server assigned to our area took forever to get our order because she was chitchatting with a couple in another table (prolly her friends). We called the attention of other servers a couple of times but they all said someone will take our order. When the server assigned finally got to us, she came with complete attitude. She was gruff and impatient when she took our order. The drinks were served promptly but the complimentary bread took ages to be served. She said it was still in the oven! By that time, we were there for almost 30 mins already, famished with not even a bread basket to eat while waiting for our orders. We decided we&#39;ve had enough of this so we got up and tried to leave. The server saw us and said a sarcastic &#34;goodbye&#34; to us but the manager stopped us from leaving. He said we still have to pay for the food! We argued about the service and he said the food is almost ready. We told him we are worried someone would do something about our food because the server didin&#39;t like us and he said &#34;well I don&#39;t like you too but you don&#39;t have to worry about it because we take pride in our food and service&#34;. Wow. Talk about GREAT PR and customer relations! He assigned another server to us who was much better than the first one. <br>We will not dine in this CCF branch ever again nor would we recommend it to anyone.

Definitely don&#39;t go here! Worst restaurant. Servers are rude especially this tall chubby Italian woman. The gay manager is rude as hell. Waited 10 mins to be served. Then waited 30 mins to even have the bread out. When we were about to leave since it was taking forever, they cornered us and wouldn&#39;t let us leave. The manager did not even apologize at all and even told us that he doesn&#39;t like us. So unprofessional. Not worth to give your money and time. If I could give 0, I would.

I now understand why this Cheesecake Factory has soo many bad reviews and low rating. To start off, I am not a big fan of the Cheesecake Factory when it comes to their food , the restaurant is over rated and the food is average (that&#39;s any on I go to). The only thing I truly like about it is the Cheesecake because it&#39;s very good lol. Okay so now with this restaurant it&#39;s very clean and nice but they honestly have the waiters do everything which is why service is bad and it takes forever to try to get your waiter and ask for something or it takes forever for the food. I&#39;m no expert but in a normal restaurant, you usually have a waiter/waitress who takes your order , checks in on you &amp; maybe at least bring the drinks. But here specially this one they have them bring the food to the table, and extra other bs. You would think that your waiter/waitress is cooking your food too! with how long it takes them to come back to your table. there should be at least other servers being out the food so that they can have the time to check in with us to see if we need anything else, or take our orders. especially when it&#39;s busy they shouldn&#39;t have to do all the work. Our waitress literally bring us the food &amp; drinks , served us , &amp; had to seat other people. this is not how a business should be ran. overall , the food was okay I had wings which were average and as an appetizer we had chicken quesadillas which were pretty good.

Oh dear. Let me begin by saying that the cheesecake itself (which is all we came in for BTW) was delicious. Service however, definitely left a lot to be desired. And thats not by any means saying that it was very bad but it was a very quiet Monday night and there seemed to be ample enough staff on shift but our server was nowhere to be found for most of our time there and she still forgot to bring out one of our orders of cheesecake despite us not really ordering much and the slow pace of the night

Had a poor experience at the restaurant in Elmhurst, NY location. Pasta was overcooked to the point in was inedible. Had to wait another 20mins+ for it to be recooked. Rest of my party was finished with their meals well before I received my new meal. Server said manager would come speak to me about my experience but never came. <br><br>Then only after leaving feedback about my experience on the website, the manager said he would help make the next experience right. Had to keep following with the manager, at least two times. But  manager didn&#39;t do what he said he was going to do. If you say you&#39;re going to make it right than do it, otherwise don&#39;t offer it. I shouldn&#39;t have to keep chasing you.<br><br>First and last time visiting this location. <br><br>Promise and Don&#39;t Deliver seems to be the motto of the management of this location.<br><br>What a horrible guest experience at Cheescake factory all around!

The Cheesecake Factory is just as great as it has always been. I came back and got the Hershey Cheesecake this time and it was dynamite. I also tried the Mac n cheese burger which was really juicy and definitely had a ton of flavor. All of the sides were perfect as well. The server was courteous and punctual so we always got the next drink right away. The location was clean and there is not a single thing I would change about the experience.

This is only my second visit to any Cheesecake Factory. I found overall the apps to be the tastiest and the entrees to be sorely disappointing and flavorless.<br>Service was friendly, but it took 2+ hours for 2 apps, 1 soup, 2 entrees and 1 dessert to come out! Yikes, who has that kind of time? And that was with us ordering everything all at once. <br>One thing that did bother me was we ordered a soup. When served the soup we were told they were missing 2 toppings of the soup.... so why would you still serve it to us? Or at least take it off the bill. It&#39;s not a loaded potato soup when there&#39;s no cheese or scallions on it. <br>The 2 small plates were great (zucchini sticks and mushrooms), but the angel hair shrimp  entree was flavorless, lots of salt had to be added. And pasta was over cooked. My chicken bellageio was okay, but a tad dry and oily. <br><br>The restaurant I thought had a strange musky/wet smell. It was darkly lit and very loud as to be expected. Great server, slow food executions and bland food.

I like that there&#39;s finally a Cheesecake Factory in NYC that is fairly easy to get to. It&#39;s in a prime location. The wait was not long to get a table and the waiters were fairly friendly. The fish tacos dish is now my favorite dish. My friend had the Mac and cheese burger and she loved it. Their dishes are not that clean and the waitress seemed to be in a hurry to get us out. The bathrooms were clean and they smelled good. Most importantly the Cheesecake was the best. I recommend everyone try the red velvet cheese once.

Just because this Cheesecake Factory restaurant is in the mall doesn&#39;t mean the quality has to go down as well. I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory in other areas and by far this is the worst one. The servers are poorly trained. Our server didn&#39;t seem enthusiastic at all and it did reflect on the tip as well. I tip all the time, more than the average customer; however our server disappeared. I had to get up from my seat and search for him. He kept telling us on a slow business weekday our drinks were backed up. Another server had to come to assist us. The teriyaki chicken was very rubbery. I am also not the person to complain about food also.  I dislike throwing food out. The chicken was cheap quality chicken. Your better off eating chicken teriyaki chicken or any other foods in the mall for only $10. I&#39;ve been to 3rd world countries and I&#39;ve had much better service along with food. We had also overheard another table that complained as well saying the service was terrible. We waited so long for our drinks and we were being rushed which didn&#39;t sit well with myself and my colleagues. We decided to visit Cheesecake thinking it would be a great experience. I didn&#39;t want nothing to do with this place after this experience. We decided to pay the food and cancel the drinks. PLEASE be warned! READ the reviews before entering this establishment. I am utterly astonished to how many people working in the restaurant the service would be so bad. Your better off visiting a regular diner where servers give their absolute best. Please look at the photo on the quality of the chicken. It&#39;s burned rather than charred. Enter at your own risk. You&#39;ve been WARNED!! Cheesecake Factory is a revolving door for workers . The employees aren&#39;t happy and it sure did show the server who &#34;attempted to serve us&#34;

Three of us stopped into Cheesecake Factory Saturday to celebrate a birthday. The wait time was normal, about 45 minutes. Once seated, we had a unusually long wait for any type of service. I would say about 15 minutes before our order was taken, and an extra 10 before we even got water. We ordered two drinks from the bar at the same time, one arrived on-time, the other arrived half way through our mains. The bread didn&#39;t make it to the table until we finished our apps and bread refill made it just as we were finishing out mains (kept being told that it was in the oven)<br><br>We started our meal with Avocado Eggrolls and Dynamite Shrimp. Both were okay, but cold and soggy. This didn&#39;t really effect the eggrolls, but the shrimp were a bit rubbery and falling apart. The presentation of both were also very depressing and nothing like it used to be.<br><br>For our main, all entrées were very tasty, however; the Miso Salmon didn&#39;t arrive until about 15 minutes after the other two plates were delivered; when the other two people were nearly finished with their meals. The excuse as to why it took so long to come out: it had to be remade because we requested the vegetable to be changed to asparagus after the order was placed (which was only 4 pieces around the side of the plate). <br><br>In addition to the entrée problem, we requested water refills. It never came, so I got up and served our table water from the station because our waiter was nowhere to be found. By the time dessert came around, we were already aggravated and ready to leave, so we decided to take it to-go.<br><br>I normally don&#39;t say anything, but leaving disappointed, with a poor taste, after spending $145 (before tip) is not something I like doing. To me, I used to love coming to Cheesecake Factory because of the fresh, high quality food, nice presentations and affordable pricing. Now it seems like many corners are trying to be cut to and the normal standard is not being met. I am sorry to say, but this, the overall service and the meal will likely sway us not to come back to this store, especially on a weekend.<br><br>P.S. Finding out that my favorite cheesecake was discontinued, Chris&#39;s Outrageous, let me down even further.

Was in with large group from work about 8 pm. 1st told 45 minutes for table of 9,  2 minutes later we were seated at a table after splitting up or party and sitting in bar. Hmmm. Waitress was good although she had a lot of tables to take care of. Food was solid but nothing exceptional. Seemed fairly clean although bathroom was bit messy and tired. Just a familiar place.

As a Californian I grew up with Cheesecake factory. I took a friend who had never been. Firstly everything was very slow. We waited nearly 1/2 an hour for bread. <br><br>We asked for a top up on bread and proceeded to wait another 40 minutes for bread and our check. Our waiter disappeared and a new waiter began serving us. The bread didn&#39;t ever come and we were just sitting unattended. <br><br>My friend let them know it was my birthday and they never came and we eventually told them to forget it. <br><br>This also definitely caused some G.I./stomach upset as well. I was too scared to eat my leftovers, I was originally so excited for. I read others experienced diarrhea. I wish I had looked at the reviews first. I didn&#39;t eat anything else that day so I&#39;m pretty sure this food was the culprit.

Went at a strange time to have a lunch/dinner.  Not sure why the service was so bad. The waitstaff decided to keep switching off. We were like uh whose our waitor or waitress?? We didnt know who to ask for our bill or water. <br><br>First off when we got served our bread they forgot a plate. I had to ask twice since I had to ask different servers. Once again wish they would&#39;ve stuck with one person. <br><br>We ordered a lunch special which was huge which I&#39;m not complaining about, but my friend ordered the combo platter which was tiny compared to my lunch special. I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and my friend ordered the Steak Diane Scampi Combo. For dessert we ordered the Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake. The food was good, but took forever for us to get our food. The portion size didnt make sense.<br><br>Not sure, I would go back since the service is so bad. It was also, strange how they decided to sit all the Asians together. Felt like we were segregated. It seems suspicious.

Very pretty place!  I only had a cheesecake &amp; coffee here, but all the plates passing by me for other customers looked very nice and the portions seem large.  The service was good too.  Unfortunately, the cheesecake itself was not very tasty--they seem to specialize in &#34;cheesecake&#34; with lots of toppings &amp; flavors and variations, but the actual cheesecake was not smooth or creamy or tangy, so come and enjoy it for what it is &amp; you&#39;ll have a good time.

The Cheesecake Factory, that&#39;s the business name, but when you try to purchase a cheesecake from them, (their main product and the original reason why they came to exist) you&#39;re up against 15 to 25 min WAIT, (if the register is not busy, otherwise you end up with a solid half hour wait!) from someone &#39;available&#39; to go (in slow motion) to retrieve God-only-knows from where they hide the cakes. <br>It&#39;s ridiculous!! <br>Millions and millions of dollars spent on its renovation, systems implementations, permits, grand opening and they forgot to place a fridge for immediate sales next to the cheesecake section?<br>Where is the CEO? The logistics director? <br>The sales manager? The store manager? <br>Where are they? Too busy counting money?

Pros: friendly service, large portions, delicious cheesecake options<br>Cons: ridiculous wait time, mediocre savory food, the number of calories posted on each cheesecake which is required by law, but certainly doesn&#39;t make me feel wonderful about eating them <br><br>At 3:30pm on a Saturday and the wait time was 1.5 hours. We expected the off-peak time would be less crowded but either everyone else thought that too or the lull between services doesn&#39;t exist at this Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Being that the nostalgia of eating at other Cheesecake Factory locations in my college years overcame my normal sane conclusion of not waiting for over an hour for a table, I decided to walk around the mall for an hour before coming back to the restaurant to wait 20 more minutes. I felt a bit bad for the staff bc it seemed there was nothing they could do to alleviate the wait time, and as wait times progressed you could see impatience creeping into the faces of customers in line, reflected in the furtive hungry glances directed toward the host station. <br><br>Once we were seated the service was friendly and responsive, our waiter greeted us with a smile, explained the menu, and answered our questions. After we received our food, he checked in on us a couple times to ask how we were doing and if we were enjoying our meals.<br><br>We ordered the jambalaya and a pasta and nibbled on the house bread before both entrees came out after about 20 minutes. The portion sizes were generous however I wasn&#39;t feeling any finesse in the flavors or technique. After dinner we didn&#39;t have much appetite for cheesecake, and for me the labels of 2000 calorie per slice left me a bit scared of a dessert I may have otherwise indulged in on a less full stomach. Because let&#39;s face it--the cheesecake here is pretty good. So at the end of the experience I left full but without a strong impression positive or negative.

I cant understand there is always a problem in this place. I saw cockroaches on my last visit and stopped going there. I came there  today feb 6 at 10 pm. Was served in dirty  plate manager said did you try rubbing it off  and explains hid dishwasher. I showed him it was dirt and he said may be from my jacket. Then he rubs the plate and says yes you were right it is dirt do you want same dish.  I got mad at this point and left hungry.
Absolutely love this place, but the best thing here is the compliment breads ! Just don&#39;t know whats the name of it!<br>Absolutely favorites

This place is a nightmare. Everything that you hope a restaurant isn&#39;t, is Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m not sure if the other locations are this bad, but the service here was horrible enough our party had to leave after we were seated. I could not imagine food tasting anything near okay with such horrid service. We definitely lost our appetite. <br><br>We waited less than 30 min for a table for 4 people on a holiday Monday night, which isn&#39;t bad...except the servers here aren&#39;t servers at all. The only thing they know how to do is walk around with an apron pretending to be busy. They don&#39;t greet, are either rude or expressionless, do not ask if they can bring you anything, avoid eye contact, etc. The people up front that hand out buzzers and walk you to your table at least acknowledge that you exist. <br><br>Our server brought us bread after 15 min... no knives, no water, just walked away ignoring us. We had one person on the way about to walk in and our server almost kicked us out for not having everyone there. Honestly wanted to avoid this location when I saw that it was rated less than 2 stars, but I wanted to give this place the benefit of the doubt. Bad idea. Will not be coming back here, ever. Going to any fast food place in the qcm food court is better than this Cheesecake Factory. We went to red lobster instead and everything was amazing as always. My advice would be to avoid Cheesecake Factory altogether and just go to Red lobster. They never disappoint. I ended up tipping our waiter there a very generous amount. I have no idea what the people here are being paid to do; you get better waiting service from a deli.<br><br>I don&#39;t think they even deserve my one star.

Yesterday I traveled from Brooklyn to Queens to give the Cheesecake Factory some much needed business. A friend of mine has been feeling low with the pandemic and figured I would pick up cheesecake to lift his spirits. I wanted the 30th anniversary cheesecake but was informed they were no longer selling it. I couldn&#39;t decide between the Godiva and the Chocolate Mousse and the employee at the counter convinced me to go with the lighter chocolate mousse. My friend was very happy to see a piece of cheesecake and started on it almost immediately. Unfortunately, the taste was out of balance and the texture had gone off. Perhaps sales are way down and cakes are staying around too long. A separate issue was the piece given was only a sliver of all the previous slices I have picked up in the past. What was meant as a pick--me-up for a a friend turned out to be more bad news. A disappointing trip.

As with all other Cheesecake Factories, the food is great, especially their  selection of cheesecakes, but I don&#39;t enjoy coming to this location.<br><br>The crowded mall area, the parking situation, the unfriendly staff, and extremely slow service might make you want to think twice about coming here.<br><br>Oh, forgot to mention, the constant police presence across the street and having to watch people placed under arrest right before you enter the restaurant is an added bonus.
I&#39;m a little biased, the kids enjoyed the place hence the 4 stars, for grownups dessert can be a treat but it&#39;s guilty dining, will be back for the fudge sundae

I for the longest time believed that this restaurant was only for cheesecake! <br><br>The ambiance and the decor is pretty upscale and pretty well done. <br><br> They not only have some great itens for lunch and dinner but they also have a skinny menu for those who are watching their calorie intake. <br><br>The regular menu and the skinny menu have the calories listed next to all items and that made me really happy as i can be aware of what i am ordering. <br><br>They also have some great drink options like mojitos with different flavors and skinny drinks as well. Just be aware of the bottles of beer as they do not serve them very cold, if you are a beer drinker that can be a bit upseting. <br><br>We had items from the skinny menu, i had a flat bread and a salad, the flat bread was amazing and only 280 calories. As the salad was a little more caloric 400 cal but it was great and it had some oriental inspired dressing that made the dish that more special. <br><br>We went all the way on the skinny mojitos and they were great! I had a couple cause i couldnt stope as they were so yummy.<br><br>For dessert we had to have one of the cheesecakes, we shared the banana cheesecake and 3 ppl could share one slice with no problems, so if you have a couple of good friends sharing is not a bad idea it is plenty for everyone. <br><br>The prices can be sneaky so be aware of the prices if you are on a budget. <br><br>I will definetly come back here for more cheesecakes and yummy skinny food. They portions are pretty fair for the price, the cheesecake options are endless, just be careful with the drinks as their prices can jack up the bill.
We like the cheese cake .However,Service is really sucks.<br>Almost 20minuts waited for get our cake.

I been to Cheesecake Factory a couple of times and I never had a complain. The usual like , long waits and stuff but today was a different story . We  waited 20 mins for a table , we got a seat near the windows which was fine since the day is warm . Our server name was Cheyenne .  At first she was quick and attentive but when we were finished with our entree , she quickly said &#34; CHECK&#34;. My husband just looked at my like wtf did she just say , she didn&#39;t even asks us if we wanted desert . For me , going to the Cheesecake Factory is to get a cheesecake ! Second , when we ordered our deserts I order a cappuccino as well , I asked for sugar and I never got my sugar . She would pass by and just ignore the fact that I asked for sugar . Meanwhile , two tables forward from us asked for specific sugar ; Splenda and she quickly gave them sugar ! I told my husband , where is my sugar though ?! We asked for the  check and a few moments later she was like &#34;are you guys done?&#34; I was like what is her problem , she sees my husband just taking out his Wallet and she just asks us that question .. very unacceptable! <br><br>I wish I can give more stars like my old review but I&#39;m so upset for this past experience . The one star is specifically only for the food and the cheesecakes of course! <br><br>Hope this is seen my a manager or something , they&#39;re customer service needs a lot of improvement.

If your looking for a good quality service and good quality food with big serving and affordable. This is the best place for you. Great atmosphere and amazing variety of delicious food!!! If you have never been here then you should definitely try it out!!

If was our first time of visiting Cheesecake factory, but I liked it! Great choice of american food, burgers, pizza, pasta and of course cheesecakes (my love :)), maybe around 20 types of all tastes. Prices are nice and atmosphere is very beautiful. The only thing is that it was very crowded and it took some time to serve us, but I do understand it because it was saturday 6 pm. The host tell us it would take 30 min to wait, but we waited only 10-15 min. Definitely recommend, especially not at busy hours.

This Cheesecake Factory is really good. The service is better at other locations but usually evening in nyc is not as good service as outside the city. The food was not up to par with other locations as well but not bad. The bacon bacon burger is great and the crab bites are perfect! Can&#39;t ever finish eating everything and always take some home. Don&#39;t understand how people get desert after such a huge meal but then again, welcome to America!

The restaurant provided the reliable good service and food expected of the CCF. <br>Staff were welcoming and very attentive. The food was delicious and well worth a visit. <br>The place was very well priced.<br> We came here first time on my friend birthday and today we came again THANK YOU so much CHEESECAKE FACTORY

I&#39;ve always come here as a party of 2 or 3. Never had a rude server, in fact, all of them have been very sweet and nice. The food is good every time especially our fave Thai lettuce wraps. Drinks are good. My bf and I love to eat here. Thank you!

I remember the hype of this place when they just open and Good thing its not like that anymore or else I wont have interest to try it. I&#39;ved been to their new jersey branch and its always spacious and kid friendly. I came here with my baby and my husband for lunch. For appetizer we got the avocado roll, on the picture it looks like its just a regular size roll but wait till you see it. Its huge! 6 pieces for 2 people is actually to much. 3 to 4 people can share this because its very filling so be careful if you&#39;re still ordering main dish. It taste good too, taste like guacamole in a roll but the avocado is not mush. For main dish I got the bistro shrimp pasta and it has mushroom, battered shrimp, tomato, arugula tossed with sphagettini and a basil garlic lemon. Everything that I want is in one plate. Yum! Its different, it taste a little sour and its creamy. The shrimp is tasty and buttery. Very good and I highly recommend. For my husband he got the cheeseburger with bacon. When you go to this places don&#39;t order burger. They have a lot of food in their menu and its just him. He regret after though. Lol. He didnt regret about the taste of the burger but he regret because he order the most basic food. Service is great! Very attentive and fast.

This popular chain restaurant is the epitome of calorie bomb meal. In small print the suggested daily calorie is 2,000. Service is always reliable and décor is well you seen one you seen all the others. Usually friendly staff. Everyone loves the unlimited Brown bread and portions are the size of Texas. What&#39;s not to like? There is a diverse menu selection for everyone one. I mean if you can&#39;t find something on the menu you have a problem and you shouldn&#39;t be going out to eat. The quality of the food coming out of the kitchen is always good. <br><br>My favorite thing on the menu other than the cheesecake are the Thai lettuce wraps. It is actually an &#39;appetizer&#39; but as anything at CCF the portions more than enough to be a standalone meal. There are plenty of veggies to wrap the grilled chicken in with three types of dipping sauce and sides. I&#39;d say it is probably one of the healthier options on the menu. This also allows me to indulge with a cheesecake (shared of course).

Love me sum cheeses cake factory and I dnt like cheese cake too funny but their food is fresh and good my server was the best his name was earnest he made the drinks just right and he was very kind and respectful he had a young spanish lady with her head shaved didnt get her name byt she was wrkin with him she  was wrking her ass off ..this plce is very cozy a little loud I had the steak diane and scampi it was very good I felt it needed a little more seasoning though but still good the appetizers were the best I had crab balls and hamburger rolls all I cld say omg

Came here tonight for a celebration dinner. Upon walking in the place looked huge and well done, but the seating(booth) and broken tables became a dead give away that this Cheesecake Factory will be a disappointment.<br><br>We were quickly seated by one of the nicest waiter who quickly bought some water and bread for us. After spending 5-10mins browsing through the menu, we decided on:<br>1. Beetroot goat cheese salad<br>2. Guacamole and chips <br>3. Factory meatloaf <br>4. Seared ani tuna<br><br>Pros: <br>Beetroot and goat cheese salad was amazing <br><br>Cons: <br>1. Old chips, guacamole was poorly seasoned <br>2. Meatloaf had sauce that tasted super artificial and was extremely sweet<br>3. Ani tuna was a complete scam! I got served 5 pieces of see through tuna placed on top of 2 cups of brown rice for $21!! If your out of tuna then do not say you have it. Those 5 pieces added together equals to one slice of tuna sashimi <br><br>Overall this place did not meet my expectations at all. The one in Long Island is much better, great service, and properly prepared food!

Had a great lunch with my friend on a Tuesday afternoon! <br><br>Went on a Tuesday afternoon around 1pm. No wait, we were seated right away. <br><br>Bread basket came out fresh and hot. Everyone loves Cheesecake Factory bread! <br><br>Drinks came out cold and quick! Beer and mixed drink were both the perfect temperature! Nice and cold. <br><br>I ordered the skinnylicious turkey avocado sandwich! It was so good!!! Bacon was nice, thick and crispy! Turkey was flavorful. Avocado and tomato were fresh and delicious. <br><br>My friend ordered the pizza and salad lunch combo. No complaints from him.
