He devoured both. <br><br>For dessert I got a bowl of strawberries and he had a caramel cheesecake. No complaints here. Both were very yummy! <br><br>Our server, Jessica, was amazing. Very attentive, and made small talk with us. Kept coming back to our table to make sure we had everything we needed. Such a sweetheart!
I would definitely be back for happy hour and my food is delicious. Servers where very friendly and accommodating. Very clean and spacious and comfortable. I

Two weeks after our first visit, we are back for their Brunch menu which is only serve on Sunday between 10AM-2PM. So we strategized and planned our brunch like a military mission!<br>The four of us met before 10:30AM and got in quickly to avoid the possible crowds.<br>Wait time- none! <br>Everything went like clock work except for the parking which was just a 15 minute sacrificed by the driver.<br>There are 11 brunch selections with one kids brunch dish of French toast, bacon and strawberry. I tried the:<br>+Bruleed French Toast- delicious warm crispy bruleed French Toast is almost perfect; a couple of pieces of fruit on the side of the dish would have been ideal. Rate 4/5<br><br>+Fried Chicken &amp; waffles Benedict- fried chicken is very good. Waffles are crispy but egg was just over cooked; yolk was not runny but good. Rate 4/5<br><br>Brunch here is definitely a great treat at Cheesecake Factory. <br>The service is great; no rushing us out like other brunch places I have been in Astoria, LIC and Williamsburg. These other places have great brunch too but the seating are elbow to elbow cramp with uncomfortable chairs and tables, Service is by part-time waiters and we are rushed and over the top loud music; not a pleasant experience.<br>Families are better at the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Note: if you came after 12 noon expect long wait time!<br>Pay parking at the Target/Best Buy Mall is recommended to avoid the crowded streets this section of Queens Center.

While I always enjoy the food at The Cheesecake Factory, I don&#39;t particularly like this location. It&#39;s a restaurant attached to Queens Center Mall and while the traffic when this location first opened was ridiculous (I&#39;m talking waiting time for HOURS), the wait doesn&#39;t seem very long now. I came here to have dinner on Sunday night and was shocked at how small the place was! I mean.. it was definitely the smallest Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to. We wanted a booth so the wait was around 20 minutes, though I definitely felt like we waited longer than that. High seats were available immediately and that section was largely empty. There&#39;s a small couch outside that constitutes as a waiting area, but otherwise everyone just stands around with their little beeper waiting to be called up.<br><br>Our waitress was friendly but she wasn&#39;t very attentive. She did come to refill our waters every now and then but we mostly had to call her over. She told us an appetizer would take 4 additional minutes to come out but we waited about 15 until another waitress brought it over and apologized. People come to celebrate their birthdays often, I believe you get a complimentary slice of cheesecake when you celebrate here.. but you&#39;ll hear them singing that quite often. They weren&#39;t very cheerful about it and seemed tired/unhappy. It definitely does not make you feel very special.<br><br>I recommend the avocado eggrolls (these are amazing!!) and the crab artichoke dip. The salmon firecrackers were also pretty good. I enjoy the appetizers here a lot, and two appetizers is as filling as an entree for me! My friend got a hibachi steak and asked for it medium rare but it definitely came out well done. <br><br>Overall, the food here is pretty good and the portions are EXTREMELY HUGE making the food here relatively affordable, however when I think of the Cheesecake Factory I imagine(d) a better experience than I had here. You almost feel like you&#39;re eating at Applebees at this location, if that makes any sense.

This is my very first time in any of The Cheesecake Factory establishment. I am so happy that they open one finally inside the Queens Center Mall and convenient from the Woodhaven Subway Station. I walked into the restaurant at 10:40am and barely anyway for a table though. I told the hostess that it was a group of 4 and I wanted a booth so she suggested like patio sofas. <br><br>One of my friends showed up and the other hostess seated us in an area next to the main dining which seems quieter. I guess it was the adult area with less screaming kids and crying babies lol I do love some cushion under my tushy =) I had the servers pulled down the blinds because it was way to sunny and going to ruin our #foodporn pictures <br><br>Two of my friends has been here for the Grand Opening so they picked a great spot for Sunday Funday Brunch today! My other friend has been to another location establishment as well so they definitely popped my Cheesecake Factory cherry hahahaha<br><br>Our server Alisha B has a great personality, very attentive and provided excellent service! She brought out these yummy freshly baked wheat bread with oats and butter spread. I do love bread and I should&#39;ve stop myself because I did get a bit full on it before my food came to the table. <br><br>Sunday Brunch Menu: <br>Rich: Bruleed French Toast with a side of Canadian Bacon (huge and thick slab of meat on the plate mmmmm) <br><br>Sally + Jane + me: Fried Chicken &amp; Waffles Benedict was a popular dish at our table hehe mmm hubba hubba in my tummy...the benedicts had a nice flow but I wish it was a streaming of yoke onto my crispy fried chicken strips though. Pour some sugar on me oops I meant some maple syrup over my fried chicken strips and those crispy waffles. I hardly ate my potatoes but took it home in a doggy bag =) <br><br>Sadly I didn&#39;t have any room for dessert and really, really wanted to try the Pumpkin Cheesecake =( <br><br>Definitely will be back soon!

Cheesecake Factory is truly amazing! Like many other Queens peeps, the nearest one for me was all the way in Long Island. I have been waiting for their grand arrival to Queens Center Mall since I first read about their plans to open here. The day we have all been waiting for is here - first store in New York City is open! This store is very elegant and grand looking! I mean look at those details from the doors to the ceilings! It&#39;s beautiful! There is a take-out section, huge bar with displays of endless bottles of alcohol, a fairly big dining area, more seatings in the patio section, and the huge kitchen towards the back. <br><br>My companion and I waited a week or two after opening because we already know how popular this place will be. We slipped in around 11:00 am on Sunday - table for 2 was available immediately! Win for us! However, when we walked towards our table, almost the entire restaurant was filled. Come early!<br><br>My go-to dish here is the Shrimp with Angel Hair pasta dish. I always get it off the regular menu and you bet it is a huge portion! Angel Hair with large shrimp, garlic, lemon, herbs, and diced tomato. Although the dish I had today was a tad dry, the combination of flavors made it so delicious! <br><br>Fried Mac &amp; Cheese. Four giant balls of mac and cheese inside of a crispy deep fried layer with marinara sauce then topped with cheese. They arrived to my table piping hot! So good! A nice starter for the table.  <br><br>Oreo Extreme Dream Cheesecake. Oh yes baby, come home with me! Layers of fudge cake, oreo, and chocolate mousse. This is so heavenly delicious that you will dream about it for days to come! GET THIS! <br><br>Arnold Palmer. Lemonade and iced tea mix. Always a great drink to get! It comes with a sugar ring here! <br><br>This particular location has a bit of a wait for service and food that I can overlook for now. Be patient and bring good company, the food and cheesecake is worth it!

They can do no wrong, I love cheesecake and with all their flavor combos (tiramisu cheesecake is my favorite) how can I hate this place. Their food (beyond burger and tamales) and drinks are solid as well.

Hello this Cheesecake Factory is out of the way for me but I had to try it. It&#39;s in the queens mall and there is a huge parking lot with lots of levels. Walk in the big doors and it&#39;s a very nice looking restaurant like all of them and it&#39;s very large. We got booth seats instantly around 1:30 - 2pm. The place was clean when we went and we sat close to the cheesecake station, lol. But before cheesecake we orders Cajun shrimp pastas, crab it&#39;s were awesome and the pot stickers are tasty. Then I had the strawberry cheesecake and it was rockin. The food is pricey but they have a big selection of food to choose from and nice comfy booth seats and lighting.

The most terrible Cheesecake Factory I have ever been made me wait 2 hours to be seated when they told me 1 hour.<br>Spaghetti wasn&#39;t even cooked it was row! When I called manager and asked him will he eat that. He replied Never!

I&#39;ve never thought Cheesecake Factory would have such good food. Since we missed lunch special at Applebee&#39;s, which was a good sign, we found CF that offers lunch special until 5, plus the happy hour starts at 4!<br><br>Our server, Domanic S (sp?) was very attentive. We ordered Renee&#39;s Special and Salmon with Thai curry sauce. Both dishes came in big portion and were good, surprisingly! We wrapped up our lunch with Long Island Iced Tea Happy which cost only $6, and, man, it was strong!<br><br>I will definitely come back to try their other lunch specials. Anyway, their beer selection was just alright. ;-(

This rating is just for the Chinese Chicken Salad and White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut Cheesecake, and great service at the take-out counter (10/8/2019 about 7:15 pm). The cashier was pleasant, and actually checked the order for accuracy. Can&#39;t ask for anything more than that.

I know I know, a chain restaurant but I haven&#39;t been to a CF in probably a decade and they&#39;ve stepped it up! Everything we got was tasty (and a total calorie bomb) but every once in a while can&#39;t kill me.. right??<br><br>M got the steak Diane and it was great, nicely cooked and the sides were quite complementary. I got fish tacos and I just wanted more of the slaw. The rice was a little dry. Their brown bread though.. I would trek all the way to CF weekly just to get a loaf or two of the deliciousness!<br><br>Our server (Brian S) was a delight. Honestly helpful and he didn&#39;t bug us every 5 seconds. The hostess was rude, however, and I heard her berating a family of 4 because they didn&#39;t mention they had a baby so it would make it 5. I understand how places get busy and hectic but she could have definitely handled it better.

Stopped by before doing a little shopping in the mall, place was empty &amp; quiet on a Tuesday afternoon, my girlfriend had the chicken salad &amp; ordered some hot tea as well. The waitress brought out a wooden box of assorted teas for my friend to choose from ! What a delightful surprise. I had the crab cake balls &amp; feta, seared pear, arugula flatbread accompanied by two glasses of prosecco ! Everything was fresh and light &amp; reasonably priced , service was prompt &amp; polite

I am so disappointed with the cake I bought today... You guys are cheating your customers why are you putting a good nice cake on your cake display and the one you are giving your customers is not the exact same thing. that is CHEATING!!!! And not really nice... You were charging way too much for a piece of crap! So disappointed and very mad! I will never ever buy from your restaurant anymore never ever and I will tell my friends of my bad experience so they won&#39;t experience the same thing.<br><br>This is like an old cake not worth the money you paid for if I could put a zero star that&#39;s what I&#39;m going to do right now.... I usually put a good review for a restaurant but this time it&#39;s a different thing.<br><br>CHEATERS!!!!

I forgot to mention in the last review, the CCF is located <br>Within the Queens Center Mall, with a entrance at street level. We took the elevator from the parking garage that is in the building. Parking is cheap and convenient, $3 for 1hr, and $5 for up to 3hrs. There is several restaurants and shops in the area, and the mall. There&#39;s also a shake<br>Shack, models, and a bank across the street. This is a bustling neighborhood and very diverse. Outside of the restaurant there is a huge menu, so that you can choose <br>Your favorite dish even before your seated. Or just sit at the bar like we did and look over the menu and order small bites.

There really isn&#39;t a place that is always really good &amp; fresh like The Cheesecake Factory!!! Whenever we are looking for a really simple dinner that has a lot of great menu options, we come here and it is always yummy. The only reason that I didn&#39;t give it 5 stars was because of the wait. It wasn&#39;t anyone&#39;s fault but it definitely made my daughter a little antsy &amp; my husband had to take her to the car. Our food &amp; service was so on point!!!! It was a fun and relaxing family night!

I&#39;m not the type to go to a restaurant during its opening week. Everything is hectic and crazy. All that can be avoided by going a month or two later. Being my sister works there, me and a friend decided to stop by. In a sentence I can say, it was crazy. <br><br>We came in an 5 pm on Friday and was told that a table would be free in an hour and that we should come back. After the hour we come back and we&#39;re given a pager. When it vibrates that means a table is ready. We waited over an hour and half! We finally get a table and it was so hectic. The servers were all over the place. My friend got the wrong dish and had to wait over 45 mins to get her correct dish. Apparently that qualifies for a discounted price or a free dish?????? I always try not to give the wait staff a hard time but with all the waiting we did and to have the wrong dish served to us I guess I should have asked for something. <br><br>The food.......well I guess you can&#39;t have really high standards for chain restaurants. I paid $11 for 5 dumplings. That is outrageous anywhere. But of we hadn&#39;t ordered the appetizer we would have been sitting there without any food for an hour. At one point one of the 10 waiters I had asked if I wanted bread? Yes after 30 mins of nothing we&#39;d like some bread. The pasta wasn&#39;t spicy. Creamy and mild. I guess the food is catered to American tastes. <br><br>The CHEESECAKE. That was definitely the highlight and worth every bit of the hype it gets. It was so creamy and decadent. Everyone should experience the Cheesecake that is offered here.<br><br>Overall I&#39;d say wait till the hype dies down a bit. Everyone is frazzled and crazy. Also those prices are crazy. Lunch special ends at 5 pm. And the prices are half! If you can, come before 5. You&#39;d definitely save some money and hopefully avoid the crazy crowd.

The food was good. The cheesecake its the best! The only thing its that the location, if you park inside the mall you have to pay (and the waitting time at the restauran could be long) and its a lil hard to find parking at the street.

My previous review of the Queens Center Mall Cheesecake Factory was very lackluster and it&#39;s been some time since I&#39;ve returned. So I&#39;ve decided to give it another shot. <br><br>Well first off there was absolutely no wait on a weekday the last time I went was on a weekend and the wait time was outrageous so maybe a weekday is the way to go. Our waiter Ramon was tending to a lot of tables and was still pretty on the ball with service. Kudos Ramon! <br><br>Although they were out of the loaded tots that we originally wanted as an appetizer we decided to go with simplicity on some Caesar salads which had a very surprisingly tart dressing which was quite good. <br><br>As for entrees my girlfriend went with the skinny luscious chicken pen which surprisingly was very flavorful and vibrant for a calorie friendly dish. As for my self I went with the New York strip mash potatoes and green beans the steak was well cooked nice medium and very juicy and flavorful the mash potatoes I would&#39;ve licked off the plate mixed with the veggies and juice from the steak.  As for the dessert we had a sweet and delicious Dulce de Leche cheesecake al a mode from there extensive Cheesecake menu well it is the Cheesecake Factory. The Cheesecake Factory changed my mind and I will return once again with a  better experience under my belt.

I ordered the Thai lettuce wraps with chicken. After eating one i noticed that the lettuce wasn&#39;t washed and proceed to pick through the lettuce to notice clumps of dirt. Highly unacceptable. I understand that restaurant have been forced to rush through orders but washing lettuce is minimal. On top of Corona no one want to have to deal with E-coli and other infections related to unwashed fruits and vegetables!

Came here for dinner and I was not pleased at all. I am a big fan of The Cheesecake Factory, however after visiting this location I no longer will be a regular. I ordered a martini and instead they made a bellini. I sent it back and the bartender said that was a martini....when it obviously was not. Secondly, I ordered tacos which never came until I asked someone an hour later about it. The tacos were cold and I did not eat it. The service was horrible and I will not be returning.

Time to update my review for Cheesecake Factory. I always said when I die sprinkle my ashes over Cheesecake Factory. I changed my mind. I decided on a Green Burial instead. I&#39;m digressing! <br><br>First: Going to Sunday Brunch was on our bucket list for years. I&#39;m certainly glad they decided to offer it on Saturday too. Not that a weekend trip either day to this mall is enjoyable. The train ride is always over an hour these days. That being said, my daughter is happy she can have the brunch menu at Lunchtime. I&#39;ll stick with the lunch menu. Brunch is 10-2 Saturday and Sunday now. <br><br>Second: Service has greatly improved. We were greeted at the reception by a lovely young lady with a beautiful smile on her face. After quickly being escorted to our table, within minutes our server was at our ready. She also was lovely and smiling in addition to friendly. I finally felt welcome and at home at this location like I had at other locations! I think they finally got the CCF vibe down on their customer service!<br><br>Third: Food preparation was timely. The food came out hot and portions are huge as always. I am always on the hunt for a decent pancake. Forget CCF on that one. I really wolfed them down. Some bites were light and fluffy while others were thick and heavy. I didn&#39;t know it was poor blending of the Ricotta into the batter until my Yelp Friend told me. Oh well. I&#39;m not lowering my stars this review because I was the one that made poor food and drink choices this visit!  I&#39;ll know better next time! My daughter was really pleased with her meal. Naturally she had enough to take half home. She has self control that I lack!! She had Chicken and Waffles. She said the Chicken and the Waffles has a very nice taste. The potatoes were just the way she likes them. Drinks rated poor on my daughter&#39;s side. She didn&#39;t like her ice tea. She said it was weak. I made another poor choice. I had a Strawberry Smoothie. I thought I had gotten it before. I may have had a Strawberry Frozen Daiquiri without liquor. This smoothie was more like having desert. Very filling. I couldn&#39;t get cheesecake after that. I wasn&#39;t in the mood to take it home. Maybe if my daughter had split her piece. Fat chance! <br><br>Finally: They do have good perks some times. We had a coupon from our last visit good for a free piece of cheesecake when you spend $30. My daughter wanted to try what I had last visit. She got Coffee and Cream Chocolate Supreme to go. With her will power she&#39;ll eat it a little every day all week. I need to learn to be that good! <br>Conclusion and recommendations: They are getting their act together at this CCF location. The food preparation is still hit or miss. I&#39;ve missed out two out of three meals so far. Remember my burnt Cuban Sandwich? I&#39;m going to keep going. Maybe no more frequently than once a month. Preferably on a weekday for lunch! <br>If you&#39;re as big a fan of their cheesecake as I am, you will enjoy. I&#39;m really there for the cheesecake! <br>And a word of warning: Don&#39;t look at the calories on the different cheesecake flavors. Forget any of the regular menu items calories too for that matter! I may stick with the Skinnylicious Menu now.

First time coming to this Cheesecake Factory. We came for lunch and were given a beeper with a 30 minute wait. Luckily for us it started buzzing within 10 minutes. After we were seated our server didn&#39;t come to our table for a good ten minutes. This was the only negative for me. <br>After he came and we put in our order the food came out pretty fast. Service was decent. We had crab cakes, avocado egg rolls, cheese pizza, salmon, and black pepper shrimp. Everything was good. Dessert was the strawberry shortcake with vanilla ice cream. Omg so good. My favorite dessert here.<br><br>This place does look smaller than most of the other CF&#39;s we have in NY.

I&#39;ve been here several times with my boyfriend. We always enjoy it. The menu is literally 18 pages long with tons of options. My go to is the herb crusted salmon, it&#39;s one of my favorites. I also love the burgers, they have like 15 different variations. As for the service, it could be better.

Just had a feeling of eating something disgusting, and getting all my calories for the day in one meal so came to the cheesecake factory. We had to wait an hour, but we just wandered around the mall for a bit before coming back. <br><br>Pretty standard cheesecake factory fare here. The bread was warm and amazing. Beers are ~$7 here. We got the spinach and crab dip, and it was delicious. I ended up getting the truffle honey fried chicken. Very moist and had a great flavor. <br><br>The thing that separates this from the other cheesecake factories is the service. I came here twice and both times I was greeted with exceptional kindness. Our drinks were never empty, and we were always checked up on.

Love the place , great food ....but they should have a policy on guests playing music or talking loudly on their phone or to each other in their table.  Besides the loud talking and singing , one can&#39;t have a nice quiet dinner.

The service here is good, but the food is terrible; We ordered Herb crusted Salmon and a chicken sandwich and both things were disgusting. The chicken was cold and squishy and the salmon was kinda burnt, we hated it. The silverware was dirty and the drinks were full of sugar. The bathrooms are dirty and there&#39;s always overflowing toilet paper in the garbage bins. WILL NOT BE COMING BACK!

This is my second visit to this location and we had an enjoyable dinner. Our wait was only 15 minutes for a table to 2, the day before Christmas eve-very surprising. Our waitress was attentive and our food arrived in a timely manner. I order the chicken enchiladas which tasted good, while my fiance order the Jamaican shrimp which also tasted good. Unfortunately we couldn&#39;t order any calamari being they were out. Overall it was a good experience.

This place opened last year near me. Decided to finally try this place since I had never been to one. The menu is very large and is basically a mix of American, Mexican and Asian inspired dishes - stuff like grilled steak tacos, thai coconut-lime chicken, and eggplant parmesan. All in all, it is not much different in variety or quality than you would find in other big chains like Applebee&#39;s or Friendly&#39;s. The two big positives I would give Cheesecake is that they have a much nicer atmosphere. They are super clean, have super high ceilings and spacious seating with booths. The portions of the food are very large as well too.
The company is good but the food was salty and just warm. Disappointed. The cheesecake was ok but took too long.
Food was very good! The problem is the service. They kept messing up our orders and they kept bringing out food that we already said we didn&#39;t want. Service can be improved on a lot!

Just left after a horrible experience. The manager on duty was was a young female.....completely rude and useless. In a empty restaurant It took 24 minutes for lettuce wraps fries and a quesadilla....and 15 minutes for a glass of wine. And the men&#39;s bathroom had no soap....how exactly are employees keeping their hands clean....<br>Regular customer here and very disappointed.<br>***tried Cheesecake Factory again on August 22 at 9pm. Sad to say it was another horrific experience. Tried to order taquitos and they were out. We ordered nachos, beet salad and tacos. There are MAJOR PROBLEMS WITH THEIR KITCHEN! We waited 35 minutes for our food and then when it came I got served first and then my partner was told that they were out of beans. They offered a salad but he wanted rice and beans. They are still the same mess that they were last month.***

Birthday celebration dinner for someone special at the Cheesecake Factory in Elmhurst. Our first time trying the restaurant.<br><br>Be warn they don&#39;t take reservations so if you have a large party over 6 ppl prepare to wait <br><br>Got there and put my name down and was told it&#39;s an 2 hour wait.  I was like did I hear wrong did you just say 2 hrs. Yep someone ahead of me also big a party. <br><br>So I am like just great I got kids who are starving. Waited for a bit an hour had passed. The kids were starting to get restless and my Brother ask if they can put us in 2 separate table instead at this point in desperation. <br><br>So they had booth that can fit 6 ppl each but unfortunately it wasn&#39;t back to back. Another party was in between us. Oh well we took it otherwise it will be another hour wait. <br><br>We had to get up back and forth during the night just to talk. <br><br>Could have gone to Longhorn or Olive Garden which was only a 30-40 mins wait. But the special person really wanted to try this restaurant out. <br><br>The food overall was pretty good. I didn&#39;t like how the cocktail menu had no price listed. <br><br>The hostess could be more bit accommodating and suggest to us if we prefer to wait or can try to seat us separately. Instead we as patrons had to ask due to the long long wait time.

It is always the best food made by Cheesecake Factory , and today I discover another delicious dish &#34; Tuscan Chicken&#34; , and thanks to the very nice waiter girl Jocelynn P. for her recommendation!

Love the food here but the service is so consistently awful that I&#39;ve resorted to only doing take out orders. Came today and ordered a jar of balsamic salad dressing to go, waited right in front of the cashiers face for 20 minutes at which point I ask if she can check on my dressing (2nd time asking, first time was told an employee was already in the back bottling it up), she proceeds to ask the girl next to her who apparently had completely forgotten about it. To sum up: food is good here but you&#39;re not gonna get around the poor service no matter what you do. If you can&#39;t handle poor service don&#39;t bother coming here.

This place has had better days. The fact that it was somewhat empty on a Saturday states the facts as well.  Service was spotty at best,  and if they ever lived up to good service it still wouldn&#39;t be as good as it once was.  They didn&#39;t listen to our requests to make the food a certain way and that made me quite upset.  At this point this chain I would have to say is barely fair to okay on food.  Decor is still unchanged from The first they opened there locations.  Maybe it&#39;s time for a new and smaller menu and to concentrate on some the food and cut some of the fat from the 10 page menu they still have.  I&#39;m still a little Ill from lunch.  Maybe it&#39;s time<br>For a New direction for CF,  but i promise this chain restaurant is dead to me forever.  Good riddance to bad rubbish.

Went for brunch on Saturday... very disappointed, breakfast burrito was cold , lemon ricotta pancakes were over done and they used thawed out frozen strawberries (barf) That is the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to. We had to ask for several bundles of silverware because they were all dirty. The servers were very friendly and attentive but the food and cleanliness need to be much better.

Pretty friendly staff. Wait times are predicted once you enter the restaurant, and you choose if you want to stay or go. Service was too fast, and the busboy brought our main course when I had just received my app, and he had to take it back. Waiter was kind enough to have chef make a new one...(or so he said!). Anyways. Prices are decent, and portions are huge. <br><br>They have a pretty decent HH as well, so if in the area and in the mood for some unhealthy apps and drinks, def pass by!

Today was my first and probably last time at eating here. Even after a few hours, I still feel disgusted and I believe that this is probably the worst place I&#39;ve eaten at. <br>I ordered the Lasagna Verde (first picture) and all throughout the lasagna, there were pieces of paper/plastic in each layer of the lasagna (you can see this in the second picture). I took a few bites and then I told and showed the waitress about the paper and she told me that it was part of the spinach pasta. Even though she told me that, I was sure that it wasn&#39;t part of the lasagna because it was very hard to chew on. After another few bites, I started to feel disgusted and I decided to take out those pieces of paper, which are showed in the second picture. I believe the only &#34;good&#34; part of this experience was that the manager came to apologize before paying the bills and didn&#39;t charge us for the lasagna. She also told us that the plastic that was between the layers is usually used to separate the spinach layers and that it shouldn&#39;t have been there in the first place. However, I&#39;m still disappointed that even though I told the waitress after taking the first bites, she didn&#39;t return or change the lasagna. She talked to the the manager only after I finished eating this lasagna. I really hope no one else goes through this same experience.

Placed an online order and showed up when it was supposed to be ready. It was a Monday night so the restaurant wasn&#39;t busy by any means. There was no one manning the counter, they couldn&#39;t find my order, and when someone finally went back to check on it, it somehow still wasn&#39;t done.<br><br>After waiting for another 30 minutes I finally received my takeout order which was cold while the nachos were congealed. You&#39;d think if I was waiting for an order to be finished it would at least be hot, right? Wrong.<br><br>I would not recommend that anyone go to this location.

Went my date a date a few days ago. The food was great and price was good. The waitress that we had was really nice and helpful. It was rush; even though it was Wednesday when we went, thinking it would be less crowded. Don&#39;t really got much to say because both of us were so hungry, that we didn&#39;t care for anything else. We couldn&#39;t even finish our meal that we had to pack our food up though. But it was good overall, it was my third going to &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34;, but my second time coming to this particular location.  Only down side was that i had to pay for parking as well, besides that had a great experience there.

I was extremely disappointed with the service there. Very, very slow, the waiter was never around, only brought the water and the bread after 30 minutes, and the restaurant didn&#39;t have half of the dishes we ordered - they only realized that 20 minutes after we ordered something, and then the waiter would come back and ask us to choose another thing. They didn&#39;t even have the cheesecake!!!!!<br><br>If you want to have a decent dinner, with peace, good service and food, you&#39;d better choose another place.

Me and my boyfriend usually go to cheesecake factory at the Palisades center mall in West Nyack New York. We decided to try out the one in Queens center mall again after a very long time today and were extremely disappointed. The service was very good but the food itself did not taste the same or as good as it does at the other locations. We ordered an appetizer of buffalo blasts and they were soggy and not crispy at all, we told our server but he didn&#39;t really give us any options and we didn&#39;t want to tell them to take it off the bill or to take it back. <br><br>The entrées that we ordered were the chicken costoletta and the herb crusted salmon, th asparagus that we both got on the side were not boiled properly and the mashed potatoes did not seem fresh. The chicken itself in my dish was supposed be crispy as opposed to soggy and the breading was just falling off. I really am not sure what went wrong but the food was definitely not the same and I will not be returning to this location this is the second time that I have had a problem here meanwhile the first time it was our service instead of the food really. Was not expecting to be so disappointed.

The staffs are extremely rude !!!! We waited for more than 90 minutes for a table of 7, when they told us it&#39;s a 30 minutes wait. When we asked how much long the host reply is &#34; you guys gotta wait !&#34; We asked for a high chair and they did not bring it until the third time we politely asked. A party of 2 came way after us, and when both of our buzzer rang the same time they seated them first. The host was extremely rude again and said &#34;mam we are going to serve them first and you gotta wait&#34;. Personally I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factory and this is the worst experience I&#39;ve had. I will never return to this specific location due to their poor service.

I have been eating the Miso salmon from the Cheesecake Factory for over 20 years. It is my go-to meal when I need something quick and don&#39;t want to cook at home. I&#39;m not sure what this is that they gave me but the salmon was burnt, and the brown sauce which is normally a dark sauce with a glaze texture was watery and the color of gravy. I can&#39;t describe how awful the taste was, the only thing I can say is it tasted like it had been fermenting for weeks. I was going to leave a negative review the last time I came here, but decided to let it slide. I ordered extra sauce and they gave me less than half an ounce of sauce. The sauce was on the side and the food was completely dry! The amount of sauce they gave me was barely enough to drizzle on my salmon.... rice was dry. Unreal that you guys charge these prices and have such awful service!

Went here August 2,2017 with my cousin,we went in as soon as they opened I had a cheeseburger and fries,it was the best burger I ever had and the drink was nice and strong we went to the bartender to ask her when is her hours so we know when the right time to come for drinks,she made them perfect,she let us know,she&#39;s not usually there that early,so we lucked out...happy about that,the place is nice and clean and beautiful decor,I would definitely go back,the waitress was alright

DO NOT go to this cheesecake factory. This is the WORST one I&#39;ve ever been to. Just my luck and what I get for being lazy &amp; settling for the closest place to eat.  But since I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake factories, I didn&#39;t think it would be bad. Where do I start??<br><br>We ordered Hibachi hangar steak with onions &amp; shiitake mushrooms,  with wasabi mashed potatoes, &amp; tempura asparagus, and Carbonara pasta. I&#39;m so glad we passed on apps and just stuck with the bread.  The only positive was the fact that they did give two mini loaves of the brown bread that I do like. <br><br>First of all we asked for water she brought the water out and didn&#39;t even provide straws. I looked over at other tables and noticed they didn&#39;t have any straws either. So we didn&#39;t bother asking for any.  But I&#39;m a little OCD and I don&#39;t usually like putting my mouth on the glasses. Ok fine I dealt with it.  But we drank our water, and after she took our order we weren&#39;t able to flag her down for more water.  It wasn&#39;t crowded in there, waitresses need to be a little more attentive- like look over and see if the glasses need refilling.<br><br>Moving on from the water situation- our food took forever to come out &amp; I get the fact that it&#39;s steak and needs to cook to order, however, if that&#39;s the case then when it comes out it should be piping hot,  no? OH my freaking goodness! It was cold and my steak was purple!!! I asked for it medium. I specifically told her I want it pink inside. The mushrooms and onions were a joke.  I had a huge piece of onion skin in my dish. The mashed potatoes were cold, with huge chunks of grey potatoes, so cold that the butter they put on top would barely melt &amp; wasabi??? What wasabi?? There wasn&#39;t even a hint.  My asparagus was cut into little pieces.  On to the carbonara, it was super watery.. &amp; I know that when you make pasta you usually have to put it into a sautee pan with some pasta water and sauce to coat the pasta well.  Obviously they added too much pasta water in the process.<br><br>Now on to the service. The black girl with the platinum blonde shoulder length curly hair was the waitress who started us out (sorry not to offend anyone, I just forgot her name and if someone from the restaurant reads this I want them to know who she is) she practically dropped the plates of food down onto the table, she never checked on us except right when she walked away after &#34;dropping&#34; our plates off literally 3 seconds later.  She didn&#39;t refill water, nothing!!  We then were told by another girl while talking over her back that she was going to be taking over. We never saw her again. Again, it wasn&#39;t that crowded. We had to flag down blonde girl to ask for water and then after another long while flag her down again to ask for the check because the other girl who was supposedly taking over never came to us. Finally blonde girl brings the bag and container and practically dropped it into the carbonara. We then flagged down second girl to take the credit card. I was so disgusted. I&#39;ll never step foot in that place again. I always get cheesecake to take home. I didn&#39;t even do that.  But then again none of the waitresses even asked if we wanted to order desserts.
Great time! The servers are usually nice, the food is made well and comes out pretty fast. It&#39;s super loud all of the time though. Sometimes the amount of screaming kids gets annoying though.

I live in the area, &amp; was very excited to have TCF open their 1st Queens restaurant close by. I&#39;ve been a couple of times, but the experience was not the same as when i first went to TCF. I remember huge portions, &amp; ordering cheesecake, b/c, well, you were @ TCF. Now, i notice that it&#39;s the plate that is huge, &amp; not so much the portions; &amp;, the cheesecake, both times was very small. I had seen another customer w/ a bigger slice, &amp; wondered. <br>I&#39;m still glad it&#39;s in the area, but haven&#39;t made another trip back.

The wait time was approx 45 min and still I had a very pleasant experience. My waitress was very attentive and kind. The food was good. It&#39;s a franchised restaurant, nothing spectacular and unique about it. I wouldn&#39;t do this spot for a first date. Its more like &#34;we been together for a while and I want to go out and eat&#34; spot. It is great for a teenage date or dinner with your friends. I had a great time . Parking is available for a small price. Browse the mall while you wait.

Went to buy 4 cheesecakes to go. The service is nice the cheesecakes are great  no complains at all the staffs are great. The only thing that I didn&#39;t like was the way the cheesecakes was pack one of my order got the the icing all over. But still I&#39;m giving this place  a five star. That&#39;s the only thing tho just be careful of the way you pack it. Over all still the best place for cheesecakes.

I&#39;ll start by saying the staff was fine. The woman at the desk who took our name and gave us our vibrator thingy was efficient and cordial. But the system for seating people is cluttered and inefficient. She took our pager and told us to wait around the other side of the huge column, which is a convergence of people coming to the door to leave and had us feeling like we were in the way.<br><br>It&#39;s far too loud. My husband and I could not talk without shouting. We&#39;re getting old. We don&#39;t like to shout at one another to have a simple conversation. It&#39;s also way too dim. I almost couldn&#39;t read the menu, which seriously needs to be edited. Cut out 150 items and do the other 100 well.<br><br>Our waiter, while service was slow, was polite and answered my questions about the Blood Orange Martini. The drink was between $12 and $14...but you only got the drink in the glass. You are not served the shaker with another drink and a half, like you get at Applebee&#39;s for about the same price. So I laughed and did not get anything more than a soda.<br><br> But we never got water. Do they not bring it automatically? Were we supposed to ask for it?<br><br>We decided to try the truffle bacon cheese sticks. Basically, it&#39;s a grilled cheese with bacon that is cut into four strips. I couldn&#39;t tell you what the cheese was because it had no flavor. The bacon was the only part of it that did have flavor, though it was toasted nicely. The tomato dipping sauce tasted like straight tomato paste. Not even cooked tomato paste. And it was unseasoned. Tasted like it came directly out of the can with nothing done to it. Some restaurants don&#39;t understand that tomato paste needs to be cooked to get rid of that canned paste flavor. I had one stick out of four and a small taste of the tomato paste.<br><br>I ordered the Carne Asada Steak Medallions, &#34;Covered with Sauteed Peppers, Onions and Cilantro. Served with Creamy Ranchero Sauce, Fresh Corn and White Rice&#34; the menu says. Well, the peppers and onions need to go another four or five minutes to begin to be called sauteed. They were warmed but largely still crisp and uncooked. I also found a mushroom slice. So it&#39;s a good thing my mother wasn&#39;t with us and didn&#39;t get that plate, because she&#39;s allergic to them. That&#39;s careless prep. <br><br>My rice was dry as a bone and CRUSTY. The corn was there. It had these salty bits of what I imagine is a queso. The steak itself is underseasoned but the sauce with it had this mysterious heat to it. No real flavor to speak of. Just heat. It went away quickly with a bite of the bread that had been brought at the beginning of the meal.<br><br>There&#39;s always this quandry when you order steak at a place you&#39;ve never been before. Do I order it medium and hope they go under and I get it rare? Or will they overcook and it comes to me well and I have to send it back? Do I order it rare and maybe they go over to a medium, which I can usually deal with, or will they under and I get it blue? Well, I took the risk. I ordered rare. I got blue.I actually had to get out my phone&#39;s flashlight to see just how blue it was. I should have sent it back, but I do enjoy a well-prepared rare/very rare steak sometimes. <br><br>I&#39;m now regretting NOT sending it back, as supper has not been sitting well ever since (for either of us). From my entire entree plate, I ate the meat, a couple bites of corn, and one single bite of rice. I almost stopped at Burger King on my way home, but my stomach has been so upset I just came home and popped an antacid. I did tell the waiter about the rice when he picked up my plate. He took $4 off the entree, which I do appreciate.<br><br>My husband ordered the orange chicken. His rice was also bone dry. The vegetables on his plate were barely past warmed, not much cooked. The chicken itself was not a crisp deep fry. The sauce was not spicy, as the menu describes, and there was this odd flavor on the back end of a bite. Like grated, burnt orange peel. It wasn&#39;t very pleasant. Panda Express in the food court does a MUCH better and FAR MORE REASONABLY PRICED orange chicken. They also have much better rice.<br><br>The table next to us, who had been seated, with alcoholic beverages AND water before us, were brought their entrees after ours, btw, so I hope they weren&#39;t upset about that.<br><br>A very serious suggestion for the restaurant: Make miniature versions of your desserts and offer a &#34;Flight&#34; of 3 or 5 flavors, so that customers can have a taste of several desserts. I seriously counted 17 different desserts I wanted to try. If I could get a flight of five and my husband could get a flight of five, that&#39;s ten desserts we both could share and try.<br><br>We settled on the Lemon Meringue Cheesecake. That was seriously the best part of the meal other than the bread at the beginning. The toasted meringue on top was quite tasty. It&#39;s not a sickly sweet lemon, but a nice, tart lemon. It was terrific, and the reason our trip gets one star and not a &#34;wish I could give half a star&#34; notation.
The nachos are BOMB! Customer service is impeccable, love how they memorize our orders! When it&#39;s not packed it&#39;s very nice and a peaceful environment to eat in.

I have to say that food was ok. Exactly what you can expect from them. The service though was slow like everyone else mentioned here. And for some reason my waiter always talked to us over the top of the wall of the booth.

I came here for my birthday and was super disappointed. Normally I come for lunch special or weekend brunch and the service is ok. But this time my waiter disappeared for very long intervals, then switched with another guy, the whole process took over 2 hours. Not all of the entrees came out at once and they forgot my sisters food, when she finally got it her food was cold!! They also brought my fiance the wrong drink and charged me for a birthday cake I did not want but the waiter pushed onto us making it out like it was free. Worst experience ever. Took forever to just get the check. Spent so much money and the food was cold and nothing special. Never coming here again for a special occasion!

Conflicted ! It really depends where you go. I visited New Jersey Edison cheesecake and has always been great food and service. I visited in 3 occasion the queens center mall location and did not receive the same service not food for that matter. Or maybe it was the service that makes the food less enjoyable. It&#39;s hard to give a review about this because it really matters on location. So just try the ones in your area and decide.

I always love cheesecake factory! You will have a lot of choices of food, from chicken, beef etc. Looking at the menu you will see extensive amount of food category. My personal favorite is the Grilled Pork chop and Buffalo Blast. While my husband loves the orange chicken. Cheesecake factory also offers amazing cheesecakes, I love the Hazelnut Crunch Cheesecake. Ambience is flexible whether you are just hanging out with friend or on a date. Service is also on the dot! Whatever the occasion is or just a plain eat out with the family nothing beats Cheesecake Factory! Amazing staff and amazing food.

Great dinner after a long day with a co-worker. We started with Sangria, followed by Chicken Potstickers which were excellent and thus I forgot to take a picture. For entrees, we tried the skinlicious menu since the drink and appetizer were on there too. Tuscan Chicken and a Shrimp entree away were were full and very satisfied.
Vivian was our waiter and he was absolutely wonderful! The food was amazing as well. Brick chicken was delicious ! Also, if you like sweet drinks try the peach Bellini it&#39;s deliciousness!

Food is on par with the legacy brand itself but the everything about this place fails on all accounts of customer service and attentiveness, initial seating in some outdoor patio with flies and 85 degree humidity.. not to mention that whole 20 to 30 minutes between menus and taking of orders.. if you go I recommend the one out in Long Island

First time I have been to The Cheesecake Factory and it will probably be my last. This is a typical corporate restaurant with a very extensive menu of overpriced almost edible fare. They cut corners using cookie cutter cooking techniques to maximize profits and to alleviate you of your hard earned cash. They subscribe to the corporate hiring technique of hiring young inexperienced people who have no clue what it means to be a good waiter or waitress. They put them out ion the floor to try to get you to bump up your bill with slightly aggressive suggestion on drinks and appetizers. Once your meal is dropped at your table say bye bye to the Server as they will never be back to ask you if everything is ok  ir to refill your water glass. Oh my mistake they will be back at the end of your meal to try to push a $4.00 cup of coffee or a 10.00 cake or pie desert. You have been warned if you still decide to go it&#39;s on you. There are plenty of good restaurants in the neighborhood where you will get value and authentic food. This is not one of them.

i had a previously had a mad experience at a different location reluctantly we gave this place another chance the menu is still about 15 pages long pretty much you will find Chinese food Italian food along with burgers and pizza just to mention a few it can be existing reading threw everything and deciding on something our server was excellent she told us food take a while to come out since everything is cooked fresh which i don&#39;t mind there was a bunch of us and for the most part the food was worth the wait everything came out hot and was well seasoned i did get really over cooked shrimp in my jambalaya they rubbery real shame because the chicken was soft and tender overall not horrible be prepared to wait as they don&#39;t take phone reservations

The restaurant was very clean and stylish. I went with a party of 7. Two adults and five kids. The kids meals were decent for a bunch of 10 year olds, but the deserts lacked in just two choices. Milkshakes should be added to the kids menu. The adult meals were great as well as the appetizers. I had the Ultimate Margarita and it was very good. The drink did not lack any alcohol, but at $12 a pop be careful those can add significantly to your price. Overall the place was great, Maria was an awesome host and catered to all the demands of 10 year olds.

We came here for my daughters graduation/birthday dinner!! Im hoping all goes well, as i continue.<br><br>First off, the place looks very nice inside and out. We walked in and said table for 3, she asked my name and when I asked how long is the wait she replied no wait. To me no wait means someone is waiting to seat me, now I know why she asked for my name and oh by the way there was a short wait.<br><br>The waitress came after about 5 minutes to get our drinks and appetizer order. She seemed very nice and accommodating. Her happiness somewhat makes up for my wait/no wait when we first came in.<br><br>Drinks and appetizers came. My virgin pina colada could have been better, but it was just ok. My daughter liked her raspberry lemonade and her father just had water, which is hard to mess up. Appetizers, fried calamari and crab puffs, again ok, but tasty.<br><br>Now to main course, which was the stars of the show, pics below. Everything hot and delicious, thank GOD! I have no complaints on my salmon, and everyone was happy with there food!<br><br>Lastly, the reason people come.....the cheesecake!!! We had different cheesecakes, different flavors, all what we expected! No pics because we dug in and forgot, lol! It was good though.<br><br>Overall, pretty decent experience. Unfortunately I have to take a star off for my no wait/wait when we entered and the slightly rude sarcastic waiter that tried to apologize and another star for the waitress Pricilla. She took the orders fine, but didn&#39;t really check on us and how the food was. I would give 3 1/2 stars if i could, but Yelp doesn&#39;t work that way!

My family and I came here on Sunday to celebrate my cousin&#39;s 20th birthday. We ordered brunch and waited over an hour for our food! <br><br>We ordered French toast and waffles, all which were delivered with no butter or maple syrup. Instead, we were given Smucker&#39;s sugar free syrup in a take-out container which was cold (picture included). My cousin, who ordered chicken and waffles, was only given HALF a waffle. To thwart this discovery, they placed some over fried potatoes in the space from the partial waffle. <br><br>We requested a manager and Eric came over to the table. He heard us but did not listen. He promised maple syrups but thirty minutes and a withered waffle later we were informed that there was no maple syrup. My cousin also never received a complete waffle. <br><br>My aunt and cousins did enjoy the cucumber lemonade. Pedro was also a very pleasant waiter who made up for the lackluster management. <br><br>It&#39;s also worth mentioning that after waiting thirty/forty minutes for syrup and being told they did not have any, we saw a waiter walk past with a searing cup of syrup. <br><br>Nevertheless, we won&#39;t be celebrating another birthday here and unless you are on the mood for drama that makes you leave hungry, I suggest you also avoid dining here at all costs!

This was my first time here. We had a great server and we all enjoyed our meals. We definitely would go back again. Prices are reasonable and so are the portions. They have a low calorie menu which is great.

I don&#39;t know why, but I love this place. Could it be the cheesecake? I think so. Food is great, cappuccino is great and dessert is out of this world. The service in this particular restaurant is always pleasant.

Came here for lunch on a Wednesday, no wait needed. Our waitress was so nice and patient. And food was as expected. I always order the seared tuna salad and of course it was delicious. Had the mushroom cream soup and it was pretty good( first time trying it) atmosphere was casual and very airy (on the count of it being at the mall it felt very spacious)

Conveniently located in the Queens Center mall with plenty of free parking around when you&#39;re lucky, The Cheesecake Factory has a very friendly staff. The wait time is long but you have the luxury of shopping around while you wait. They call you when your table is ready which is really nice.<br>The food is low in average because it lacks flavor. I ordered the lemon garlic shrimp which came out very garlicky and buttery. Maybe the lack of flavor is because It came off the skinny menu.  The shrimp was rubbery. My friend&#39;s got the California salads but the tastiest was the Detox salad. <br>The appetizer we ordered were the mixed egg rolls which were  delicious especially with the sauces. <br>This place is fun for the experience and the atmosphere. Food is not satisfying. I didn&#39;t try the cheesecake but many of the tables around me had it coming to the tables non-stop so I&#39;m sure it is delicious.

Friendly staff. Great atmosphere. Entrees were just okay. We ordered mushroom burger, Louisiana spicy chicken, bbq pizza, and pasta. Instead of a soda, try their strawberry lemonade. I thought it was was pretty good. Calamari appetizer was delicious. And if you&#39;re craving for dessert, indulge in their sweet and creamy Godiva chocolate fudge ice cream. This place is great for dinner or lunch with your family and friends. I took off one star just because we were waiting for so long to get our order taken.

Last night was probably one of the worst experiences me and my family had at a Cheesecake Factory, now it had nothing to do with the food, but they were so understaffed that made our experience not so pleasant at all.<br><br>We came to the restaurant around 9:30pm to have some dinner after flying in from Florida, we Checked yelp for a good restaurant around the area and right away we decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory to eat because we know from previous experiences that they have amazing food and fast service.<br><br>The table wait was about 30 minutes but we saw 3 spots opened at the bar, I was with both of my parents, so we decided to just sit at the bar to eat, the bar tender was so busy that he barely had time to greet us and clean off the table from the previous guests, which was fine but we had to wait about 10 minutes until a busboy came and cleaned up, then the other bartender came out of nowhere put menus in front of us and walked away,  or even asking us if he could get us something to drink, but like I said before not his fault they were just so busy and constantly harassed by the waiters to get drinks out that they barely got to us when they would find time to take a breath. So we order some food, after getting our drinks, comes out about 15 minutes later, ok great, this looks really good, but once again, no silverware or napkins were given to us when we told them we were having dinner, so here we are playing he waiting game again, 5 minutes pass... 10 minutes pass... finally my dad had enough and walked to the waiters station and just simply asked for a knife and fork, by this time our food was cold and we were so unenthusiastic to stay there we just asked for boxes to take our food and leave.<br><br>Again this was a bad experience simply because the restaurant was understaffed and could not find any time to properly take care of their guest.
Great staff. Every time I come the staff are wonderful! Tried the cucumber lemonade 100 calories is wonderful.

It is the first time I come to this place that I have a very bad experience with the service, the food is very tasty and the drinks are also the problem, the waitress that took us about half an hour to take the order and when she brought the food  that we didn&#39;t have  I had to ask another waiter for water because the waitress who was serving us did not pay attention to us as if he did not bring money to pay and the difference was seen when he attended the two winged tables

Always clean and food tastes good. Long waits during dinner especially towards the weekends. Expect to wait. Service always courteous and professional. <br><br>Keith is a waiter that really stands out for me. The level of his service and manner would make you think you were at a high end dining establishment. As it should be.

The only good thing of the night...Cheese cakes I give them a 7 to Fresh Strawberry and 8 to my chocolate moose cake, food like i mentioned before on facebook was terrible and for being my first time and going in just to try the shrimp scampi was dissapointed, but it is what it is, maybe trying something else is better, who knkws... it just happend that i had to pick my favorite dish.... and left half content....

Really not impressed with the service. We were at the bar and our food came not to our liking at all. I ordered medium well and got a very well done filet mignon. Such a waste of a good cut of meat. I&#39;m starving so I had to eat it even though.

I had never been to a Cheesecake Factory but heard so many good things about them , I got very excited to see one opening in Queens.<br>Be ready to wait in line for a while. The food itself was decent and the cheesecake, delicious. I would definitely go back , most likely at a quiet time !

My friend took me out to eat here for my 23rd birthday, and it was amazing! <br><br>The food is great and comes in large portions and it is all decently priced! You have so many options to choose from, all which vary greatly from one another. Definitely recommend you get the fried mac and cheese balls! I&#39;m dying to go back just to get my hands on some more!! <br><br>The servers are amazing and the service is on point. We got our appetizers and drinks 15 minutes after ordering them and our entrees 20 minutes after ordering, which is great considering the place was overly packed due to the holidays. I understand the wait to actually get seated is horrible, but its easy to kill time since this location is in a mall.<br><br>Definitely recommend everyone to come here!

Chain restaurant, so I don&#39;t expect fantastic quality or even very original/unique food. <br><br>But the takeout service was excellent, considering most people wouldn&#39;t bother making effort for  to-go orders. But the young lady manning the dessert section and taking orders was very efficient. Not friendly or pleasant, but clearly doing her job and wanting to do it well. <br><br>Gets busy very quickly -- I was there right around when it opened, no later than 11:30 if that, and people were already steadily coming in. I overheard from the Host stand that they don&#39;t take reservations. <br><br>The food:<br><br>Fish Tacos -- really enjoyed this! Had them grilled, and we liked the sauce. It&#39;s described as chipotle sauce, but it has a heaviness to it that tasted like a tangy/zesty mayo. Overall, good! <br><br>Factory El Grando burrito -- OK, this should NOT be classified as a burrito. You envision a rolled up tortilla stuffed with food that you can hold with your hands? Yeah, this is laid down flat, and not even rolled that well. So kind of seems like a giant Enchilada. A bit disappointing. Need to reevaluate the description.<br><br>Lemoncello cream torte  -- Didn&#39;t care for it, a bit too tangy for me, and the middle pieces of cake seemed hardened. I initially thought it was lady fingers but that didn&#39;t match the description. And never been a big fan of streusal on top of any dessert. <br><br>Fudge layer cake -- Very rich cake. Fudgy ganache like icing on the outside, and in between the layers of cake a sweet buttercream frosting. And chocolate chips on the outside icing as well. <br><br>Tiramisu -- gave a giant square piece! Was much bigger than I&#39;ve gotten anywhere else. This lasted me days.<br><br>Would come back here for takeout, probably those fish tacos. Nothing else on the menu really stood out to me.

If i could give just half a star for review I wouldn&#39;t have given one star! Half a star for an impressive over-all restaurant look. Came here for dinner for my daughter&#39;s birthday and the experience was nothing but a disappointment. We have frequented other branches of Cheesecake Factory but this was by far the worst experience we ever had coming to Cheesecake Factory. From 6pm we came out past 9pm not because we had a blast!!! Wait time was ridiculously long from start to finish. 30-minute wait to get a table for a party of 6, we were called to be seated only to wait another 30 minutes for the table to be ready because nobody knew what they were doing and where to seat which party, a lot pf confusions. Once seated we had to wait forever for someone to take our orders and food were served after an hour. Complete waste of time, considering food were not superb, rather salty and dry!!!

Today my Calamari appetizer came out cold and not fried or tempura well the batter was falling off the calamari. I Took Lunch special to go it was blah and salty! Not what i experienced in long island with the same dish and loved it there. My drink was decent! Who has time to complain when. In a rush for lunch. Not sure whats going on at this location!!<br><br>Smh insulted hours later. I guess they thought it was funny. With adding salt to our food. Actually. The pasta carbonera. Is what i had was from the GRAND LUX RESTUARANTE! Delicious. This crap here idk! Dont bother.
Got the ribeye and pork chop. Both were terrible and small portions. I can&#39;t believe how bad it was. Really disappointed.
The food was okay it was cold when the waiter brought it to me. The drinks was good and the cheesecake was great, I have banana, the bar maid was Very Nasty.
Food is average, however the cocktails were great,  the ambiance is wonderful  and the staff is very personable. I didnt try the cheesecake

I love Cheesecake Factory, but the service here was just terrible, not to mention there a 50 minute wait at 8 PM on a Monday night. <br><br>After waiting almost an hour to be seated, we then had to wait 20 minutes after we had ordered our entrees before we even got water and even longer before we got plates and utensils. <br><br>Then, we got our entrees, they had forgotten to make one of the dishes so we had to wait another 15 minutes for that. <br><br>The food itself was good, minus the missing entree and the cheesecake was delicious! I love the red velvet cheesecake and Chris&#39;s outrageous cheesecake! <br><br>After this poor service I do not know if I will be returning again anytime soon.
Extremely expensive for the extremely small portions and Luke warm food. The cheesecake was OK. And the service was OK.

I have always been a big fan of The cheese cake factory and was excited to see one in Queens!<br>This location has a very nice atmosphere, the food was good and the prices are reasonable (for the food). They have a healthy food option menu! which i loved! They list the calories, very helpful! The staff very friendly and sweet, BUT the service was a bit slow, (got a soup and had to wait for the spoon) My biggest complaint here is the price of the cocktails, got 2 Mojitos for $12.50 EACH! I say, very overpriced, and i don&#39;t know if the price is listed on the menu, i did not see it, and if it was, it was not very visible...other than that, it was a good experience overall.

I came here with my cousin for lunch. Compared to the one is Garden City. This place is bad. I ordered a pasta but I didn&#39;t enjoy it. It was bland. I do love the crab cakes and I took some cheesecake to go. That was good. I would rather travel go Garden City next time.

The most enjoyable thing about my experience was my waitress. She was so attentive and sweet! Other than that everything else was subpar. I ordered Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp, not spicy at all as I thought it would be, but it was really salty I mixed everything together and still was unable to finish it. We ordered the fried Mac and cheese balls which was good, but also salty and the factory nachos which were not as good this time as the last time I got them. Don&#39;t think I will be back here since, I never get cheesecake the calories are insane!

My girlfriend took me to this place for the very first time 2 years ago. I ordered the gumbo because it&#39;s a southern dish and I&#39;ve never had it before. I didn&#39;t know how it would be like since I&#39;ve never tried it before. But it was maddd good, unlike anything I&#39;ve had before. I highly recommend this dish. My girlfriend and the rest of her family each ordered the fillet mignon. It was a pretty big piece for the amount of money they were spending on it. It was also really well cooked, she asked for medium rare and it came out perfectly like that. I&#39;ve also tried the cheesecake here, I&#39;m a big fan of cheesecakes but the cheesecake here was a little thicker then I would like. <br><br>The restaurant itself just like Drakes mentioned is a place for families that drives camrys.

I love the cheesecake factory but I have to say that this location sucks. The food is not the same as other cheesecake factories. Consistency is poor. Poorly managed and neglected store. And they ran out of salmon. What chain restaurant runs out of salmon? And if you run out of salmon, wouldnt you go and buy it somewhere? Maybe a fish market?

Started off fine. Friendly waitress, yummy bread. Delicious drinks. Then the maincourse took forever and the food came barely warm. Fries were not crispy nor hot! Asked for steak knives, never got them. Then the waitress went on break, person who cover never came to our table. Finally asked for a cheque after 30 minutes wait. Took another 20 min for someone to pick up the payment. We wasted almost an hour at the end NOT able to get dessert because no one bother to come to take the order! All the table around us got their service and already left way before us. It is frustrating.

The Cheesecake factory is by far my favorite restaurant chain; they have awesome decor (and this is consistent for all the chains I have visited) and a large selection of different cuisines to choose from (perfect for those indecisive nights). In NYC, the only Cheesecake factory that was available would be the one in Long Island (and that kind of travel was intense for those who did not have access to a car)-- so you can tell that this new one came as a wonderful surprise. If you&#39;re questioning the fact that it is in the QCM, worry not because the place is relatively large-- and is a BIG HIT. In fact, for the first 3 weeks (maybe longer?), the wait for dinner was a disgusting 2-3 hour wait (I would know, I tried) on a Friday night. I think the hype has gone down a bit now.<br><br>For appetizers, I ordered the spinach and cheese dip with nachos. I know, ugh.. why did I do that? It&#39;s kind of bland when it comes to pairing with hardly salted nacho chips-- I would not advise unless it&#39;s your thing. I would normally order avocado dip with nachos, but I decided that a change would be interesting (it was not). I also ordered a Skinny Mojito (which is &#34;essentially&#34; a normal Mojito with less calories?)-- but it tasted REALLY fruity and had hardly any taste of alcohol (I really hope that it wasn&#39;t a virgin now...).<br><br>For the entree, my partner ordered the Filet Mignon for about thirty bucks and I ordered the beef tacos. The Filet Mignon was super flavorful (no need for sauce, salt, or pepper)-- oh my goodness, I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be going back to Outback Steak House (sorry... okay, maybe I&#39;ll go back for their bread). The beef tacos came as 4 tacos and was super bland (unfortunately)-- the lime juice helped a little bit and the fact that the tacos were very filling made me feel a little better, but the lack of flavor was disappointing and though I do not hate it, I would not go for it again.<br><br>At the time of my visit, there was a deal going on where if you purchased a $25 giftcard, you would get 2 slices of cheesecake (redeemable in January). My partner and I purchased one giftcard each and we were able to apply it to our meal. We will be coming back for those free slices of cheesecake next year (get it? because it&#39;s December now). **A few weeks earlier, we purchased a cheesecake for a relative&#39;s birthday, it was MM MM GOOD :)<br><br>Though my choice of food was not the best, I&#39;m going to come back and try everything else.

There are a few entrances, none clearly marked but it seems just one leads to a host stand (fortunately we got there right when they opened and were seated immediately).<br>Our server was excellent, the entry process and payment process (we had 4 eSlices of Joy and $50 in giftcards and got as many receipts) were quite inefficient, and the food was highly caloric (we got an entree each and were full enough) and not as satisfying as you&#39;d hope, but the cheesecake made for decadent finales.

Food is great as always with more then plenty of options to choose from. This location specifically lacks the over the top service you usually receive at other locations but overall great place to eat on weekends with family or friends.

3.5<br><br>What a great addition to the area! Once I found out that Cheesecake Factory was opening, I knew I had to find out what the hype was about. Once we got here earlier this morning, there was already a long line outside. <br>As we walked to our seats, I couldn&#39;t stop but noticed how massive the establishment is; I&#39;m impressed. We get to sit by the window area which was great because it was sunny out and it definitely has a nice vibe (think I actually prefer sitting around here than the main area).<br><br>Since it was still earlier in the day, I decided to go for OJ ($4.95) and Spinach, Mushroom, Bacon and Cheese Omelette ($13.95). I would have given my first Cheesecake Factory experience 4 stars at least, but the wait though. It even took a while for water and orange juice to be served. I became hangry having to wait over half an hour for breakfast to show up. Our waiter dropped by twice to apologize since it is opening week, but it wasn&#39;t his fault. <br><br>Once the food came, I was happy again. Breakfast was surprisingly good, but I was also hungry. Can&#39;t also help but notice how big the portion was ... well worth the price. <br><br>I may come back for the food if I have more time to kill. I&#39;d definitely come back though to get the cheesecake. I&#39;m all for places that are big on sustainability and social impact.

Very impressed with the service here. Came here on their grand opening day and there were A LOTTTT of people. We came during off peak hours and still waited around 20min <br><br>Me and my friend really looked forward to this and it certainly didn&#39;t disappoint. We came with the mind to order the pasta and cheesecake, however the pasta was way DAMN filling(but delish) and we couldn&#39;t fit the cheesecake. (Thanks for that, CHEESECAKE factory) <br><br>I ordered the four cheese pasta, it was unexpectedly good because hearing 4 cheese it might be too cheesy, but it&#39;s actually not. It&#39;s blended with marinara sauce and isn&#39;t too salty. <br><br>My fiend ordered the shrimp and sausage pasta and it was actually really good, a bit spicy( for her, for me it tasted so weak spicy haha) but I personally thought it was a bit salty. <br><br>Service is definitely 5 stars. VERYYYYY good customer service. I hope they keep it up and that it wasn&#39;t just a first day attitude kind of thing. <br><br>Will be backkkk (for the cheesecake now actually)
Menu is huge!!! So many choices.   Avocado  toast and fried mac and cheese . Server was very friendly and brought our food out quickly.   Took home a slice of peanut butter fudge cheesecake.

It was alright. The menu was overwhelming. The server Kathryn B. Did can awesome of taking care of my elderly mom and I for lunch. my mom originally ordered catfish but there was no catfish and she ended up ordering spaghetti and meatballs. I loved how clean the restaurant was and its design. I really would like to return for happy hour to see it it is worth it.

Lordy!!! I made the mistake of thinking that coming here on a Saturday night was a good idea. It was ridiculously crowded, so many people everywhere, blocking doors, angry, so much disorganization, just complete chaos.<br><br>I didn&#39;t bother staying for dinner, the wait was about 2hrs or more. I decided to just get cheesecake and go, well even that took 11mins. There a guy who had placed a to-go order and had been waiting an 1 1/2. lol they need to get it together.

Yum Yum Yum!<br><br>Even if you are from Mars and dont like cheesecake, You need to come here! <br><br>Ambiance: Gorgeous. As we were lead to our seats I noticed the Bars had about Two T.V.s and about 8ish Seats. I did not try any alcohol but I noted that there was a large selection available. The seating can be great if you sit way in the back where it is intimate and private Or it can be kinda close to other parties in the middle where it is a bit louder. <br><br>Food: So finally after being seated we received the thickest menu I ever saw. It took me a while to decide between many great options. When the food came it was Oh So Tasty! My Diane Steak/Shrimp Campi Combo was well done and still juicy with some tenderness. My Date had the hibachi steak which was not as tender but just as tasty and delicious. You could taste the wine in the steak. The machpotaotes taste as good as they look in the pictures. The appetizers came out WARM! Loved that. Avocado Rolls and Toast Avocado. Quality Food! <br><br>Juniors Vs. The Cheesecake Factory (CHEESECAKE REVIEW): Get the Chocolate Hazel! You won&#39;t regret it &amp; I think a portion goes to feeding the needy. I haven&#39;t had Juniors in a while so take this with a grain of salt (No Pun intended) but The cheesecakes here I found to be fresher and more tasty. I had the Fresh Strawberry &amp; Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch &amp; Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake  And they all were very smooth in taste and the perfect softness to the crust. I&#39;m not a big cheesecake fan, I prefer ice cream cake but these cheesecakes were really good and not over the top. TRY IT!<br><br>Customer Service: By far Daphnie and the others who also came to our table gave great customer service skills! She was very clear and thorough. We came on a Thursday night around busy after work hours 7 pm and waited 1 hour and 12 mins but I expected the long wait given they just opened this week. Its better to come here for brunch or lunch if you cant wait. Also I was told that they do not take RSVP yet. The staff here works as a team (Which I loved) So many people will check up on you. It was attentive without being too attentive or disturbing. My utmost compliments to Daphnie and The Manger (a chubby bald guy in a blue shirt). This team screams great communication skills. My water was always filled, &amp; the appetizers came out at a decent time, followed by the food. The soft drinks did take a lil long.<br><br>Cleanliness: Please note They did not have their letter grade up, which is important to me but the place was pretty much clean. My utensils were spotless (Not even the ugly water stain), My waiter put my knife &#34;sitting&#34; on the table (I loved that). My glass seemed clean and none of the waiters or waitresses or busboys walked around with dirty towels or stained shirts. Everything was neat and clean. BUT I WANT MY LETTER GRADE POSTED b/c It would help to know that the kitchen is clean.<br><br>PS! They are one of those very few restaurants who still pack the food for you when it&#39;s time to go! I must have shed a tear or two for this when I realized I didnt have to do it myself. #FirstWorldProblems<br><br>T.I.Ps:<br><br>(1) There is NO COAT CHECK<br>(2) At this time, You can not RSVP. First come first serve. Dont take the the little Buzzer past JCPenny<br>(3) There is NO Separate PARKING. (Park in the Mall Parking Lot as this factory is part of the mall)<br>(4) Dress Code: I saw a lot of couples the wait for two is crazy and they dress up/ very few families, and lots of groups of friends who dressed casually. Skinny leg jeans and cute shoes and cute sweater will do. Cute Chic/Not too dressy<br>(5) Most Entrees are between 15$ and 22$. Some Small slice Cakes were 6-8$ Enjoy!

Had dinner here last night we got avocado egg rolls, nachos, fried cheese balls and fish tacos. We waited over an hour on a Saturday. The nachos were really good recommend them not a big fan of the other things . Also fish tacos were good. I thought it was a overall good experience but the wait was unreasonable.

Update 07-22-18: Just took off a star. I was asked to contact their customer service to resolve this....No reply, no one cares on the other side. From no on I will avoid this place. They really don&#39;t care about their customers satisfaction or health.<br><br>****************************************<br><br>I&#39;ve always been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory since the early days in Miami.
