However, after my trip there today with family I might not come back. <br><br>We went there for early lunch, place has a B grade (checked online &amp; it was something minor so no bid deal).<br>We ordered our usual dishes, staff was very friendly and place was as nice as always. I was pondering how unfair the B grade was until I got my food.<br><br>I ordered chicken chipotle pasta, it&#39;s a ziti type of pasta. While eating I found noodles (looked like Thai style noodles) from other dishes and even stale looking french fries....I have never been so disgusted in my life. How did food from other dishes arrived into my pasta??? Was I eating leftovers??? Garbage??? <br>I stopped eating and didn&#39;t want to make a scene in front of my wife and kid. Lost my appetite &amp; still feel disgusted while writing this review. <br><br>Hey Cheesecake management, look into this please. June 2nd, 2018 around noon time, we ordered 2 pasta dishes &amp; 1 kids salmon, lemonade, coffee &amp; milk. How did leftovers from other dishes get into my dish???<br>Google the term Pagpag, is that what you serve?<br><br>The 2 stars are for the staff and decor, the Cheesecake factory should be a 5 star place all the way...shame!

This was my first time at The Cheesecake Factory. Overall the experience was good. The serve was great from start to finish. Because it was my first time I went to my go to dish chicken Alfredo. The issue is that my chicken was can chicken. As a cook you know the difference between can food and real food. If my chicken was real they would&#39;ve gotten 5 stars.

Haven&#39;t dined in but always done take out. <br><br>Staff is nice and friendly. Only downfall is the wait time.<br><br>I always get the avocado rolls and buffalo blasts and whatever cheesecake I&#39;m craving that day. That is all!

Came here with a few of my co-workers and we had a blast! It was the opening week and it was hell trying to get a table. The waits were ridiculously long, but we did end up finding seats at the bar after half an hour of stalking the high tops. The service was pretty quick given the amount of people there for opening week. Our bartender always made sure we were taken care of. My only complaint is that the food and cheesecake took FOREVER to come out. I&#39;m sure they were overwhelmed with orders, so I understand, it was just tough because we were all so hungry.<br><br>If you&#39;re looking to get a drink here, get the pineapple moscow mule. It is delicious and has a gigantic slice of fresh pineapple in your drink. For dinner, I had the chicken bellagio (which is my go to dish here) and the tiramisu cheesecake. The chicken bellagio was smaller in portion size than at some of the other Cheesecakes I&#39;ve been to, but the quality is better. It was also decorated very nicely. I really enjoyed the tiramisu cheesecake. It was light an fluffy, but it made me so thirsty afterwards. I had to chug three glasses of water just to feel slightly hydrated.<br><br>Overall, had a good experience here. Good company, good food and good drinks! Just wish the ticket time was a bit shorter.

The thing with the Cheesecake Factory is that they know no matter what, people will still come here, likely myself included although in recent years the crazy wait times has made me steer very clear of coming here.  This location opened last year when I was still living nearby and back then, it wasn&#39;t unusual to have 2+ hour wait times for a table for two. These days, things have slowed down a bit but the wait times are often still bizarre. <br><br>So why despite everyone&#39;s love for chain restaurants, do I want to write a review? It actually came down to one instance. While I feel I&#39;ve always had a 3/5 star experience (not just this Cheesecake Factory, but every Cheesecake Factory location), given the long wait time, servers in the past forgetting to bring silverware, coming back to tell me multiple times what I ordered is unavailable, etc, I came here recently ahead of my larger party to put my name down for a table and was told 20 minutes despite the restaurant being pretty empty. My party came in soon after through a different door and didn&#39;t see me already waiting and asked for a table as well and they were seated immediately. (WHAT?!) I don&#39;t understand why I was told to wait by one hostess when another hostess sat the same party immediately.<br><br>This makes me think that the wait times are often disproportionately exaggerated and you want us to wait just for the sake of waiting. The food is good and the cheesecake is obviously what we all come for, but I&#39;m going to be skeptical of these alleged wait times now for sure.

Great service. Food portions is less than other Cheesecake Factories but same price. Food quality was also pretty bad. Ordered Spicy cashew chicken and it was way too sweet almost inedible. <br><br>My friend order of Shrimp w/ angel hair pasta. Order was missed but manager handled it very well and paid for his dish. But it came out overdone and soggy...<br><br>If the service wasn&#39;t good this would be a one star review. Probably would not come back. Wait was almost 3 hours but that would hopefully change after the hype dies down.

In a word, tremendous. I was blown away at how awesome everything was. We went to eat there at around 1pm on a Friday and the place was packed to the gills. Make sure you call ahead with reservations because we ended up waiting for about 20 minutes for a table. <br><br>Everyone was super nice and efficient. As busy as the place was, no one was overwhelmed. So 5 stars for the managers, waitstaff and chefs as well.<br><br>As for the food? Hot damn. I don&#39;t know what else to tell you other than it was out of this fucking world. <br><br>For 4 people, we ended up getting the guacamole egg roll and fried mac and cheese ball appetizers.<br><br>For entrees:<br>--I got the Steak Diane (delicious sauce and perfectly cooked steak)<br><br>--Country chicken and biscuits (my girl went nuts over this and she&#39;s still talking about it).<br><br>--fish tacos for my friend (they were delicious and not fishy at all)<br><br>--and a bowl of mac and cheese for our friend&#39;s 2 year old son.<br><br>For desert: The crunchy Nutella cheesecake that we all split (and couldn&#39;t even finish).<br><br>PROS:<br>-great food. Even though it&#39;s a big menu, every item on the menu seems fantastic.<br><br>-great service <br><br>-they have health options<br><br>CONS:<br>- because of how busy it is, that plus the music they were playing through the speaker system, it can be a little loud...and if you have a kid, make sure you break ear phones because the 2 year old at the table kept saying how loud the place was. So just a FYI.<br><br>- because the place is so new they really want to make a good impression. The problem with this was, we had about (not kidding) 3 people constantly checking in on us. So every few minutes someone else would come up to the table and say &#34;is everything alright?&#34; Then 60 seconds later someone else would say &#34;just checking to make sure everything is alright.&#34; Then a few minutes later someone else would come up to our table and say &#34;just wanna make sure everything is okay.&#34; Every time we told them we were fine. It was a little annoying so I&#39;m not gonna take away any stars.<br><br>All in all, it was tremendous. Can&#39;t wait to go back.

Went here on a Thursday night. Waited 15-20 minutes for a table which isn&#39;t bad for this location. Waited another 15 minutes to have a waitress come over to give us a menu. Another 15 minutes after that for her to come back and order drinks. Drinks took forever to come, and same with the food. Place wasn&#39;t that crowded. Waitress could have been better with her service. Barely came by, and gives my table bread half way through the meal. Drinks are expensive here. $13.00 for a margarita. Food was not worth the wait at all. <br>Wouldn&#39;t come back.

Took my godson out for lunch and we were able to partake in the happy hours specials. We ordered dynamite shrimp, buffalo blasts, crab cake bites and the Caesar salad with spicy Caesar dressing. Overall the food was great and the service from our waitress Autumn was amazing. I&#39;ve been to many cheesecake factories and this location had a friendlier vibe than the others.

I was celebrating Father&#39;s Day with my family. Upon sitting at the table, we had to wait about 10 minutes for the waitress. We ordered drinks for the table. The waitress brought the drinks without any straws. After we asked for straws, she took another 5 minutes to come back with straws. <br>Then we ordered appetizers and entrees. The appetizers arrived after about 30 minutes. When the appetizers arrived, there were no plates and utensils on our table. We had to ask for plates and utensils. The waitress took about 15 minutes to come back with the plates and utensils. In that duration, the appetizers were cold. <br>She also did not offer the complementary bread to our table. When we asked about it, she said forgot to offer the bread when she went to get utensils. After we finished our cold appetizer, she finally the brought the bread to our table without any butter. We had to ask for butter for the bread. <br>At that point, we were notified that one entree order was not possible to make. So we had to change an order at that time. We asker for bread refill but we did not receive it. Then we had to wait another 30 minutes for the entrees to arrive. Afterwards we had a different waitress for the remainder of the visit. The waitress did not offer to refill the water at our table during our meal.<br>After entrees, we ordered desserts. The waitress did not bring any new utensils for the desserts. We had to use the  same utensils from our entrees for the desserts. Sometime during our visit, we had asked for the manager but the manager never came. Overall we had a horrible experience during our visit to the Cheesecake Factory.

This was the best choice I&#39;ve made all week. After a great workout me and my cousin decided to stop in here for a quick bite. We were greeted by the awesome hostess Michelle by the bar. She suggested I get the chicken Madeira and my cousin Get the soup and salad. My meal was absolutely succulent and hearty. They even gave me a sample of the soup of the day which was pretty cool. This will be my new place to dine frequent.
When we got there in the evening, there was about a 15 minute wait. There&#39;s a display of all the different cheesecakes up front  <br>I had the tiramisu cheesecake which was amazing!!
EDIT: You can see CCF reaches out below to make it seem as if they care to follow up about your experience but I have yet to hear back after contacting them.

This is one of the better Cheesecake Factory locations I&#39;ve been to. Very welcoming staff and quick food preparation after you order. The bartenders are super chatty and friendly and the overall restaurant is well taken care of and has a pleasant atmosphere. Highly recommend after a day of shopping in the mall it is attached to.

We were quickly seated. Server was overwhelmed but provided friendly service. However, the food is not so good. All chain restaurants serve the same food, just a different spin on items. This place is known for its cheesecakes and thankfully that didn&#39;t disappoint. The red velvet cheesecake tastes great.

Save your money and go somewhere else where your money and appetite is worth. This  used to be my favorite place but it totally fell off. Maybe it&#39;s because of  new management or lack of. They don&#39;t give you bread unless you have a party of 3 or more. The female servers are very rude and nasty. I had several occasions where the female servers banged my glass beverage at my table and the beverage splashed all over me and she didn&#39;t even say sorry. The other female server shoves a hot plate at my sisters face and has the nerve to tell her place it on the table herself. The other female server had the worst attitude and got annoyed because I as a customer asked her for extra plates and forks. What a way to get tips right?

This is a review for a meal in May 2018. After a frustrating wait at the neighbourhood&#39;s Red Lobster, where I sat for 20 minutes at a table with no one even bothering to approach me, despite pleas to the front desk to intervene. I was hangry and headed for this place. Despite a line, since I was alone I managed to get a place almost instantly. The waiter also came by quickly. It was a gentleman with a beard. I ordered the chicken with biscuits. I had a wait of about 15-20 minutes - a good sign for me that they were cooking food from scratch and not heating up prepared food. It was a large helping and good. Would recommend if you are in in the neighbourhood and need a clean and decent meal. Did not have the cheesecake or any dessert.

Menu was overwhelmingly large so I ordered from the Skinnylicious insert because it was healthier. <br><br>However, calories are not the whole picture by any means. I like to know where my food cones from -- if my fish is wild-caught or farmed. I don&#39;t eat meat or poultry but it helps to know if it is grass-fed or raised with hormones and this menu fell short on that so it lost a star for me. <br><br>The only reason it didn&#39;t lose another star was that the service and ambiance were superb and none of the national chains tell us where our food comes from. Listing calories alone appeals to a very unenlightened and somewhat ignorant segment of the population and can be very misleading

horrible experience waited 30 min for a table, 75 % off the appetizer was sold out, my entree hibachi steak, sold out my wife&#39;s entree sold out but no acknowledgement , waited for our entree to be notify  this everything is probably sold out, what happen to my wife entree and daughter entree? The worsted service ever, one off my top favorite restaurant, is now the worst resturant.

Going to this specific location is usually a hit or miss with the wait time due to it being connected to queens center mall. Other than the wait being a problem this restaurant is amazing! The staff are super friendly and the food tastes really good..

Came in around 2 pm, on a Sunday, with a group of 4people. The wait was not too overwhelming--40 mins. We walked around the mall for about 20 mins before our buzzer let us know the table was ready. The servers were nice and attentive. The food was hot and delicious but took forever to come to the table. I ordered the steak medallions from the skinnylicious menu, the only way you knew that if was in fact &#34;healthy&#34; was the portion, which was smaller than typical Cheesecake portions, the taste was not lacking!<br><br>I would come back!

It was disgusting. Waited 1 hour to be seated. And one hour to get food. Asked for steak and shrimp combo with pasta instead of mash potatoes. Bill was $150 for everything my family and I had ordered and they brought it out cold. And they had the nerve to leave the middle of my plate empty where the pasta WAS supposed to be and say &#34;pasta is coming out soon.&#34; Sent all the food back to get reheated to the point where I burned my hand from touching the plate. Pasta was hard and not boiled. Food terrible. I would have been more satisfied eating at Burger King.

The Dulce Leche cheesecake is out if this world!  I love this place!<br><br>I love their menu items too!  The portions are large and the plates are tasty.  Sometimes on the weekends you&#39;ll have to wait for a seat.  I suggest to make reservations or get there early to put your name down for seating.

I would start by saying that I&#39;m addicted to their avocado egg roll , bread and banana cheese cake butttt and there&#39;s a big but , this place is crowdy , noisy , the dishes are not that clean at all , but I understand why so many people love coming here , the prices are honest , the portions are huge but it really bothers me that you can barley hear yourself .

Because the restaurant is new I decided to go early to avoid the madness. Thankfully I did. We decided to sit at the bar area. <br><br>Drew and Lindsey were awesome. Very attentive to our needs. They made the experience pleasant. <br><br>I got the Stuffed Chicken Tortillas and they were amazing. Great portions for the price. <br><br>No more driving to Long Island, Upstate or NJ to go to Cheesecake Factory. Although, it being walking distance now may be dangerous to my waist line.

Food was mediocre and customer service wasn&#39;t good at all. The waiter that handled us was very unprofessional named Henry. They&#39;ll argue with you because they believe you&#39;re wrong. Henry didn&#39;t even have the courtesy to apologize to us for starting an argument. We tried being civil and explaining the situation and Henry didn&#39;t respect that, he raised his voice and started raising his voice. If I had the opportunity to give zero stars I would. Wait was also about an hour. Our bread came out rock hard. Overall, a nightmare of a dinner experience

I am a fan of the cheesecake factory, but not this one. Not only did they refuse to seat us because our party wasn&#39;t all there when the table was available they made us wait another 90 minutes! They have no clue how to seat medium sized  groups, and we were only 6!!  2 which were young children!  You don&#39;t know how to move two adjacent tables together!? Seriously wtf!?  <br>If you are a party of two you have quicker seating. <br>By the time we sat down we already knew what we wanted cause we studied the damn menu for 90 minutes!  You think cause the server knew we waited so long she&#39;d  expedite our order cause the children were starving. Nope. Another 45 minutes. Well how about some of that free bread to hold us over? One basket! For 6 mouths. Our basket was empty in 60 seconds. No refill.<br>Let&#39;s talk about portion size. I ordered the chicken maderia and steak Diane special. It was 3 pieces of steak and 1 palm size chicken breast. You bet I&#39;m upset! I was already Hangry!  From that long wait and half piece of bread! Did I mention we arrived well past lunch. It was 2pm. We weren&#39;t eating until close to 4!  I would never ever dine at this location again. I&#39;ll take my cheesecake to go!
The food wasn&#39;t great but we had a great server. We were there about a month ago with a huge party and many people. Our waitress Charisse was very patient, polite and helpful.

Me and my friend decided to go here last night. I been to this location before, the service wasn&#39;t bad. For appetizers we got avocados egg roll and for entree we got the chicken Madeira and it was enough for two people. We were glad that for entree we ordered the chicken medira it was really delicious, it comes with sauté mushrooms, mash potatoes, asparagus and the chicken is filled with sauce and it was very moist. Overall great experience.

Im not usually a huge fan of chain restaurants, but I&#39;m a sucker for this place. Lots of choices in terms of appetizers, mains, drinks, and desserts, pretty good food, and yummy cheesecake! The wait can be obscene during peak times (think weekends, holidays), and their waiting system leaves something to be desired compared to other Cheesecake Factory locations, but the bartenders and waitstaff are actually super attentive, friendly, and professional, which is awesome. This is a much-needed addition to the Queens Center Mall!

I havent been to the cheesecake factory in a long time, and was pleased when I visited this location with my friend and her two kids. First thing first the waiter was so sweet and engaging and also he was very patient with the kids. He suggested the quesadilla and chips and guacamole and we quickly agreed. The food was delicious quesadilla were huge and full of flavor. We both ended up getting the bacon cheeseburger. DELICIOUS!! Juicy burger, crispy bacon it was really good.. I couldnt finish it lol but it was delicious. Of course we ended the lunch by purchasing cheesecake. I got the reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake and my friend got the strawberry cheesecake.. both were delicious. Thank you to our waiter Gerard wonderful young man, I hope to see him again when we visit soon.
I went there for my birthday .the ambience was great the food well it depends on what you ordered.good prices also I has fun  good  customer service.

This was my first time going to the Cheesecake Factory, and the experience was great. Our hostess Michelle was fast, fun, very friendly and attentive to our ordering needs. The rest of the staff was very energetic and polite, the food was awesome I ordered the shrimp with angel hair pasta and my boyfriend order the steak tacos. He also ordered the Strawberry lemonade, which he says was great. The cheesecake was also amazing ( I had the red velvet and he had the Butter pecan turtle one). <br><br>Everything was great until I went to the restroom there was no toilet paper in none of the stalls and the bathrooms in general needed major attention.<br><br>But, all things considered we would definitely go back again.
I&#39;ve been told to go to the Cheesecake Factory, and I just did, it was good, nice place and great atmosphere

What a disappointment...have never been here, so today I decided to give a try, place is beautiful I give them that, but service on the other hand (never had any after 20 minutes of waiting in the booth).  We a party of 4 picked what we wanted to eat....we waited...waited no one ever came to us.  We did get our plates and silverware when seated only interaction.  Looked across the street OLIVE GARDEN here we come

Although the service was lacking due to being seated in the back area, the food was pretty good and filling. <br>Got seated quickly, our food came out within a moderate amount of time, and the prices weren&#39;t as bad as anticipated.

My experiences with this place have been weird. The hostesses  and waiters I had were great, and I tipped them all. So there&#39;s no problem there. The cheesecakes were amazing and I loved them! And I liked their smoothie drinkers.<br><br>The entrees/appetizers I&#39;ve had before were not good at all. The last time I went, I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and there was no spicy anything. Only for two bites, otherwise, it was not good.<br><br>The time before I last time I went, I had nachos. The nachos I had before were greasy and I did not like the cheese.  Nor the meat used. It was salty enough where I did not want to finish it.<br><br>The time before the time above, I ordered  the buffalo chicken before that, the blue cheese was extremely salty (I am not sure if blue cheese is like that but I could not eat  it as  I was not feeling well) and had to use my  friend&#39;s barbeque sauce.<br><br>And last but not least, the first time  I went, I had the fried cheese. It was okay. Nothing major.<br><br>Overall: Nice employees, good atmosphere. The food however could be much better. :)

I had the farfalle pasta, it was very good. The problem is that I have made changes to the dish that the Kitchen agreed to, but when the dish arrived, it was missing some key ingredients. It was still very good, could have been better. The staff was welcoming and nice. Our server was missing at times and the other servers took our requests. Very professional on their behalf. <br>Another nice moment was when we first set down,  we were 4 adults and my baby boy.  We asked for a high chair and it was ready by our table and the hostess was so nice, she brought me some warm bread and a sliced banana for my baby without even asking... <br>Will definitely come back again.

I came here for a quick lunch on a Saturday and it was very busy but luckily me &amp; my friend found seats at the bar. I had the crab dip for an appetizer and the Chicken &amp; Avocado sandwich for my entree. The crab dip was good but I wish it was a little bit warmer because it seemed to be room temperature. The sandwich was very good and was a good portion so it was fulfilling. The bar was full but the service was still pretty quick and good. I would come back here again but if you plan on going on an early Saturday afternoon be prepared for it to be crowded and you will probably have to wait.
Terrible service, 45 minutes for burned steak<br>Careless manager and service, waste of time. <br>The worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to.

I&#39;ll spare everyone the horrendous wait times and service details (let&#39;s just say after 1 hour at our table we only saw an appetizer and a glass of water each). When the manager, Amanda, came to our table I expressed that we wanted to cancel the dinner order and pay for the app so we could leave. She was snide and defensive telling me THREE times &#34;there was nothing she could do about it if the kitchen already started cooking the order.&#34; So the insinuation is that I&#39;m going to pay for food I had not received? After the 4th time of me explaining that I want the check for the appetizer and I wanted to leave she rudely walked away. Finally, another 5 minutes later a bill was dropped off by the waiter - no apologies, nothing. Amanda was immature and ethically inappropriate - definitely NOT a professional.<br><br>DO NOT EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT. YOU&#39;VE BEEN WARNED.
The menu is a mile long.  So many delicious options. Healthy and fattening.  Our server is uber fabulous so far
Best Cheesecake Ever!!!! Their pastas are terrific as well but I mainly went to try the Chocolate Tuxedo Cake for my birthday and it was like a dream! Highly recommend!

Ordered delivery through an app. Got the meatloaf... and explain to me why the inside was red? A meatloaf is cooked for hours...didn&#39;t understand why it was also a bit frozen in the middle as well. It was disgusting. Never again will I order or eat from this location.

On July 7 we went to eat there with Daniela and Freddie from colombia, the dinner and the service was spectacular, my plate was chicken Parmesan pizza , my wife had the quesadilla with chicken much better then we have had in other Restaurants, Freddie had a special burger which he raved about it . The reason we went was to have their famous cheese cake we where so full we did not order dessert. But after all we do want to say this place is worth going to will refer to all my friends and family.

I usually don&#39;t really care about service as long as they do the basic job. But this location sucks. I did not get any bread, nor a spoon to eat my pasta. i couldn&#39;t even ask for it because I could not find the this server throughout my whole meal after he dropped the food on my table quickly. He seems really rude and grumpy as well, no smile at all. I even called him from far away just to get the check at the end. Will totally avoid this location from now on.
The food and drinks here are amazing. Love getting the Chipotle chicken pasta and their margaritas and mojitos. The downside is that their wait time is always 40-50 mins.

Yesterday, I called to make a reservation for get together for my friends and family. The lady that answered the call was very condescending, and she was mocking my accent constantly; I can hear her smirky sound. I felt disrespected and that behavior was not necessary. The lady said her name is Marissa; the call was made around 10:20pm on March 26, 2019. I feel she could be an liability to the well reputed Cheesecake Factory, not an asset. I would definitely not recommend anyone this restaurant. I can only imagine the ambiance the employee like these can create in the restaurant.

Came to eat dinner before Thanksgiving with my fam. It was around 5pm and luckily we got seated after waiting for 20min., which isn&#39;t bad. The food we ordered...<br><br>1. Pineapple Moscow Mule- really good! Can barely taste the vodka. It was like pineapple juice.<br><br>2. Fried Mac and Cheese- loved it! Crunchy on the outside and cheesy inside.<br><br>3. Steak Diane (medium rare)- it was a bit overcooked at some part but it was still pretty good. Mashed Potatoes was pretty good as well.<br><br>4. Chicken Marsala and Mushroom w. Bowtie Pasta (forgot the name)- more to the sweeter side but still good. <br><br>5. Southern Fried Catfish- The catfish was really soft, which is great! Mashed potatoes ofc was good. <br><br>The only thing that I didn&#39;t really like was how slow the service is. It takes a while for them to serve all the food out, so expect that to happen. Either the chefs gotta learn how to cook faster or they gotta hire more chefs. <br><br>Overall, the food was pretty good so I didn&#39;t mind about the long wait. We were too full so we didn&#39;t get the chance to try some cheesecake but next time. The total was about $88 including tax, not bad. Had to bring some leftovers home since we couldn&#39;t finish it.

This is a great place to go on a date on a budget. When I went with my boyfriend they sat us right always, so there was no wait at all. We ordered and in less than 30 minutes everything we ordered was served. All the food was nice and fresh. They give a good amount of food too we even ended up taking leftovers home.
Filet mignon... even if I asked for it well done, (which I didn&#39;t) it still shouldn&#39;t come out like this. Waste of time coming here. 1  1/2 hour wait to get a burnt steak.

My best friend brought me here for my birthday and we had a wonderful time.  We arrived on a Tuesday as soon as the restaurant opened. Our waiter was fantastic and very attentive. The food was really delicious. I thoroughly enjoyed my Mac and Cheesw burger- it was cooked to perfection and the portion lent itself to sharing. This was my first time at this particular location and I will be returning on May 19th to celebrate my daughters 12th birthday. I look forward to having another fantastic experience!

To Whom It May Concern:<br><br>I know I am not alone when I express these thoughts, but the leadership team is not qualified, trained, or equipped to handle the magnitude of responsibilities in which this restaurant produces. This is one of New York City&#39;s busiest restaurants. There has been many instances where I&#39;ve come into work before we&#39;ve even opened and 10 minutes into our shift we&#39;re busy, possibly on a wait, due to the lack of staff, and the place is a mess. I know matters such as this are hard to predict and is easier said than done when it comes to being managed, however, eventually with great leadership we shouldn&#39;t be repeating the same mistakes.<br><br>Yet they have been and it&#39;s becoming way to noticeable.  <br><br>Corporate, I&#39;m praying you bring this restaurant back to its core foundation. The kind of establishment where guest satisfaction is our highest priority. No guest should ever have to travel all around the city to our ONLY location in New York and experience a B letter grade for our health performance. Then, get themselves ready for our extensive 86 list because for the last 8 weeks were out of their favorite appetizer, drink, or entrée. We are simply much better than that and I know this for a fact. <br><br>Managers,  please treat your employees with more compassion, respect, and appreciation (not just the ones that are easy to love). You don&#39;t get credit for dealing with people who are only easy to deal with. I hope that the Queens location begins to reflect Cheesecake factory&#39;s morals and values. A company where we not only take care of our guests, but our staff as well. Too many times I&#39;ve witnessed managers demanding too much respect, but offering none in return.  In addition, this establishment also lacks communication. Communication is one of, if not the most important skill to have as a manager. I&#39;ve seen grown adults who assert themselves as professionals, come out of their professional character out of frustration in a corporate environment, and demean their employees. These actions not only affect that employee, but the community of the entire restaurant. <br><br>In conclusion, my time with Cheesecake has come to an end. I loved where I started, but unfortunately didn&#39;t like where I ended. There is so much favoritism in that establishment. I worked in Queens for over 6 months and there were stations on the floor plan I never even experienced. This alone should say more than enough. If corporate gets a hand on this, I hope that they take every word seriously. If managers read this I hope they do too. <br><br>Be more charismatic towards your employees and treat them like humans who are special and a blessing to their business. We are all special, we all have something, something different deep down inside of us to bring to the table. Managers, please embrace that and seek the potential in your employees.

Tonight&#39;s service was very bad, I don&#39;t know what but the bartenders missed their mark. The guys in the picture completely ignored us, he literally attended everyone but us at the table! I have been here when it&#39;s busy and I get it, but the bar isn&#39;t full. Very hit or miss with these bartenders.

First time going to the Queens Center Cheesecake Factory...have had their food very few times several years back and from what I remember it was fairly good. Came here specifically though for National Cheesecake Day the other day and got the Tiramisu Cheesecake which was really good. Can&#39;t really comment on much else about Cheesecake Factory here but they can use a little bit more organization how they have their take out line be more separated from their line to just order cheesecake. Other than that, that&#39;s about it...will come here again some other time to actually sit down and partake on the food.

I&#39;ve been here quite a few times and each time it has downgraded. But today has got to the be the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had here.<br><br>I ordered their Louisiana Pasta. The noodles were not even al dente. They were freaking raw. <br><br>I had the Chinese chicken salad. I could taste the dirt/ sand in the salad. They are not washing their lettuce good enough! So upsetting!<br>I also ordered the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta with no peas, guess what there were peas. I had to send it back.<br>I also ordered the margarita with less ice. The whole cup was filled with 3/4 ice.<br><br>My server had way too many tables to keep track of. I felt bad for him. This place needs to be well staffed. It is impossible for one waiter to have 5-6 tables.<br>One of the servers by the bar was really nice enough to cater to us thankfully.<br><br>For a Thursday afternoon, this is unacceptable.<br><br>I&#39;ll give some points for the waiters on trying, but poor guys are so understaffed and its so busy that your food will be fucked up.

I have been going to Cheesecake for over 17 years but times have not changed for the better. When I first stared to go to cheesecake factory it was great, the food portions where hugh and I never left hungry. <br>I would always order the SAME entree and take some food home because I was not able to finish it.<br>Now this place is designed to rip YOU off.  The serve huge plates with very small food portions. The size of their entree plates are three times the size of the food they serve you. All designed to rip YOU off. I had a entree that I paid $24 and I ate it in less than 3 minutes, that&#39;s how small the food portion is. Really. I am not a big person weighing only 150 pounds. if you are over 200 pounds I would recommend ordering two full orders for yourself. If you don&#39;t mind being ripped off then you will enjoy this place.

My daughter turned 6 on Sept 11th, as did my 22 year old niece. When my daughter realized she wasn&#39;t having a birthday party, she asked that we celebrate her birthday at the Cheesecake Factory. We have always had a pleasant experience at the restaurant in Ridge Hill, NY, which is by our home. <br>We decided to go to the Cheesecake factory at the Queens Center Mall in Elmhurst, NY because it is closer to my parents. Plus my niece (who came from New Jersey) wanted to invite her friends from Brooklyn. We arrived at the Queens Center Mall at 7:19pm, and immediately put our names on the waiting list. We were told by the concierge that due to the size of our party (9 people) they were required to tell us that the wait might be 1 to 1.5 hrs but would most likely be called within 45 min. I then decided to order a cheesecake, which would take 1.5 hrs to cook, and chill before serving. I figured &#34;perfect! We&#39;ll be done eating by then&#34;. I walked around the mall with my daughter to keep her awake and occupied. This is when I receive a call from my mom, who had decided to sit it out and wait. She realized while standing there that people who walked in AFTER US had eaten, paid their bill and walked out.  Upon looking further, she realized that half the restaurant was empty! When I headed back, my mom was conversing with a guy who is telling her, &#34;well we are understaffed. But I&#39;ll ask the manager if she&#39;s willing to send a waitress to the enclosed area to take care of you guys.&#34;  He never returned. At approx. 8:50pm (still waiting to be seated mind you), my mom asks to speak with the manager. She comes out reluctantly, to which my mom tells her that this is horrible customer service and she&#39;s not sure how she is comfortable knowing that we have been waiting for 1.5 hrs while 3/4 is the restaurant is empty. My mother then says &#34;this is horrible business tactic and we will be sure to write a review on the horrible customer service we received! How can you run a business like this?&#34;  The manager responds  &#34;if you&#39;d like to know how to run a business, I&#39;m more than happy to tell you&#34;!!!! This is when my entire family loses their mind, including myself, while my 6 year old daughter is trying to yank us out of the restaurant. I exclaim to the manager &#34;We understand that this is a Tuesday night and that business is usually slow, but as manager, it is up to you to take into consideration that is is not just Rosh Hashanah, where School was closed, but also 9/11, where a lot of families may have taken off for this Memorial Day&#34;.  <br>She then tells us we are welcome to leave HER restaurant. My mother asked for her name and she said she would be back with her business card. She Never returned. This is when my mom decides to walk around the restaurant to record the EMPTY sections (app. 44 empty seats on the right side of the restaurant and 48 in the back) By the time we left, my cake was ready; Needless to say, we didn&#39;t take it. We went across the street to Longhorn Steakhouse, where we were immediately seated. My family was physically and mentally exhausted by the debacle that had just occurred. But luckily we had a pleasant experience at Longhorn. <br>I have videos of both sections when we left at 9:05pm, from our 7:19pm arrival, still not seated. Unfortunately yelp will not allow me to upload videos. <br>This attached photo was also taken around 9:05pm

My boyfriend and I arrived a little past 9pm tonight. We were immediately seated by the hostess. Our waitress promptly greeted us and took our drink orders. It took 15 minutes for my well mannered martini to arrive. The waitress was apologetic and explained they were very busy. We ordered our meals, a cheeseburger and a bang bang shrimp and chicken dish. The food took about an hour to arrive, the waitress keeping us updated and remained attentive. Andrew the manager came over to check on us. The food eventually came out, my boyfriend was happy with the burger, my rice was crunchy and dry as if it had been reheated. I did not send it back as I was not waiting any longer to eat. The manager Andrew came over and asked if he could get me another drink. I was under the impression it would be complimentary for our troubles since he had come over twice to check and apologize for the excessive wait. Again I waited about 15-20 minutes for a martini to arrive. When we received our check we were surprised to see that we had been charged full price for everything, especially the second drink that I had expected to be on the house. Our waitress was very professional and made the best of an unpleasant situation. The manager dropped the ball completely. I usually go to the Cheesecake factory by Roosevelt Field Mall, and in the past 10 years at least, have never had a bad experience there. I was very disappointed tonight with our experience, but especially with the way Andrew the manager handled it.

First step into this restaurant and I get smacked in the face with some really bad smell probably from the floors. Service from my waiter was quick and exceptional but the appetizers took maybe 40 mins and this was during lunch time with the restaurant being empty. Not really a place I would come back for at least only in this location

This place is HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE!!!!<br>Dont ever eat here if you dont want to be upset, disappointed and get robbed. We waited an hour for our food. Waiter didnt even give us bread. Had to ask for it. He didnt give us water, had to ask for it. And Food was horrible and Customer service sucked BIG TIME!! Dont waste your time eating at this place. Better off eat across the street at Olive Garden or Red Lobster or Apple Bees around the area. If i could only give them NO STAR, that would be a perfect grade for this place. I used to love to go to The Cheesecake factory but this place just ruined that. They definitely need to re-train those waiters/waitresses/managers  again to know how to serve a GOOD customer service.

As expected the cheesecake was very good. While there, you gotta try the Bistro Shrimp Pasta, it&#39;s exceptional.<br><br>The restaurant and team is still new so it&#39;s not yet the well-oiled machine that it could be. The estimated wait of 15 minutes turned out to be 4 times longer than expected, and as for the wait staff, I&#39;d rate them a B. With a little time I&#39;d hope to move that up to an A grade.

My mom turned 94 this week, so I planned a birthday party at her favorite restaurant!!!!!<br>Mom eats there with friends all the time.<br>The party was yesterday....Lot&#39;s of mom&#39;s friends and lot&#39;s of the friends I grew up with came and everyone was soooo glad the party was at Cheesecake. We were allll so well taken care of. And everyone loved everything from the appetizers through the main dish&#39;s and the cakes for desert.<br>We all had a really good time together....especially my mom!<br><br>I&#39;m gonna take mom back sometime in the coming week.

I&#39;m really shocked at the negative reviews. I went here with friends and family a few days ago on a Sunday 1/20, and everything was absolutely amazing. The manager was so caring of everyone dining and his manners and attention to how things were going really shocked us all. It was pleasant. The food was delicious and greattt portions. We had about 5 different cheesecakes and they were all amazing as well. I can&#39;t speak for other customers experiences, but my crew and I were so satisfied with the food and service. The manager is really going above and beyond (really sorry that I forgot his name), but thank you!
Horrible wait time<br>The food arrived cold<br>And no flavor .<br><br>Only the cheesecake is fresh . <br>Go somewhere else for lunch or dinner.

I&#39;m only giving 2 stars for the delicious red velvet cheese cake.. I came for my friends birthday he had never had food from the cheesecake factory I had and thought it was great that a location was close to Brooklyn.  Boy was I wrong   ..I ordered the spicy jambalaya with pasta. When I stuck my fork in it literally picked up a lump if pasta and right away it just didn&#39;t seem right I assumed maybe I just needed to taste it.  It tasted bland and the shrimp tasted like mush rubber from the shrimp being over cooked and the chicken tasted like it needed to be sauteed a little more.  I had to get a whole other order.  I chose to get the herb crusted a salmon which was 100% better but by the time I got it I full off gas and had to take it home.  The birthday was also very un happy with his meal he had shrimp and steak Diane which was really 3 shrimp with a lot of mash potatoes and 3 small pieces of steak more like cubes.  I asked for medium well and received well done he requested it to be done over with no sauce and they got it right the second time around.  Another person from our party ordered the Jamaican shrimp with black beans and that was horrible also.  The black beans looked dry and stale the plantains were fried so black we thought it was meat and the shrimp was also over cooked.  The manager trued to rectify the situation as best as he could.  For this to be a brand new location on a non busy day the best thing was the cheesecakes!!

Terrible! my husband and I have come to this establishment since it opened as we live in the area, but today it has been a bad choice to come to this place. 1) it took more than 30 min to get our food order. 2) my salad was full of dressing, it was that crazy that I couldn&#39;t finish it. 3) the &#34;carne asada&#34; it was just disgusting, rice with no flavor, corn and steak with tons of peppercorns, extremely salty! 4) the service was a disaster to the beginning to the end, we were sitting aprox. 10 min at the bar and they even look at us, we had to call theirs attention to be able to order and after everything when I told the bartender about the food she told me that she could do nothing about it, followed with another wait to pay. 5) manager Andrew, completely useless. After what happened we tried to explain our dissatisfaction and the only thing that he could tell us is that he hopes to gives us a better service next time, what a joke! Definitely after this sour experience, I will not go back to this place, there are millions of restaurants in this area to come here to waste my time, my appetite and my money.

My wife took me to celebrate my birthday with a late lunch/ early dinner here. Ordered a Manhattan to get started, good but there was an exception. The server; Brian, very pleasent sent over the manager in order to address my concern, resulting in an outstanding cocktail. The dinner was delicious and enjoyed by all. The Carmel Macadamia cheesecake was the desert of choice. Comfortable establishment and attentive staff. Looking forward to returning in near future. Thanks for the memories.

When the food came it was disgusting. The &#34;banana&#34; has the barcode sticker on it and the chicken tastes bitter. When we told the waitress about it she was like &#34;oh you&#39;re not suppose to eat the skin anyways.&#34; And when we asked for the bill she asked if we want to pack the food and once we said no she gave us an attitude and asked why. Why? Because the freaking food is disgusting!!!

Service was terrible... took about 30 minutes to get our food and when we requested that our dessert be delivered after, our waiter never appeared again! We had to hunt around the whole restaurant for someone to bring us our cheesecake! The same thing happened with getting our check.. Food was really good though. I got the fettuccini alfredo, which was delicious and for dessert, I got the hazelnut Nutella cheesecake.

Place is trash corporate needs to take a look into this place. The worst part of all of this is that I decided to give it another go because of Cat the server which now I learned Her name is Casterin. Hello corporate guess what this place sucks! Manager Andrew is the worst manger on staff!! Super rude didn&#39;t even want to mention I had a problem b4 because of his attitude I just wanted HIM TO GO AWAY!!!!!!!!!!. Plus I don&#39;t know if you have a new head manger cause things haven&#39;t been the same since January 2017 and 18. I came back because of the great service despite everything else and the server I like CASTERIN wasn&#39;t even there.. this place just gets worse and worse. I don&#39;t even give places reviews but this place has just been such a disappointment time and time again  besides the serving staff it&#39;s ridiculous

I gave this place another chance because i believe that you should always try a place at least 2x. But both times were horrible. Not only is the food tasteless but the service is mediocre too. I definitely like Cheesecake Factory but this location does not do justice for the company. Unfortunately we will not be returning.
They would not make accomdatioms for my 80 year old disabled mother at the bar, since she could not get into the high chairs. Very disappointing.

Poor customer service, dusty lamps, dirty floors. Workers need more customer service and hospitality training because they don&#39;t seem to take pride in their job and for the franchise. Me and my husband came here lunch hour, the place was pretty empty. We got seated and for about 20min our waiter was supposed to bring us some bread and forgot about us. I had to go out of the way to ask a different waiter for some bread. Then I realized we had no plates or utensils. I then asked a different waitress for some plates. She responds, &#34;I&#39;m having the same issues I&#39;m trying to find some plates for my table too!&#34; Wrong thing to say to a paying customer. Plus, the Place was so empty for them to run out of plates, makes no sense! We left before receiving our meal, workers let us go easily without apologies or no persuasion to stay. Owners please take into consideration. These are your staff working for your business either to succeed or to fail. I have been here 3x, all three experiences was a total fail. Third one did it for me, never setting foot in this location again. I would give it zero stars. <br><br>Please clean all the lamps in the two seater tables. How can anyone eat with dust build up and floating around next to our meals?

It&#39;s a smaller Cheesecake Factory than most. Service is a bit slower than the others I&#39;ve been too. But the food is still pretty good. Great apps, tons of entries and great deserts. It&#39;s not too pricey but there can be a wait on the busy nights.

Worse Fkng experience in this location on 4/20in night 8:00pm.we usually have great time.from waiters to manager everyone acting like dumm wtf.we have to leave the place with 75% food  at table.we went with our 2children. table next to us this couple was behaving so Fkng bad like animals mofo. I did request to manager to remove us to different table and guess what manager disappear.this couple did everything next to us only thing left was getting naked shame at Cheesecake Factory for handling so poorly blind and deaf.
Too many flies... move my table twice .. maybe. Sewer issue  construction trucks with hose going in the basement...

The Cheesecake Factory is everyone&#39;s favorite restaurant. I&#39;ve been to the Queens location several times and I&#39;ve never been disappointed. I was happy to see on their menu, my all time favorite, the incredible Chicken Gumbo, a dish that I enjoyed many times when I visited The Cheesecake Factory in Kansas City, MO. I&#39;ve had from veggie burger, to shrimp platter, avocado rolls, and everything was delicious and the portions were huge. If you don&#39;t eat too much, you can easily share. Staff was always friendly and accommodated my requests. The bathroom is clean and smells good. It&#39;s location is great, inside Queens Mall.

I love Cheesecake  Factory in general. This particular location, however, is an absolute mess! Avoid at all costs! And if you MUST dine at queens center mall, choose any other spot. <br><br>You will WAIT.... WAIT.... and WAIT... some more!! The wait times are ridiculously long and the front desk staff has no concept of time. I was given an hour wait for my party and ended up waiting OVER 2 hours... When we finally got called there was a small scuffle between a server and a hostess. The hostess had a long metal spoon that she was waving around trying to provoke the male employee into hitting her first.  She then ran up and down the aisles yelling expletives and shouting about being disrespected. It was all a bit too scandalous for my taste. At no point did any staff member apologize for the disruption or the long wait. <br><br>If you are hungry and time is valuable to you, avoid this place.

This is one of my go to restaurants when I&#39;m at the mall. I was happy to see that they offer a diet or i should say clean eating Menu. The appetizers selections are huge. The portions are huge and fulfilling. My favorite appetizer is the fried Mac n cheese balls. The inside is creamy macaroni and outside with the crips brings all the flavors together. I love how they place it on top of a tomato sauce nice and creamy. My main dish was the shrimp scampi pasta. The shrimp was pan fried and i must add jumbo at that. The sauce was not to heavy. I didn&#39;t like that it was so much garlic cloves in the pasta. I requested extra sauce on the side because i dislike dry pasta. But the tomatoes and spinach brought out the flavors in the pasta. After the appetizers i barely could&#39;ve ate my entrees. I love that the menu have variations to choose from such as seafood , pasta , finger food and other dishes. The raspberry lemonade is my favorite not to sour nor sweet.  The services here was fantastic quick seating and services. The waiter was very prompt and informative. I love how the restaurant was not to dim perfect for date night and family outings. The pricing was reasonable and the dessert selection was amazing but i don&#39;t have a thing for cheesecakes.

My prerequisite for our late dinner was fast, easy good and not too expensive.  I got none of the above.  In the past, when I have been to a CF, it&#39;s been in Jersey at the mall and while not fine dining, the experience I recall was not too bad.  Here at Queens Center at 10:30 pm, there&#39;s no parking on the street so you have to park in the mall garage (and pay for parking) and have to come back outside to the street because there&#39;s no access to mall entrance during its closed hours, in order to enter the restaurant.  With a half hour to closing time, there were still about a dozen tables still eating.  Ordering is no easy feat with their extensive menu with all the calorie counts.  Psychologically, it works, at least for me that I am not apt to order something that is 2000 calories and then a cheesecake for another 2000 calories.  It definitely works as a deterrent and reminds me how fattening dairy and carbs are.  The appetizer of fried calamari was good, fried, yes but if shared, not horrible but a bit salty for my bf&#39;s taste.  I opted for the chilled grilled ahi tuna with the wasabi aioli on the side over white rice and veggies.  What I got was tuna that looked like it was cut with a butter knife, a little rough around the edges which I honestly don&#39;t mind.  Tuna prepared this way is really rare or raw and it was correct for the temp but it seems they followed the same protocol for the rice and veggies.  The first mistake was they used long grain rice which is incongruous to the dish since medium or short grain would be better match.  That&#39;s not even as important as the fact, the rice was underdone and cold.  That was my main turn off.  I noticed CF has quite a few dishes with white rice so they should have a better handle on how to prepare and serve it.  The veggies also, shiitake mushrooms, bean sprouts and snow peas were neither raw nor cooked.  It had an undercooked taste to it.  I appreciate the fact that they were probably striving for a quick Asian stir fry but they should continue striving  a little more as it wasn&#39;t cooked.  My aioli that I asked to be put on the side was not present at all but that was okay.  I am not a big fan of mayonnaise-y dressings any way.  They&#39;re also laden with extra calories.  I made a relatively low caloried dish even more low caloried as I couldn&#39;t eat the rice and didn&#39;t have the dressing.  The veggies had they been cooked a little more would have been finished.  My bf&#39;s go-to dish other than a steak, is a pasta alfredo mixed with a pesto sauce.  They accommodated by giving extra pesto on the side which he mixed in himself in his Alfredo.  From what I saw and tasted with half a strand of fettucine, he was more successful than I was in my selection.  His strawberry cheesecake was light and fresh, probably better than the iconic Junior&#39;s.  He ate half the cheesecake and brought half home which he later finished. All in all, there&#39;s only half a success story.  The service was also uneven, with no plates or utensils on the table even after the appetizer was served.  We finally flagged down another server to get a set and then our server comes later with another set saying she had to find the plates, etc. intimating that&#39;s why it took so long.  A proper resolution to this awkwardness would be, apologize and take back the second set of plates and utensils in hand.  But no, she proceeded to put down the second set so now our small 2 person table had  8 forks, four knives, 4 napkins.  That was insensitive and lazy on her part to not bring back the unnecessary sets.  Similarly, when I first sat down and as I was taking off my coat, with my hand half in the sleeve, she hovered over me to hand me the menu.  Our server needs to learn how to adjust to the customer&#39;s situation and not go through the mechanical motions.  She needs to be more intuitive.  It should be about satisfying the customer and not about her.  Let me spell it out in case management reads this and is open to some customer service advice. If the customer has no hands available to take the menu, the server should place it down on the table rather than force the customer to take it with her hand still in her coat as she taking her coat off. If the table doesn&#39;t have plates and silverware, get some quickly but if the customer already got some while you were away, don&#39;t give them the extra set in your hands for no reason other than the fact you don&#39;t want to feel like you wasted your time &#34;looking&#34; for them.  So the clincher is the meal cost us nearly $90 for 2 people.  Next time, if we need fast, good and inexpensive, I would go to the neighboring Joe&#39;s Crab or Shake Shack or even Burger King.  I am not adverse to chains but this reminds me how bad things could be.

Being from  the South (ATL) I am use to having the Cheesecake Factory, and I have never been disappointed. But going to this one for the first time since it has been in my neighborhood I was a lil disappointed. More so with the service than the food. <br>Our server just seemed as so she was a bit overwhelmed. She had a few tables, but nothing that should be out of the ordinary. It seemed as though every time I would ask her for something, you could see it may be a struggle for her to remember. With that being said, she got my appetizer wrong, and although (after I had already started to eat it), I told her and she offered to replace it but I said no b/c the one she gave me was like my second choice..It was the shrimp spring rolls(which were not great don&#39;t  get them), and I did the want to have to wait another 20 mins to get another app when my main course was about to come out.  so needless to say I didn&#39;t finish them. There were  a few other things she forgot as well or that we had to remind her of and so I felt that she just was overwhelmed. <br>Then she had to go to break and another waiter was serving us and he was way better than her. I felt bad b/c when she came back I wanted to ask to keep him instead. When the bill came I felt as though she should have taken off the app all together b/c it was her mistake even though I ate partial of it and she offered to replace it.. I just felt it should have been removed all together. <br><br>All in all it was ok but not the best first impression. I may go back and I may not. It will depend on my mood and appetite.. Lol I didn&#39;t get cheesecake, so maybe I&#39;ll go back for that one day.
Worst location when it comes to customer service.<br>The staff at the entrance are so dismissive. I&#39;m shock. Was happy to see a cheese cake factory in the area but now very disappointed.

My friends and i came to eat on Friday night to celebrate a birthday, and it was a disaster. We told our waitress we were celebrating a birthday and she informed us that the dessert for the birthday person was on the house. After we ordered our food, we waited a good 40 minutes to receive it. Once i got my plate, the food was cold so i asked the waitress to take it back to be heated again. My friends salad was missing components which were advertised on the menu and she kindly asked to have them delivered on the side. After waiting another 20 min for my food, It came back cold again. Now upset, (rightfully so) i asked for that food to be set aside and have a whole new order made because i was afraid i was going to be served the same food a third time. A manager came over and apologized for the food being placed under a heat lamp as opposed to being properly heated. By this time, my friend had received 3 ingredients that belonged on her salad to begin with, and my other friend had finished her food. I had to eat while my friends watched which was horrific. Then, the birthday girl chose her dessert and to our surprise we were charged for the birthday dessert AND for the extra meal THEY messed up to begin with. I guess the waitress changed her mind about the free dessert after this whole debacle. I rather make the long drive to long island where the staff knows more customer service. STAY AWAY FROM THIS LOCATION!!!

I was so completely disappointed which is a shame because the first time I came here, everything was wonderful. Our server was this blonde woman whose name I forgot but was sweet and attentive and made our meal there a great experience. <br><br>I raved about it to my best friend so we went back with our boyfriends and the server just seemed angry with us. She avoided eye contact and would just toss things at us and practically sprint away. To be fair, we had said we needed 5 extra minutes twice to place our order but that&#39;s still not an excuse to mistreat a group of people. She even went to the table right next to us and laughed and smiled at them and then would get to us and drop the niceness and just do everything but sprint away from us. <br><br>It was honestly so insulting when she flat out ignored my boyfriend who was trying to get her attention to let her know she had made a mistake with the bill. So not only was Erika Mae rude and neglectful, but she couldn&#39;t even be bothered to bill us properly! <br><br>When Elise momentarily took over her shift we had a much better dining experience but then Erika Mae was back and we were literally taken aback at how poorly we were being treated. It was as if we had hurt her long ago and she was getting petty revenge. <br><br>I don&#39;t know what crawled up her ass and died but I know I&#39;m never going back and if anyone gets her as a server, they should request someone else because she cant even claim to have been having a bad day when she was treating everyone else nicely but us.

Top restaurant 1st place of Cheesecake! There are definitely hard choices to make when deciding weather to eat, drink and or just dessert. It&#39;s always hard for me to choose. Good luck to you! I must extend my Appreciation to a Hostess name Danielle that was working this evening, and having a sharp vision. There was another Hostess who offered, and acted as if she was concerned about my seating. I told her I was thinking of take out and I said let me see. I stepped one foot towards the delicious dessert menu which is a big billboard. I pulled my foot back, looked at the Hostess and said I&#39;m ready to be seated. A woman, and her daughter walked and was literally by my side, and stated &#34; I&#39;m looking for a table for two &#34;. As previously stated I was speaking with the Hostess before the woman walked up. The Hostess  began engaging in a full conversation with this woman, and reaching to pick up menus as she was saying I have a table for you. It was at this point when Danielle asked me &#34; Excuse me are you being helped &#34; I  stated &#34; I sure thought I was, and I asked Danielle did you just see that, and she answered Yes. I was extremely glad she witnessed  this, and lead us to ours seats first. The food was fantastic as usual. As we were exiting I had to ask Danielle her name and Once Again Thank her for noticing what her co worker was doing. I sincerely hope The Cheesecake Factory realize she certainly handled The Situation Quickly and Professionally. I Believe she saw the Instant Anger, and I was about to Explode. Thanks Again Danielle! A FEW OF THESE STARS ARE FOR HAR AS WELL!

Four stars for the food. It&#39;s a chain, so you already know what you&#39;re getting. One of my favorites is the garlic creamy pasta - it is sooo delicious and hearty. And, of course, the cheesecake is amazing.<br><br>The wait for our food was just insane here! On a Wednesday afternoon, after the dinnertime rush, my party of three waited over an hour for our meal - two pasta dishes and a chicken sandwich. Appetizer came out right away, but it just took absolutely forever for our food to come. There was really no apology from the server or anyone else or even any update while we waited. I would have loved to be comped for my Cheesecake for the extremely long wait, but alas, no.

Honestly this review is for my past experience like long time ago. Come across this restaurant on yelp so I want to share my experience. It was packed and I wait about an hour which is fine that they told me already, however, after seated we waited long time to get served and then the waiter disappeared. We finally gets our appetizer and were enjoyed the food. Waiter come and Told us they change shift and intro a new waitress will serve us. Which at that Time I already ordered main course. Guess what happen next, we wait an hour that we thought they are busy and I&#39;m kind person who doesn&#39;t like to rush people, and I saw tables coming after us finished their food already and our waiters is nowhere to be seen.  And I finally get someone to find out waitress, she has no idea what I ordered or the order were never put into process. I was so piss and they get the manager, all they do just put your order on the top of line and make you wait. I&#39;m so hungry and mad and leaves the restaurant!

I give it four stars simply because the food and atmosphere overall is good. We just made some bad appetizer choices. I haven&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory in about 5 years and it hasn&#39;t changed much which is a plus for me. I liked the food then and I enjoyed it now. The drinks were weak, needed more liquor but was good but not for $12.50. The server was very nice but not attentive at all. Over it was a good experience and I will return eventually...lol

After reading most reviews I was starting to get disappointed and worry since I wanted a good time dinner for my mom and our friend but I prayed to God and everything was awesome except for the beginning. First when I entered an employee in the front was not friendly, when I approached her to ask her where do I go to get a table for 3, she seemed busy in a computer and she just responded quickly without any eye contact or smile, &#34;just go up ahead to the lady&#34;. Up ahead obviously wasn&#39;t enough detail since I had to ask another employee passing by where can I register for a table for 3 and he pointed to the direction we should go. <br>Finally when I was attended they ask for my name and give you a small rectangle device that vibrates and flashes red lights when your table is ready. I was able to wander inside the mall but only through that first floor and up to jcpenny since the connection of that device only reaches that far. They said that I would wait approximately 30 minutes but I just waited about 15 minutes. <br>The food was great and the virgin Piña Colada had a small different taste than usual but it was still good and the food did not take long to arrive at our table. First our appetizer came quickly which we ordered Fried Calamari and then our entree plates came which my mom and our friend kept saying how great was the new York, well done Steak.<br>The waitress that took care of us was very friendly and attentive to our care and I have no complain of her<br>Overall it was a wonderful experience especially since we sat by the window and could see outside the streets, this area of the restaurant we were placed was a long narrow rectangular shape but it was a cool area too.

Inefficient seating system, especially if you arrive around 6:30pm. No way to make reservations over the phone or online, so you could be waiting for 50+ minutes.<br><br>Decent food, nothing particularly special. Large portions but feels overpriced for the quality.

No wonder why it looks like they lost a lot of customers even Friday night. It used to be really crowded before. Everything is clear after I went there this evening. My friends and I (only 3 of us) ordered beverage ;2 glasses of water and 1 regular lemonade and appetizer first. It took about 15 minutes to get our drinks. I thought I didn&#39;t order anything complicated. The food was alright but it used to be better. I knew it was busy for a server who was in charge of a lot of table but at least he should check if we needed anything once in a while. We had to ask for refill even though he walked pass our table so many times (maybe it was too dark).<br><br>However, they really pissed me off after they served us a dessert which I shared with my friends. Being a server needs to have common sense as well. When you put the plate on the table and saw there was no fork or spoon...how could customers eat it? Thus, I had to ask other server for spoons. He had gone forever and never came back with the spoons. After waiting for a few minutes, I asked another guy. He looked for them at the drawer near the register....unfortunately, it seemed like they ran out so instead of figuring out what to do, he just stood there without doing anything and walked away. Seriously!!! Until our real server came, I asked him for spoons, he looked for them at the same drawer just different level,he found 2 which was alright because only 2 of us shared it. <br><br>I was very disappointed how they gave us the service, standard of the taste. Maybe the managers need to rethink how to manage their responsibilities which seemed to be too much for them to handle and didn&#39;t look happy enough to work by heart. I know it&#39;s busy but service mind is also important.

I was advised not to go to this location, but I had to try it my self. It&#39;s a new location so as expected the Decor is beautiful, but today for the first time I ordered my normal take out choice &#34;Jamaican black pepper shrimp&#34; and when I got home to my surprise these cheap bastards gave me half the shrimp I usually get at the Westbury location. It&#39;s like they went over they&#39;re budget so know I have to sacrifice with my portions. I swear they&#39;re isn&#39;t a shortage of shrimp in New York so I can&#39;t figure out a logical reason for this. What&#39;s worse is when I finally decided to eat the food, it was over cooked.<br>First and last time. So disappointed.

Came here with my family for my birthday dinner and had a great time. My server was attentive but not over bearing and the food was delicious. I look forward to coming back and would definitely recommend coming here.

People were nice, polite and accommodating at least but quite a few mistakes with our meal though. <br>We got &#34;beet salad with goat cheese&#34; without any goat cheese; cold fried calamari, with raw batter inside. <br>After a long wait with no entrees, we were told there were no more mashed potatoes and gluten-free pasta and told to pick alternatives. Then when we were ready, wait, the mashed potatoes were done so forget it. Instead of gluten-free pasta, we ordered an omelet but it was dry that I thought the egg was a tortilla. <br>Medium burger came out well-done and ordered &#34;crispy chicken with cheese&#34; but was given a grilled one without cheese. <br>The Thai coconut chicken didn&#39;t look appetizing especially with the lighting, didn&#39;t look as on the menu and didn&#39;t taste good. The pineapple chicken didn&#39;t have much pineapple and the pasta with it was already dry on the top. Is it bec the food was waiting too long to be brought to the table? <br>Corrections were made but with all the waiting, some people weren&#39;t eating and our dinner ended up too long. Ok if comped parking but we had to pay mall parking

Only posting 5 stars because we had an amazing waitress Melissa. She&#39;s awesome and makes the experience great. Other than that the food sucks completely but the cheesecake is bomb. I obviously had the low carb strawberry and it really hit the spot. <br><br>Will not be back.

My wife, kids and I just walked out shortly after being seated because we were so disgusted.   About 5 minutes after being seated, we were approached by a staff member and was asked to pick up our feet because they wanted to mop some orange vomit like substance off the floor. After a few wipes with a dirty mop it only ended up spreading more of it and that killed our appetite.

Great service and atmosphere! Our waiter was super friendly and patient. The food took a while to come, but it&#39;s understandable due to Sunday&#39;s busy brunch schedule. Loads of food options on the menu :)

We had a good experience dining here. We came around 2:30pm and it was still pretty crowded but we got seated after 5 mins. The host was nice so as the servers. Nice ambiance too. <br><br>The food was nice and tasty. The full portion is really big. Will come back here again.

Sitting here right now having a hard time. They brought out a strawberry drink which decorating strawberry  was rotten! I didn&#39;t realize until I gave it a regrettable bite ewww my bad for not checking I guess ... they brought a beer for my husband without a glass to pouring and drink. No extra napkins until I ask for it. No water ... I asked for it and has been ten minutes and water is still not here.... the appetizer was good but nothing to write home about it.... we won&#39;t be coming here. 1 hour later: food was yucky. Service was soooo bad that we tipped 10%. It was the first time my hubby does that. His standard is 18 to 20+ % . So yeah this place sucks .

Went there for dinner, it was ok, nothing too special, just the basic classic franchise restaurant. Service was ok, the waiter checks up on us every now and then. Food was also average, I personally like the jambalaya noodle they have. The only reason I rated this with one star was because I ordered takeout after dinner for my dad, the Thai chicken lettuce wrap, and when I got home and gave it to my dad there was no chicken, just lettuce... and I live in Brooklyn so no way am I going back there for the chicken.<br><br>TL;DR: make sure you double check your take out before leaving just to make sure they have everything.

I am so mad, I felt obliged to open an account and share my experience.<br>Today, December 15, 2016 at 5pm I went to this location of the cheesecake factory yo buy a whole cheesecake.<br>It took them 40 minutes! FORTY MINUTES, to be able to give 1 cheesecake.<br><br>The exact same cheesecake is half the price at the Costco which is 300 feet away!<br><br>So,if you want to wait 40 minutes to just get a cheesecake to go (I wonder how many weeks would they need if it was a dine-in order) feel free to go.<br><br>I will continue buying Cheesecake factory&#39;s cheesecakes, but I will never go back there.<br>40 minutes for a cheesecake, do not get surprised when you run out of business. Because with that attitude, you won&#39;t last long...

Came today for lunch. Orderer appetizers and two main. The whole reason for the two stars is that my wife ordered a chicken/avocado and mango salad but they made a mistake and brought her a Caesars. After we told them it was wrong they took it to change it. After waiting 15 more minutes they brought us another salad which again had 3 small pieces of chicken and pineapple! So Yeah, i think that says it all. Shame cause its a nice place and the service wasn&#39;t bad.

The three stars is for the foods only.<br><br>I am very disappointed with my waitress, very impatient and rude, name starts with N. When she first came over to the table, we want to start ordering the drinks first, we took a few seconds to discuss an alternative because they don&#39;t offer what we request. Then she got impatient and said we need more time she will come back, she just left and without giving us any recommendation on the menu. When we told her we are ready to order, she just said ok and left us waiting for another 20minute. That&#39;s been 30 minute passed since we sat down. Finally the food came in another half hour, it was two other different servers who serve the food, and they are very nice.<br><br>When we finished, our waiter came back, we asked for desert, and she started to take the plates away, she took the first plate, and then she have her hand there and waiting for us to hand her the other plate. I&#39;m have never been to a restaurant that a customer have to serve the waiter/waitress.<br><br>I understand it&#39;s a Holiday, and it is busy. But the waitress make me feel like I&#39;m not welcoming at the place, very unprofessional. We still give a 15% tip, only because we don&#39;t know if they share the tips. But I really don&#39;t think she deserve it.

Check my Yelp profile-- I rarely ever give any restaurant a 1 star but this Queens Center Mall location is the exception. I am beyond upset with the manager at this establishment. I was seated promptly and then told by the hostess that I &#34;took a table that wasn&#39;t mine&#34; after she called me, took my buzzer, sat me at the table and distributed the menu to my party. She said there was a party of 7 ahead of me that our table was originally meant for them and I calmly told her I will not get up as this was an error on their part and we are already seated and I&#39;d be happy to discuss this with a manager, thinking that a manager--- you know a well trained staff member in customer service would see this as an opportunity to quickly resolve a small issue. The manager who came up to me did not want to disclose her name to me but she was a woman with dark brown shoulder length hair. She was automatically defensive and condescending telling me that I should have known the table was not mine if my buzzer wasn&#39;t vibrating and as soon as I responded with, &#34;well if that&#39;s the case, the fault is on the hostess who is an employee and trained to know the buzzer should have been vibrating when she received it from my hands and proceeded to sit our party at the table.&#34; I didn&#39;t even finish my sentence when she literally walked away from me!! Everyone at my table was shocked that this was a &#34;manager&#34;. The worse part is that this was my birthday dinner (which I somehow managed to tell her before she left me mid-sentence). <br><br>The only reason I stayed was because the server was mortified, she came over to our table to apologize on behalf of the managers behavior. She listened to me, told me she didn&#39;t really know what to do but she&#39;ll bring us some water in the meantime. I appreciated her validation that this was totally crazy.
