I even asked her to call the manger back so we can finish our conversation and I literally watched her go back and the manager refused to come back to our table. She made our server wait 20 minutes before taking our order but in the mean time our server brought us bread and refilled our drinks as needed. I will say this again, the server ELENA was amazing and if it wasn&#39;t for her we would have left with my Birthday dinner completely ruined. <br><br>I will be sharing this review on every forum and Cheesecake contact because this &#34;manager&#34; who refused to give me her name and tried to refuse me service should not have a job much less a title as a manager.

Do not order DoorDash!!! Do not do take home!!!! Trust me!!! Where do I start?  I have eaten at this location a few times and the experiences have been great!  I decided to order through DoorDash a Sunday afternoon.  I expect the food to not be hot... it&#39;s delivery in NY-traffic- one way streets, 2 miles takes about 25 minutes! But to be missing items, a whole meal and when I call the manager Andrew (which didn&#39;t want to provide his last name or initial), he could not help us! He said that they have a contract with DoorDash and they are not responsible! I call DoorDash, it&#39;s an automated system and the number is no longer in service once you received your meal! So my daughter&#39;s meal never arrived and had to go get another meal for her around the corner!!! I really thought Cheesecake would get it right! They usually good about it but there is always a manager that doesn&#39;t follow the principles of the company and think that it&#39;s their own business! Shame on you!  Unbelievable!!! Yes 6 days later waiting on the items missing

First and foremost I would have to say that you should avoid this location. The hospitality here is subpar. It took almost 10 minutes for us to get water (we didn&#39;t receive refills for the rest of our stay), another 5 minutes after that for our cocktails and ultimately a server who didn&#39;t even bring us shared plates or resetted the table. <br><br>We received our bread at the table 2 minutes prior to getting our appetizers. For appetizers we had guacamole and calamari. The guacamole was very refreshing whereas the calamari was VERY salty. If you&#39;re a fan of calamari, refrain from ordering it here. <br><br>For my entrée I had the garlic noodles with chicken, it didn&#39;t have asparagus or mushrooms as it stated on the menu, but I had no time to even let my server know because he was never anywhere to be found. In addition, the noodles were very bland, dry and needed more sauce. By the time I saw my server I was already done eating and mentally checked out.<br><br>I&#39;ve worked in the industry for years and this has to be the one of the worst restaurants as far as hospitality goes. Whatever happen to adhering to the steps of service or the MOD touching a table to ensure their guests are fine? <br><br>RECAP<br>Appetizer: The guacamole was refreshing whereas the calamari was almost inedible. <br>Entrée: Subpar and isn&#39;t a direct reflection on what&#39;s on the menu description. <br>Hospitality: The server was nowhere to be found and our table wasn&#39;t resetted with shared plates.<br><br>Don&#39;t expect to get what you pay for or read on the menu. VERY inconsistent.
Good experience at the restaurant. I saw 8 people celebrating their birthdays on one night. That&#39;s amazing ~~

If I can give this location half a star I would ! <br>This has to be the worst service I have experienced at any of The Cheesecake Factory locations! Not only did my party and I wait for 2 hours while waiting we heard servers complaining about customers! Everything was just COMPLETELY DISORGANIZED! When we were seated our service was horrible we had to ask for utensils more the 5 times. Our food took about 1 hour then when I received my food it was cold. This wait staff and management were literally a shit show. Being so close to my home I really hoped for this place to be as amazing as the other restaurants have been ! Big disappointment !

I went to the new location attached to the Queens Center Mall. The atmosphere was great on a Thursday night. Half hour wait but I was catching up with a close friend so it&#39;s all good. Restaurant and bathroom were clean and relaxed. Service was very good. Very nice waitstaff, not pushy and gave us space. The food was mediocre; truly just ok. I had mozzarella sticks which were squares as well as zucchini sticks. Greasy and reminiscent of bar food. I looked forward to dessert. I had Chris&#39; cheesecake which was chocolate, coconut, and chocolate mousse. In reality it was German chocolate filling on top of cheesecake with a dollop of chocolate mousse- mouse was very sweet. Food was quite underwhelming, however,  if I was drinking it would be perceived as better. I will go back bc it&#39;s close to my house and is a cool date spot.

With the exception in Honolulu, I really can&#39;t say much for all other locations. The quality of food and service has really declined from the last time I visited the chain. My daughter was very excited upon learning the grand opening of a Cheesecake factory in NY! What 4 yr. old doesn&#39;t get excited over sweets &amp; desserts? <br><br>The opening week was in late Oct. That was a major disappointment. It was chaotic with expected wait times to over 2 1/2 hrs. The host was overwhelmed and end up telling customers to come back next week. We end up grabbing a cheesecake for our daughter to go. And, that was a total nightmare! A single line form for ordering and another one for pick-up. Two cashiers were ringing all the customers while the pick-up line crammed all customers into the back and front of the exit doors. This push into the other line where customers were waiting to be seated. There was no management or structure whatsoever. Staff was flying all over the place. It was a zoo!<br><br>We made the trip and return in the next two weeks. We ask for a table for 3. The host told us it would be a 40 minute wait. It turned into an 1 1/2 hr. wait. After you&#39;re called in when signaled on the device, you have to wait on another line to get seated. Once we were seated, the assigned waitress disappeared. As we approach one of the waitstaff for a manager. The waitress returned and gave us menus and ask if we want to place our drinks in addition to a bread basket. After our drinks were placed, she disappeared for over 20 minutes. The table across from us got seated after we did. They already got their order in with the bread basket and drinks. When she returned, she offered no apology for the wait. She hurriedly asked if we were ready to place our order. Once she took our order, she was gone! We had to flag her twice to ask for utensils and bread. Regular utensil was given to our daughter that is 4. She could barely manage with the big silverware. <br><br>The food was ok. I had the salmon. The sides were drenched in butter. My daughter had the chicken sliders with the fries. The sliders were less than appetizing. The chicken seem to have been left in the fryer for awhile. My husband had the burger with a salad. He was given fries instead. Normally, we would had asked to speak to a supervisor/manager on the side. Unfortunately, no one appears to know who the manager is as staff frantically runs back and forth. With our waitress disappearing half of the night, it was nearly impossible to address anything. We placed the last order for dessert- an ice cream sundae for our daughter and a cheesecake to go. Our waitress again hurriedly put the check on our table. We did not ask for the check since we were waiting for the dessert. The ice cream sundae had 3 scoops of vanilla and huge dollops of whipped cream. There was no hot fudge or cherry on top that kinda thing for a kid. We concluded this visit was the worse that you can possibly get from a waitress. I don&#39;t think we plan on returning! <br><br>A side note to management: please slow down the pace with the staff in the restaurant! It causes the environment to be more hectic and frantic than it really is. There are enough tables to seat everyone. It has to be addressed and organized better. It would nice for the waitstaff to remember and check in their tables once in awhile. The front has to be managed better for pick-up orders. Form a line to the side and have another cashier pack up the order so that it&#39;s ready instead of ringing customers back and forth. And, the wait times have to be managed better, give a more accurate wait time to the customers. This gives customers a false pretense that it&#39;s this amount of time when it&#39;s closer to 2 hrs. or more.

The Cheesecake Factory is hands down one of my favorite restaurants but I was hesitant to go to this one because the city ruins everything but my mom was craving the Godiva cheesecake so we went.  <br><br>The wait was 50 minutes. At the entrance of the restaurant someone had spilled frozen yogurt but no one cleaned it up. There was only one bench for people to sit and wait and someone was begging for change in that area. We were seated in this add-on area to the restaurant where the heat did not reach and had to sit with our coats on. <br><br>The waitress was extremely slow we had to look for her several times. After waiting 15 mins for silverware to butter our bread the server informed us that there was no silverware available in the entire restaurant. <br><br>The food was amazing. But again I had to wait for the waitress to bring me the condiments for my burger. My mom enjoyed her salmon salad. <br><br>Be sure to ask for your Cheesecake either in the beginning or middle of your meal so you can have it by the time you finish your food or so you can take it too go. <br><br>My conclusion was too never step foot in there again and stick to the one in Long Island, but my mom says we should give it another try... We will see.

I hope this experience here it&#39;s all because they are relatively new. <br>Order came backwards, meaning main plate first and then appetizers.<br><br>Asked for Thai wraps with extra chicken. The extra were none. Had to ask for a manager, then got our extra chicken. <br><br>Gave us the San Pellegrino water bottles on their own, no glasses. We do not sip straight from the bottle, PLEASE! Had to ask for water glasses. Came back with a hock wine glass, really?!?!<br><br>Waitress seemed sweet, everything we asked for her response was &#34;sure&#34;, but failed mostly on her delivery.<br><br>Has to get better. Although I&#39;m 10 mins away, I think next time I&#39;d rather go to the Long Island one.
It&#39;s a real good restaurant in ELM.For the environment,service all of them are pretty nice.Recommend the chicken mango avocado salad .But the air conditioner was too cold!LOL ...

Cheesecake Factory has good food. That cannot be disputed but the service at the queens blvd / queens center mall location is HORRIBLE ! <br><br>Three different times of horrendous service. To he point where I could&#39;ve and should&#39;ve walked out !! <br><br>I think I will just take the drive and head to Roosevelt field and go to grand Lux !

I had an absolutely wonderful time here with Matt and Andrew! Both bartenders were extremely attentive and made sure our glasses were never empty! My mom and I had the guac which we absolutely loved! It was fresh and flavorful! We also had the potstickers, chicken sliders and shrimp spring rolls everything was amazing!! We were hesitant to come since Cheesecake Factory is new to our neighborhood but I have to say I was impressed! Thank you for the great time!!
I&#39;m a fan of the establishment but the service at this location is terrible. The bread was stale, the waitress was fresh, and it took close to an hour for the food to come out.

Only good thing about my experience was that me and my friends were seated quickly. Aside from that, this place is a hard pass for me. Food took about 40 mins to arrive and the plates were hot but the food was not. None of me and my 4 friends finished our food. Pasta was cold, rice was uncooked, meat was weird. Not to mention my mojito tasted like pure juice and when I then ordered a margarita as my second drink she brings me.... a mojito. I gave up at that point and just asked for the tab so we could leave.

They never have Mac and cheese balls , like ever they always &#34;run out&#34; . The bread is always cold, and I can never locate my waiter. I&#39;ve given them countless chances this will be my last. I prefer any other cheese cake in New York. Try the one in ridge hill excellent service every time.

Thought I&#39;d give this Cheesecake factory another try after waiting 40 minutes food last time. <br><br>This time waiting for a table only took 30<br>minutes but my food took 1 hour after I order which is terrible. <br><br>Then the waitress told us since we are waiting so long we have a complimentary cheesecake on her. Well its was nice of her but this is by far the my worst experience at cheesecake factory. Even for coming here on a Tuesday. The food wasn&#39;t too great either.. very dry. <br><br>You probably have better luck eating at the food court downstairs or driving to Long Island to eat at Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t recommend you to come  here.

Came here for lunch. I use to love going to their location in Long Island. I didn&#39;t like anything I ordered. Everything was too salty.  Best thing about the whole experience was the passion fruit margarita and service.

When we first went about a year ago it was the afternoon and the lighting was fine and the food was good.  We went back for my wife&#39;s birthday this year at night and boy what a horrible difference a year makes.  First we needed our cell phones to light up the menus because the lighting was too low.  Then our daughter&#39;s food did not come out with ours and we had to wait an additional 15 minutes for her MAC AND CHEESE.  That&#39;s right.  Mac and cheese.<br><br> Also, I dont know who taught the cooks to make shepherd&#39;s pie, but it is not served on a deep plate with steak strips.  Seriously.  It&#39;s a bowl and ground beef.

Went for happy hour after doing a little shopping. We sat ourselves at a high top by the bar. I&#39;m not into corporate restaurants but we were hungry and it was right there. The server came and she was very nice and took our order. We had some HH drinks and Apps. The chicken potstickers were a little too salty,the Vietnamese spring rolls were yummy and light tasting and lastly the spinach dip which I wasn&#39;t a fan of,but my girls devored it. Overall it was ok,nothing special wont be back.

Horrible experience! Waited 1hr to get a table, 1hr and half to get the food and 20min to get cheesecake to go. When we were asking where was the food after 40min they kept saying it will be ready in 10min. No one came to us to apologize the long wait we had to ask for the manager which he only said &#34;it not your fault I will go get your food right now&#34;. Frozen cheesecake, burn food and long wait. So unprofessional, absolutely no sense of costumer service. Everyone here need more training. Never again!

The gods have answered Queens residents&#39; prayers! My friend and I came for lunch on opening day, and we were very impressed with the service and the neatly organized layout. We were told 20 minutes but seated in 10 minutes.<br><br>Our server was on point and courteous. We didn&#39;t want to eat huge entrees, so we ordered 3 small plates/appetizers: chicken samosas, crab bites and the Vietnamese shrimp summer rolls. All were great but I liked the crab bites the best. We shared the pumpkin pecan cheesecake, and it was divine. Complimentary warm bread and butter were great too. Yelpers, we no longer have to trek to Long Island.

The food was good and our server was very helpful. There is a subway station right outside, so you can get here in 25 mins from central Manhattan. The cheesecake is so good and never disappoints. The portions are large and tasty - you won&#39;t be disappointed.

I love Cheesecake Factory so I was happy one was coming to Queens. <br><br>This location is smaller than the LI location. Located inside of Queens Center Mall, on the lower level. You can access the restaurant via the mall or the street. I came here two days before Christmas and the mall was packed so I figured so would the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>The wait time for a table was 30 minutes which wasn&#39;t bad considering it was a table for 3. The staff were nice &amp; courtesy. Our waiter Henry was very nice, funny, and fast. Upon sitting down at the table Henry, approached us, introducing himself and offering meal &amp; drink recommendations. I went with the big grande burrito &amp; boy was it huge and a typhoon mix drink. My mom had bang bang shrimp dish with coconut and my aunt had Chicken &amp; Shrimp gumbo. I have to say all 3 dishes were great. The burrito was huge &amp; could feed at least three people. The gumbo was very favorable and the bang bang shrimp had a sweet coconut flavor to it. Of course we took Cheesecake home, I had the Reese&#39;a pieces Cheesecake. Omg it taste good especially since I&#39;m not suppose to have. <br><br>On another please do something about the floor. While walking to the bathroom the floor was kinda of slippery. I had to walk my mom to the bathroom because she was afraid she would fall.

waited an hour for a table for 2 on a saturday afternoon. <br><br>we ordered:<br><br>-chicken madeira with mashed potatoes (very good, but was a bit cold when i got it)<br>-steak diane with mashed potatoes (steak was okay, but i asked for it to be medium and got it well done)<br>-miso salmon with sauteed spinach (no complaints, fresh fish)<br>-mac and cheese side (best part of the meal)<br><br>we also asked for extra bread. the multigrain brown bread was nice and soft and slightly sweet, and the white bread was crunchy and great with butter.<br><br>we were too full for dessert, but i was eyeing the chocolate cake the entire time hehe

I had the most amazing experience at The Cheese Cake Factory! Our server was the perfect definition of customer service! I couldn&#39;t have asked for a better person person, thank you so much to Danielle B Table 0353!!!! Shout out to you girl ! I hope we get out every time!

First time at Cheesecake Factory. Hands down wonderful experience, servers Noela and evi were amazing on their attentiveness,professionalism and dedication to my dining experience. Definitely worth checking out. Great job Cheesecake Factory!

Went one saturday afternoon with my girlfriend and best friend. The three of us had a wonderful time! The food was very good and out waitress was super nice and attentive.<br><br>Only downside to this place is that the wait can be fucking brutal. We got lucky on our first visit having only a 40 minute wait time. Our second visit, we were told it was going to be 2 hours for a table. Sadly had to walk away from that and order some cheap takeout instead.

Went to the Queens Cheesecake Factory for the mac &amp; cheese burger but they were out of Mac &amp; cheese ... As disappointed as I was, that&#39;s not why I gave them the 1 star, my server brought the dirtiest most disgusting eating utensils I was ever served in a restaurant in my life. ... Not only were they not wrapped in a napkin, he held them in his bare hand. &amp; I mean they were sticky &amp; visibly filthy with gigantic food stains!  ... I asked a different server passing by if I could get clean utensils, she came back and just dropped another dirty set on the table with her bare hand as well. ... It took a THIRD server to finally bring a clean set wrapped in a napkin.
Great atmosphere large menu selection you can order just about anything. Comfotable setting fast and friendly service. Don&#39;t forget dessert Cheescake to die for.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, I truly do and I won&#39;t let this bad experience stop me from going elsewhere. But I will say this is by far one of the worst experience I&#39;ve had at a Cheesecake Factory establishment. <br><br>We came to the mall to shop around for my little SIL birthday. We know this place can get busy so we came by to ask for the wait time for a table of 7, the hostess told us about an hour thirty mins to 2 hours! <br><br>At first we were hesitant but my little SIL hasn&#39;t ate here before so we decided to wait. Knowing it may not be that long. We waited some by shopping around. Came back in 45 mins and our table is ready. <br><br>Service is horrible. Let me compare this experience to going to see a doctor. You go in and you have people who come in and out of your room to remind you that the doctor IS coming. In this case it&#39;s the manager. The waitress kept coming back and forth to give us our drinks to take our orders but after that we didn&#39;t see her for a good 25 mins. She then comes and tells us the kitchen is working on the soup and she didn&#39;t forget. Honestly by this time we were full from our two baskets of bread my uncle said we should just leave. I told my little SIL that she should&#39;ve stuck with just going to hot pot, her initial decision but her sister persuaded her about CF. <br><br>We sat at our table for 30 or 35 mins our food comes but the soup doesn&#39;t. By now the doctor comes in, the manager. He ask us how the food is, well we just got it so we didn&#39;t get a bite yet. He says the soups were cancelled since we told them.we didn&#39;t want it anymore after we got the food. We say yes, just to forget about it. He then says ok, enjoy. No apology for the shit service. The long wait on food, on soup on getting our drinks. So it&#39;s whatever. We know we won&#39;t be coming back here ever. Then the doctor (manager) leaves. So we waited a total of 2.5 hours including waiting time to wait some more inside and see the doctor for 2 mins. Didn&#39;t know I was paying with health insurance tonight. On a serious note this is the experience here tonight is exactly the one you would experience at a hospital or doctors office. Either way you lose. <br><br>They ended up wanting to give the soups for free to us. We couldn&#39;t enjoy it because we had all this big portion sized food in front of us. <br><br>The food 1/5 stars. No flavor. They got an order wrong but by this time we didn&#39;t even want to say anything anymore. It&#39;s ridiculous!!!! <br><br>Wished we would have just stuck with hot pot tonight. Easy in and out and worth the money, self serve. <br><br>Never again.

I&#39;ve been here a few times since they opened including lunch for my daughter&#39;s birthday. Great service and food is exactly the same as any other Cheesecake Factory. Yes it does get crowded but that&#39;s expected for a mall restaurant.

Went here with my mom for dinner before a show. Thought we had some time to kill and ordered steak tacos. Right after we order mom checks the tickets again and realizes our show is at 7pm rather than 8pm. <br>Cue panic. We suddenly have one less hours. Thank god Tim was our waiter. We explained the situation (having only order moments before) and he hopped to it. We got out right on time. I so appreciate his attention to detail and care in handling our needs. I know how much it must suck to have a table suddenly have very strict time constraints but he was so sweet and wonderful about the whole thing.<br>My only wish is that they made reservations, I called today so mom and I could have a less rushed experience here and apparently seating is on arrival. Maybe it would drop the wait time some of there were reservations available.<br>Also, the steak tacos were INCREDIBLE. They deserve their own review!

I would have to say the scenery and the customer service is the best they got because the food and the cheese cake is not it!!! The place is extremely beautiful with nice detailing a seats and the workers, which I am sure work hard and maybe tired, have great personalities.<br>I went here out of hunger so you know if I was hungry and the food still didn&#39;t taste good it wasn&#39;t good food. I was skeptical to order food with seeing pictures or many good reviews. I decided to ask the waiter, Anthony, who was extremely professional and great spirit, what was good. I don&#39;t necessarily eat meat (been trying to stop), so I was deciding between three shrimp pasta dishes. He said the shrimp scampi was MADDDDDD GOOD, so deal that&#39;s what I got. The food came quite quickly and it wasn&#39;t much on my plate it was honestly the look. It was six standing shrimp with a little bit of pasta in the middle, and the shrimp had the tail on and had chucks of garlic in the pasta. ‍‍. No one came around to check and see if I were enjoying it or anything but I didn&#39;t really have a problem with that. Then of course being that it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory I would think they have a restaurant but their specialty is for cheesecake much like the Sugar factory food not all that but known for their great dessert, candy, and sugar drinks. Cheesecake wasn&#39;t even all that and I have the fresh strawberries with cheesecake. Wasn&#39;t impressed with the food, best thing was the bread and lemon water.
Skip this place if you can half an hour sitting and still no drinks seems like they take on more business then they can handle. For the price of the food the service should match.

I am so happy that this place has opened up close by. <br>To start off the staff is wonderful, like the best customer service I have ever experienced. Everyone is super friendly and courteous. The place was nice and clean. The food was just perfect. The portions were generous and filling. The chicken madeira really was extraordinary...soft tender and delicious. The appetizers were really large almost a meal by themselves. Overall wonderful experience and so happy such a wonderful restaurant has opened here. From service to food everything was spot on.

This was my first experience going to any Cheesecake factory. The location is so convinent and easy to get to. Expecting a long wait, it was only 30 mins for 2 people and a manager walked up to us and said if we want there are two spaces open at the bar. So we were immediately seated which was great! The bartender Terri was really sweet, attentive and courteous. Our long island iced teas were DELICIOUS and she made them with obvious expertise. We were a bit annoying, asking for things like napkins, the menu back and utensils but she got them to us right away.<br><br>The decor and amtmosphere was really really nice for a chain resturant. I was expecting an applebees type of vibe and it was more of a fancy 5 star in manhatten type of place. The bar was stacked and gorgeous.<br><br>The mashed potato tots were delicious and the firecracker shrimp was just tiny fried shrinp w a delicious chipotle aioli.<br>I ordered the southern fried catfish with mashed potatoes, corn, green beans and remoulade. Amazing!!! Very large porportions! I got three pieces of fish a healthy serving of mash and the remoulade was fantastic. The absolute star of the night was definitely rhe mac and cheese though!! Me and my friend were raving about it all night. It was cheesy, crispy and flavorful. Honestly AMAZING.<br><br>The whole experience was really awesome. Great food, service and atmosphere. I will definitely go back.

I came here to experience a pre opening dinner. The sever was very attentive but he can work on meal placement. Don&#39;t place the drinks on top of the meals and if the appetizers are not finished don&#39;t bring the entrees. I had the buffalo blasts for my appetizer which was a different take on a buffalo wing. I recommend having the boneless option. For my entree, I ordered the shrimp and chicken gumbo it wasn&#39;t bad but the rice was hard. The beer that I was served had a lot of foam, but overall it was not bad.

This place is whack. The servers are nice; but the service is slow. I&#39;ve noticed that they run out of several items on their menu; despite the fact that those are their most popular items. How does one run out of their more popular items that frequently? Then; there is the portion size of the meals. I once ordered a Factory Burrito; and I was surprised to find out that it&#39;s tiny. It pretty much looked like a small fat wrap. Recently; I ordered the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp. Damn; the serving was tiny. It was served on a side dish platter. Perhaps this place is best suited for take out.<br>Honestly; I rather go to the Factory over in Westbury.

Delivery service was done in 30 min. When an item was thought to be non-stocked, I received a call asking if I would like anything else. When the item was delivered (shortly after I placed my order) they called in to inform me. <br><br>Food was delicious, all my vegetarian samplings were phenomenal. <br><br>Colour me impressed.

Basically:<br><br>1 hour+ wait for 4 people. Sit down. Just ate cheesecake cuz we went to Shake Shack next door in the meantime. First time. Lunch Sunday.<br><br>Okay Godiva. Not my favorite but definitely downable bite by bite even by a person who don&#39;t like chocolate mousse. Chocolate in the middle pure heaven.

Very slow service here. I am a fairly patient person but if you&#39;re not putting 2 hours aside for this dining experience, you&#39;re in trouble. <br><br>Also, I have twice ordered a burger and asked for no mayo and both times the servers messed up it.  Both times they made some excuse. The first time I sat and waited 20 minutes for my server to even take it back. <br><br>Get your service working there, people. I think I got one more try here and then I say adios to the Cheesecake Factory.
Came here today service was good food was good deff will be coming back. Can be pack knowing it&#39;s like right in the side of the mall

I sat with Edie (or Idie idk how she spells it). Amazing service overall. My son was celebrating his birthday and she made him feel very special. I loved the parm herb chicken she recommended to. The only reason I didn&#39;t give 5 stars because my drink was watered down. Will be back!

First time to this cheesecake factory the wait its 1 hour ... i understand its new and all but really? We got this waitress taking our drink afterwards never return with order our meals. Have a different waiter take our order but never comes out. 45 min still NOTHING!! First time your meal will be here shortly, 2nd time just look, lastly ask us your meal not here yet? I was wow table its nothing but the drink

JUST AWFUL! <br><br>I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake Factory locations in Long Island and NJ and this by far has to be the absolute worst. This was my 3rd time at this location. 1st time, 2 hour wait and the food was just ok. 2nd time,  an hour long wait, I got the Steak Diane which literally tasted like someone dumped a gallon of salt on it .. and my 3rd, yesterday.. I ordered the chicken &amp; biscuits (had this dish a least 10x before) ... My biscuit was hard and burnt, you could here the clacking sound if I hit my fork on it, then the mash potatoes (if you want to call it that) I had 3 HUGE potato chunks that were not fully cooked ( size of my biscuit) and hardly any gravy. Our waiter who was extremely nice and friendly didn&#39;t really try to resolve the problem. He apologized when I showed him everything when he came to collect the plates, but came back with no manager and the full bill. I barely touched anything on that plate. Extremely disappointed and this location is tarnishing the Cheesecake Factory brand.

I got a free cheesecake for buying their gift card during the holiday so I redeemed it just 3 days ago. I got a piece of Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch cheesecake to go. The first thing I noticed is that they changed the box for the cake. I&#39;m not sure if it has anything to do with it being a piece of free cake. The box was obviously too low for the whole cake to fit in, so the cashier had to push the lid down and squeeze the cake to fit. When I got home the cake looks like a piece of shit. Not only that, the cake was also not fresh. The cake at the very bottom is overly dry and this is not the first time I had this cake, so I know it shouldn&#39;t be that way. Like the other reviewer said, I&#39;m done with Cheesecake Factory.

Service here is atrocious. Our waitress was very nice but very absentminded. My friends and I placed our order only to have her come back 25 minutes later to claim that she would check with the back to see what was going on. The thing is that we ordered the Seared Tataki Tuna Salad, which shouldn&#39;t have taken incredibly long to make. Nonetheless, we watched as other people who came in after us receiving their orders before us. Mind you, we came in about 15 minutes after they opened!<br><br>The salad was pretty good and refreshing, nothing to write home about but satisfying enough.<br><br>The menu is crazy long, practically like a book but I immediately flipped to the cheesecake section. My friends and I went for the Salted Caramel Cheesecake and that was honestly the only highlight of our visit. That one slice of cheesecake could be split between 2 people!! It was just so creamy and the salted caramel layer at the top balanced the cream cheese portion nicely. I loved that the crust was nice and moist too! And the fact that there was little flakes of salt to provide that extra crunch was the cherry on top.<br><br>A little side note: I asked the waitress to bring out the cheesecake as soon as she took my plate away because we were running late on time. She came back to the table to collect everyone else&#39;s dishes 10 minutes later and asked if we had placed an order for the cheesecake already. <br><br>Service is definitely lacking here. Such a disappointment. Come for the cheesecake but be prepared to be very patient if you order entrees too.

Have not been into a Cheesecake Factory since moving to New York City just over a year ago. After looking at Yelp reviews I was a little unsure of what to expect. I&#39;m happy to say that my experience was delightful. For our low key anniversary dinner we order two Proseccos, appetizers, and the very tasty Steak Diane. Emily was such a wonderful server. She made our cheesecake dessert extra special in the way she brought it to the table. Koodos

Went for my birthday dinner and loved it! It gets crowded so you might have to wait a bit to get seated. They don&#39;t do reservations but it&#39;s well worth the wait! The menu is extensive and an endless list of choices! Amazing food and service! Loved it.

Great food, and most importantly the service was wonderful. All though the wait was an hour and 20 min, but it was expected. Great place , definitely worth going. You don&#39;t want to miss out!<br><br>Food: Greek Salad, it was great. <br>Fried zucchini was alright, not the greatest, the smell of it irritated me, but it was okay.<br>Margarita pizza, delicious.<br>Alfredo pasta, it was alright.

Never thought people who work in restaurants could be so malicious to other human beings. Went here with a guy last night to have dinner. Orders garlic pasta with shrimps. As i am eating my food I bit down on something hard. Don&#39;t know what it was. Then I ask the waitress to package my food to take home. Here I am about to dig in to my cheese cake and look WTF I see.. a big portion of cheesed cake dug out . I am so disgusted and confused. Like why why would you want to do something so evil and wicked to someone who you don&#39;t know. Who has never done anything to you. I promise you I will never go back here. Trust and believe the manager will be hearing from me.

This was my first time at The Cheesecake Factory ever. Let me just say the service was great. I think my server&#39;s name was either Isis or Iris and she was awesome and accommodating. She made honest recommendations about the food when asked and brought us multiple fresh bread baskets.<br><br>So, why the one star review? The food left so much to be desired. Honestly, the tuna tartare we got was over seasoned and that detracted from the quality of the fish. Also, the lemon garlic shrimp pasta and steak medallions were very under seasoned. The only saving grace of the meal were the fresh bread and few bites of mashed potato under my steak. <br><br>I wish I was less underwhelmed by my experience but... suffice to say, I don&#39;t think I will be dining here again.

Waitress forgot to put in our order and we had to wait additional 20 min on top of the 30 min we already waited. My shepherd pie was so salty and burnt. Even a wait for the drinks were long..something is wrong with this service.

came here with a hungry tummy, left satisfied and happy. Wait wasnt too bad for 6pm time, i ordered the carbonara pasta was so so delicious best pasta dish ever! I finished every bite. The bread and butter was amazing too. I enjoyed this location the seating was great. My server was so nice and kind. Will come back for a hearty meal. <br><br>Wish they would open more locations, this business is a success.
Love ordering these guys on DoorDash! The menu is so extensive, and everyone can always get what they want.

Usually go to the long Island location. Decided to try this one since it&#39;s closer and just opened. <br><br>The wait was long and the entrance was too crowded so we decided to eat at the bar. <br><br>The food is the same as the Long Island location.  The waitress and bartender who helped us were extremely personable. They ran out of some things which left us disappointed. Also, the chicken pot stickers had way too much garlic and were almost inedible. <br><br>Overall I&#39;d really recommend going to the Long Island location as opposed to this one. The space is significantly smaller with an equal if not larger clientele base. <br><br>There is absolutely no direction upon entering ; it&#39;s a literal clusterf*ck. I learned only later from the servers that as you enter, pickup orders (from the app) are to the right, reservations are directly ahead, and something else is to the left. When entering, you&#39;re literally in a giant, overcrowded space wondering what the hell is going on. The Long Island location has clearer directives on where to go and not nearly as crowded when you enter; they&#39;ve also never ran out of things I&#39;ve ordered so I assume they&#39;re run better.... Just go there if you can and avoid Queens Center Mall altogether

oh boy, I&#39;m rating this by service.  As usual, the servers are new and training, understandably, but below par!! asked for coffee twice, kids chicken strips came last and late. the chicken strips should&#39;ve been the easiest to get out to the table.  we spent almost two hours in our meal, which waiting time is spent the most out of those hours.  i think management is the problem. they are the &#34;promising&#34; things like&#39; this n that is coming&#39;, but nothing. seriously!?! hopefully they get better.......<br>ok the manager came at spoke to us and apologized for the late kids chicken. she insisted to take the strips out of the bill. good gesture.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory last night, host were great, food was great, but my server Henry was lacking. Service was absolutely terrible to the point where I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be coming back to this location. I&#39;d rather drive 45 minutes to the one in Westbury because that&#39;s how bad my service was last night which says a lot because I come to this location a lot because my past servers have been absolutely great.

I only visited this place twice:  a month ago on a regular day when there was almost no one at the cashier&#39;s, and the second time a week ago on a day that happened to be a national cheesecake day or something. Maaan, that was the queue I havenot seen since the black Friday. <br><br>However, could not leave the place without my tiramisus. They are very nice there. <br>They offer the cheesecake version and the origianal one. I go for the latter. <br><br>I took the cakes away with me,  but the place is quite nice  to stay and eat there.<br><br>Definitely going back to the place for more tiramisu.

The service was here was absolutely terrible. It took about an hour before I got my meal in front of me and the waitress who was serving us clearly had no interest in doing her job properly. The food was mediocre at best. I should have listened to the other reviews and gone somewhere else.

I had dinner with my family at your Elmhurst location. The food was brought out with hair on it. Our waiter literally rolled his eyes at me when I tried to get his attention &amp; when I asked the manager for some sort of discount he looked at me like I was crazy. I was foolish to ignore the B health inspection grade on the door. I will not be returning to your restaurant.

I&#39;m a native New Yorker who lived in Florida for several years and was pleasantly surprised when this place opened in my home town because It brought back fond memories. I decided to take my dad here for his birthday brunch and it was a disappointing experience.  We got there shortly after opening so it was pretty empty.  Long story short, we waited almost an hour for brunch and one of our party guests never even got his dish.  The waitress only came by to check on us once after receiving our coffee and sent the manager to talk to us after 40 min of waiting.  When we got the bill there was a credit for the dish that we never received and a beer.  The manager apologized as did the waitress <br> But the experience fell way short of the memories I look back on.  No chance of a redo.
had my birthday lunch there today. Anthony our waiter and was friendly and assisted us with our selections. He brought me a sundae for my birthday and sang happy birthday. best waiter

I love this place don&#39;t get me wrong, but the service is so slow! We had the waitress pack our food into to go boxes and 2 slices of cake to go and I don&#39;t understand why that takes more than 20mins. We were in a rush to leave and it was in the middle of a really bad blizzard.

So for dinner me, my mother and brother decide to have cheese cake factory for dinner  since we were already at the mall.  My mother was really hungry and ahe has some blood sugar issues. So we go in and the host is no where to be seen and we had to wait about 10 mins for someone to come and welcome us. When I asked for a table of three, the host tells us theres a 15 mins wait for a table when clearly there was alot of tables empty and no one else waiting. We just left. It made no sense and it utterly boggled my mind how an establishment like cheesecake factory would be run so poorly. It&#39;s almost like they don&#39;t want any business from customers.

A cheesecake spot in New York that doesn&#39;t make their cheesecakes on sight and no one at the restaurant is quite sure where exactly they are made.  Florida, maybe?  Then again, what do you expect at a chain like this?  Go elsewhere.  You&#39;re in New York.  If you&#39;re here, get the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cup cheesecake slice.  It&#39;s good.  The Shepard&#39;s pie is pretty good too.

We waited about an 40 min to be seated, which is normal for any Cheesecake Factory especially on a Friday night. I got the bistro shrimp pasta and my friend got the eggplant Parm. Portions are HUGE as usual and filling. Food came about 15 minutes after we ordered which isn&#39;t bad, considering how busy they usually are. Will be back!

This was my first time at The Cheesecake Factory and it will not be my last. I enjoy the food,drinks and service. The waitress was very helpful, she showed my girlfriend and I the best service we have ever had at a restaurant. The drinks that we ordered were perfect, strong and enjoyable. I would recommend this place to everyone.

The menu is huge and the ambiance is loud but awesome.  They have a late night delicious menu and a wide array of drinks. You will drop a pretty penny but the size of the dishes is enormous.  Be prepare to bring home a Doggy bag. You HAVE to save room for a piece of their cheesecake as it is awesome and so worth waiting for.

Place an order to go (pasta yambalaya ) pasta is overcooked cold and nasty portion is so little . trying to call the restaurant. To speak to a manager they put me on hold for 37 minutes and they hang up the phone. .
Went here for my friends birthday dinner on Friday night.. short wait time..food was mediocre (had to send food back). Beautiful atmosphere though.
80 minute wait for okay food and super slow service. The waitress, Amanda P., was awesome! Super nice and very helpful. That&#39;s the only reason this place gets 3 stars.
Great place to have lunch but dinner gets really busy with sometimes a two hour wait!  So get there early if possible. Great food with a very large menu with tons of selections and great service.

Second time there.. Our toast was BLACK on one side, of course black side down. All brunch plates came out at different times, service sucked. Also, we didn&#39;t get our side of potatoes which the waitress asked us if we wanted upon returning if  because &#34;it was supposed to come with the entree.&#34; Third time there.. This Sunday we went for a birthday party of 12 ended up being 10, the waiter had a melt down when we shifted over one seat. Not. kidding. It took an hour and 10 minutes for our breakfast to come.. BREAKFAST. Management clearly isn&#39;t doing something correctly with their hiring process and the kitchen is way too slow. If you come here sit with Talisha!! We had her the first time we went to this location and she was the best.

So I&#39;m going to update this review ... literally am taking one star away for the fact that the rule of &#34;one drink per customer at a time&#34; is BULLSH**T I finished my last sip of Chardonnay the second he walked away , food arrived almost ate half and wine still wasn&#39;t here. Waited and waited now foods cold and still no wine. ?! Don&#39;t understand. Service is outstanding and food is honestly delicious. Bryan&#39;s awesome and I know he&#39;s following store policy. He&#39;s probably the best server I&#39;ve had here and this is about my 6th time at this location. I have ordered the loaded tater tops multiple times but this time I just wasn&#39;t feeling them. Maybe I ate them too many times (LOL) I got the Farfalle (but substituted penne) and it was honestly absolutely DELICIOUS. but I am upset about the wine situation .. fix that guys . Thanks ... sincerely your semi regular --- chris ..... PS Bryan&#39;s customer service is so good and he is just killing it here for real ... would love him come work for me !!!
Service was good the food was pretty good drinks ok no crazy about it. ...but they do deserve 5 start

I sat at the bar for happy hour and was pleasantly surprised. I don&#39;t usually go to chain restaurants because the quality of food and drinks isn&#39;t where I&#39;d like it to be. A ratchet friend of mine begged me to come, and come for happy hour I did. The drinks were ok, but at $6 Per drink you aren&#39;t getting a complaint from me. The food is what blew me out of the water. I had the Ahi tartar, which was wayyy better than I was expecting. It was fresh, and came with avocado and a nice soy ginger sauce. The avocado rolls and chicken sliders were also pretty good, but the burger is what surprised me the most. It was juicy and perfectly seasoned. I looked around the joint like, &#34;where am I? Is this really the Cheesecake Factory??&#34; The bartender wasn&#39;t too sociable, which I&#39;m perfectly okay with. As long as you grab my order and the food comes out in a timely manner, I&#39;m good. Anyway, definitely recommend for happy hour which is from 4-6.

I had only 30-45 min to spend on dinner, I set at the bar and ordered a vegetable salad and a glass of wine. I specifically asked for my dressing to be on a side. When the salad arrived ( relatively quick) the dressing was on it  The bartender was very nice, he apologized, took the salad  and said the new salad will be out shortly. The salad arrived and it was missing edamame, radicchio and cucumbers ( annoying) I let a new bartender now about that. He apologized and said that missing items will be out shortly. The missing items arrived, I dumped them in my salad, then realized that edamame was frozen. The manager was called ( a nice young lady) she apologized as well and brought out warm microwaved edamame. I was confused ( what do you expect me to do with frozen edamame that are already mixed in my salad? ) she said I will get you a new one. At this point I don&#39;t have time to eat anymore. She said I&#39;LL TAKE CARE OF IT. I asked her to put it to-go. She also graciously gave me a piece of cheesecake( that I didn&#39;t really care for) . But when my bill arrived I was surprised to see a salad was still on the bill. I paid and left <br>It is not about money but more about customer service. My order was messed up 3 times!!!!! And I left hungry. It&#39;s not a great experience. I was very disappointed
Very slow service. Staffs are busy but inefficient. Needs 20&#39; for being served. Needs 30&#39; for getting some bread. Very low class restaurant.

APPETIZER <br>The Thai Lettuce Wraps - were simply amazing! We cleared the plate but left the purple cabbage leaf &#34;boats&#34;!<br><br>PASTA<br>Shrimp with Angel Hair pasta - this was very hearty and satisfying. And yet again I cleared my plate. <br><br>SERVICE<br>Friendly but a tad slow with bringing out the dishes. This is a popular restaurant so I can understand they must be busy. Our waitress was lovely and attended to us with second helpings of bread! <br><br>Overall, I always really like coming to the Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;m sure I will be visiting this location soon, except on a weekend because the wait is an hour!

I wish I remembered my waiters name, but he was very attentive and informative. The menu is very long but he was able to explain to my mother what&#39;s what. He was also very nice when Mentioned my brothers birthday and he made sure to surprise him! It was great. Only reason I didn&#39;t give it 5 stars was because the host wasn&#39;t very kind.

Not one for reviews; but, horrible. <br>You can blatantly tell that managers and servers are just going through the motions of service, without actually providing any.<br><br>Food sucked. <br><br>Just save your time &amp; money <br><br>We all know the food is frozen and prepackaged. Do yourself a favor and go to Food Bazaar up the the street, you have a better chance at home. <br><br>Never again.

I was very excited to find out there was a Cheesecake Factory in my area I have always visited the one in Massachusetts and never had an issue the food at that restaurant was great. So I went here last night with some out of town guests it was their first time so we were ready for good food. My friends ordered the Angus steak, they came back and said they were out of it bc they had a busy weekend I  remind you this is Monday at 7pm after that disappointment they got the Steak Diane and one order had watercress salad the other didn&#39;t.  I ordered the Chicken Bellagio and the pasta was cold, greasy and the chicken I had to uncomfortably spit out on a napkin bc it was pure cartilage.<br>I was disgusted and once again disappointed. I really felt bad bc I have gone elsewhere and loved the food it got me to wonder if they don&#39;t care bc it&#39;s in Queens NY and we don&#39;t deserve quality food.<br>I gave it 2 stars one for the service the other for the cheesecake.<br>I asked the server to let the manager know she did and he never came to the table...

The worst service EVER! My niece organized a group dinner reservations are 5. Tables empty but not prepped and not seated until 5:40. No one took any orders for 1/2 hour. Drinks took another 1/2 hour. Appetizers and main plates came at the same time. wait staff not knowing who gets what. We could have gone to juniors! Do not come here!!!!!

when I walk out the bathroom look at the kitchen The guy in the kitchen was texting with gloves on smh I told the manager he asked me did u see him making the food and he was going to change his gloves smh that so nasty  people take they phone in the bathroom or touch outside things I don&#39;t  want nothing from them again smh I just pray I don&#39;t get sick I payed for my food and the manager was a little rude he didn&#39;t care if the person in the kitchen was on they phone at all then you have this big guy walking around taking phone out of girl pocket horse playing in smh I will be calling the board of health office my first and last time tgere

I&#39;m not one to complain or post reviews but this place is absolutely awful. Came to celebrate a birthday and instead walked into a disaster. First off, the service is terrible. Our first server should not even be a server. The second server I actually felt bad for because he walked into a mess. Second, I ordered shrimp scampi and the food was cold. I ate the shrimp, they were lukewarm and soggy, but I was hungry so I slowly ate them. Barely touched the pasta after I realized when I first got the dish that it was cold. By time the server came back I was done the shrimp and told him about it. First the manager repeatedly tried to get me to order dessert. I don&#39;t see cheesecake as an equivalent to dinner. Apparently all the manager could do was take $5 off the meal because I &#34;have to pay for the shrimp&#34;. I should have just let the food sit instead of eating it since the only way you can get your money back for shitty food is to not eat it. The best part about it, the birthday sundae came out completely melted.

Took the server 15 mnts to greet us. Than 8 mnts go get me a lemonade. When entree arrived it had sausage in it, after I specified that I did not eat meat and didn&#39;t want sausage, she never checked on other people&#39;s entrees. I go to Cheesecake Factory y Lawrenceville NJ and it&#39;s great but this one sucks

Ordered takeout. <br><br>Had a good experience -- but had a very long wait time. The wait time for sit down looked to be over an hour judging by the size of the line...crazy!!<br><br>The cheesecakes were on point as always though.
Great service, great food and drinks, great atmosphere. Made me a really good date. My wife really like this try. We will definitely come back!

Annoyances that have nothing to do with the quality of the food:<br><br>1) You have to pay for parking here. Pretty much $5.<br>2) At 4 p.m., they were out of both of our first choices.<br>3) They were out of my wife&#39;s second choice.<br>They are open from 11:30 till 11:00, so 7 hours to go and they are out of God knows how  many things.<br>4) Once served, five different staff members came by within the first 7-8 minutes to ask if &#39;everything is ok?&#39;.  Really annoying.<br>5) They have a ridiculous amount of different types of cheesecake, but no pineapple cheesecake, which is a staple here in NYC. Blueberry, strawberry, pineapple, cherry and plain are the norm mostly anywhere. Come to think of it, I don&#39;t remember seeing blueberry either....<br><br>THE FOOD<br>Philly cheese steak was extraordinarily greasy. I LIKE a greasy chees steak, but this was dripping in grease.<br>There was probably no more than 2 ozs. of steak on the sandwich. For $13, I expected more.<br>The steak did taste good though, what little there was of it.<br>My wife&#39;s salad was ok, nothing to write home about, but acceptable.<br><br>Haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory in 10 years, just reminded myself why.

We are still sitting in the restaurant. I ordered the skinnylicious shrimp, angel hair pasta and asparagus. I understand the pasta portion is supposed to be smaller, but it was barely two bites worth. The &#34;sauce&#34; was watery and the presentation was not appetizing. I sent it back and did not want a replacement because the rest of my party was almost finished eating. The manager cocked her head to the side like a dog and basically looked like my concerns were not valid. My husband&#39;s mashed potatoes were raw. They came and took the plate and gave him new mashed potatoes but they were also raw. His chicken was cold, but he ate it anyway. I included a picture of a massive piece of raw potato. I would not recommend this location. The wait staff ignores you and doesn&#39;t make eye contact. Drive to Long Island.
Dre is an amazing server and is the primary reason we come to Cheesecake Factory! He always makes great recommendations and always delivers exceptional service. Definitely will be coming back !

Was in the neighborhood yesterday with my family looking for a place to have breakfast and my 9 year old son who loves The Cheesecake Factory suggested we go for Sunday brunch. The food was amazing as always and our server Chantel was a pleasure. She recommended the brûlée french Toast so both my husband and I had it. So glad we took her advice, it was heavenly. Our 4 kids really enjoyed their brunch as well.

I came here the day before Valentine&#39;s day around 9ish so granted,the place was full. The wait on tables was about 10 minutes so it wasn&#39;t so bad. The interior decoration is lovely and the cocktail list seems well put together. Our food was pretty good,the Filet Mignon was so tender,it was like butter in your mouth! However,we had to wait long for our food and the mash potatoes were undercooked. Our server was so understanding! She was a bit overworked but she still found time to be attentive and ofcourse,the cheesecakes were amazing!

Fiancé took me to the Cheesecake Factory as a birthday surprise since I have always wanted to come here but never had a chance because of situations back then.wasn&#39;t that long of a wait,our waitress was funny &amp; made us felt welcome I wish I remembered her name (I would recommend her).they have a big menu,covering about everything.i was a bit surprised and felt my order should have been more but it tasted good.would definitely come back again.

Very nice location, but I don&#39;t dare think I&#39;d try my luck at getting a table in under an hour. The cheesecake is divine, and usually takes 15-30 minutes to get a to go slice depending on the day and time you drop by.<br><br>A valid tip for those who are planning to visit; do expect to wait, and don&#39;t blame the staff for how long it takes to seat! they can&#39;t rush patrons out, so when they apologize and say they&#39;re doing their best, don&#39;t be rude and hasty because it&#39;s not their fault. I&#39;ve been here about 6 times so far for cheese cake pick ups for my coworkers, and each time there&#39;s an argument about something inevitable. Everyone&#39;s excited about this place, so expect the wait that comes with it! <br><br>Also, to the woman who says a piece of her slice was eaten, it looks like a tiny piece came off a connected slice lol. I don&#39;t think anyone would go through weeks of training to blow their job over something like that.

This place sucks.  The one by Roosevelt field mall is much better.  We came here for lunch at 12pm. The waitress came right away and took our orders. It took over 1 hour to get our food. The waitress didn&#39;t even come by once to see if we were ok. We were starving at this point. I ordered the chicken Madeira which i always get and absolutely love. It came and the sauce was like water and it was very bland.   Very disappointing. The one by Roosevelt field the sauce is thicker and tastier. We all got served our food and 2 people did not. We were almost finished eating when the food came out for the two people in our group. We could wait to get out of there. <br>I will NEVER go back there again to this location.   It wasn&#39;t even busy. Poor service and the chef sucks.

This Cheesecake Factory located in the Queens Center Mall is an embarrassing representation for the franchise. We started with drinks and my fiancé ordered a passion fruit mojito and I ordered the peach Bellini. Both drinks were really good but I liked my fiancé mojito a little more because I could actually taste the alcohol. My fiancé ordered the chicken bellagio which our server, Jordan discouraged him from getting because he said it did didn&#39;t have any flavor and recommended the parmesan chicken. I ordered a favorite of mine the chicken stuffed tortillas. <br> At least 30 minutes had passed and Jordan hadn&#39;t checked on us or asked us if we wanted more drinks and we still didn&#39;t have our food so my fiancé ask for him to check on it. Jordan brings my chicken stuffed tortillas first then my fiancé chicken Bellagio. My fiancé food looks right but mine looks like it&#39;s missing something. I noticed the sweet corn cakes are missing from the plate. I ask our server, Jordan<br>Where are the corn cakes. He looks at me with a confused expression. He said that is what you ordered. I said I know, but it&#39;s missing the corn cakes that give the dish that sweet with savory balance. The waiter just kept the dazed and confused look, so I asked him to bring me a menu. He comes back with the menu and starts trying to look through the menu to find it. I told him to give it to me because I know exactly what page it was on. When I turned to the page and pointed to the details of the dish where it list what&#39;s in it, the waiter doesn&#39;t even look at the menu instead he walks away... yes you read correctly. I point to where it says corn cakes and this guy just walks away. There happens to be another waiter, Tyrone cleaning up a table beside us and I ask him if the chicken stuffed tortillas comes with corn cakes and he said yes it does. Tyrone is the star of this story because he apologized for our bad service even though he wasn&#39;t even our waiter. This restaurant doesn&#39;t deserve you. <br>A manager I want to call Jessica comes out and says sorry we don&#39;t have any corn cakes would you like something else. Wtf? I wouldn&#39;t have ordered this dish if I would have known that. She said I&#39;m sorry I just found out. She said I can give you a minute to think about it. It had taken so long just to get the food I didn&#39;t want to wait in that cold restaurant waiting for any more disappointment. <br>Our waiter, yes that idiot that lacked social grace came to my fiancé and asked if he was keeping his food. That&#39;s how it is Jordan,really? First you was recommending food then something goes wrong with my dish and you don&#39;t even say I&#39;m sorry the meal wasn&#39;t complete or I&#39;m sorry I didn&#39;t check on you guys before we got the food or after. The manager comes back out, I tell her I don&#39;t want anything just take care of my fiancé meal. The managerJessica by the way is not rude, but she is basic. Basic customer service, basic concern with a lot of basic staff. (She first was just going to offer me cheesecake for my trouble) lol. <br>We asked Jordan for a box for my fiancé food and this fool actually said I thought you said you didn&#39;t want it. Now I&#39;m pissed. We explained the manager comped his meal and I said it&#39;s not your concern anyway seeing as you didn&#39;t do anything to resolve the situation. He looks at me and says how come, I didn&#39;t make the food I just brought it out. I told him that it&#39;s not that there was an error that makes him responsible it&#39;s because he never admitted there was a mistake, he walked away when I showed him there was something missing and didn&#39;t say anything(weird) and he walked around us like I did something wrong even though my meal was wrong. I said in the future instead of trying to give your unsolicited advice on food we should order make sure you learn how to effectively communicate to customers their order will be incomplete and learn strategies in how to best resolve issues when problems arise. At the very least most waiters will say I&#39;m sorry we didn&#39;t have what you ordered correct or I apologize that you were disappointed with your meal.. See Jordan, simple. This is by far the WORST Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to. From the wait time to get the food, bad management, to incompetent servers, this Cheesecake Factory location is a fail. Also the other manager Katie who describes herself as a second tier manager... yes sweetheart you are definitely second tier. Your sarcastic tone and unfriendly disposition fits quite perfectly in this second tier establishment. Tyrone even though you were not my waiter nor management you showed more professionalism and class than all other parties mentioned above. Yes, it did mean a lot to us  that you apologized for the bad experience.

Service was bad.<br>Servers takes too long to bring drinks to take orders.<br>Took almost an hour to get our main course.<br>It takes them forever even to get bill.<br>Oh my oh my, so sad.<br><br>Food was ok, i guess thats the semi good part.

I had such a great time here.. you must get a table with Manny! I couldn&#39;t believe the service. He was so knowledgeable- the menu can be intense. And he helped us find the best cheesecake. (Omg, I was so full) Thank you Manny! If you have a great server to guide you, this place is great!!! You need to have good server here. The menu is large and not everything is good.

Cool, comfortable intimate environment with beautiful interior, this place always ranks at the very top of the list no matter which of of their locations I try. The food is always outstanding and reasonably priced. Be prepared for a wait during peak hours, but it&#39;s well worth it!
Been here a few times and food and service has been good..Im not sure why there so many bad reviews, but ive only been there during the day when there not busy..Good spot.
Very polite staff, My server was noelia such a nice girl, she made sure I was okay with my order and asked if I needed anything else, really enjoyed my food and I was satisfied with the restaurant...

The wait is the worst part honestly. Came here on a Friday night. My friends and I arrived at 6, and did not get seated until around 8ish. The wait for the food wasn&#39;t nearly as bad as the wait for the table. Everything came in a timely fashion and tasted pretty ok. In my opinion I can skip the entrees. They don&#39;t taste all that great to me. I can be completely satisfied with just apps and dessert. My waitress&#39; name was Charlene and she was very nice and helpful.
All of the food was crazy delicious and our server Alec V. was incredible! On point throughout the whole night, extremely kind and patient, just the best! Will definitely be back! :)

I have been to CCF at least 3 times at different locations.NJ,Las Vegas and Queens Center Mall and my wife I have enjoyed it.The food is good.I had the mac n cheeseburger and I also had the godiva chocolate brownie sundae which was ok but I prefer their cheesecake.I had the reese&#39;s peanut buttercup cheesecake which was very good at the Las Vegas one.We will be back very soon to try the other flavors.

Portions are large and the food is not bad. The service is good. HOWEVER, carefully examine the receipt because the &#34;suggested gratuity&#34; is inaccurate and inflated. Tip is based on the subtotal, NOT on the total. You don&#39;t pay tips based the taxes you pay to the government. Take note. That&#39;s why I rate 2 stars.
Went there for my birthday with my family and had a fantastic meal and a spectacular dessert, it was a Monday and totally packed but after my meal I understand why

It was an interesting dining experience. The waiting area was very cramped, but we maneuvered around to find a place out of the way.  Our hostess guided us to a table that was clean on top but wet underneath. I would&#39;ve rather waited 5 more minutes for a clean table and floor than stand to the side and watch someone use a table towel to mop up whatever was spilled underneath. After placing our drink order, water was brought over as we waited. I did a double take.<br>One water mug was old, chipped, cracked and just gross. Who&#39;s drinking from that? How many hands would that mug go through before someone realized that needed to be thrown out and not reach the table?<br>I fast forward. The bread was hard, the pina colada arrived with a weird color and tasted bad. I was happy I only placed an appetizer order and waited before deciding on an entree. I had enough and would  not take a chance. <br>Thank you Katie for listening to our comments. I really wanted to like this place more; however, it didn&#39;t live up to my expectation for the Cheesecake Factory. This location needs a lot of work.

Exquisite &#34;Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake&#34;. My all-time favorite! What I come for each time. They don&#39;t do it wrong here. They really strive for perfection. I also had the &#34;Avocado Eggrolls&#34; for appetizer. It was certainly fresh and tasteful. They use avocado, sun-dried tomato, red onion and cilantro fried in a crisp wrapper. The tamarind-cashew dipping sauce adds a flavorful touch to say the least and I would add that it&#39;s just right with its saltiness. The atmosphere here is intimate and relaxing! Service is commendable. It&#39;s high time NYC got its own Cheesecake Factory spot. I&#39;m very grateful. Good job, guys!

Yesterday was my first time visiting this location.  We arrived and was quoted a 50-60 minute wait for a family of four including two highchairs.  We decided okay we&#39;ll wait, despite no seating available.  After about an hour and 5 minutes our buzzer goes off and we finally proceed with our toddlers.  Get to the desk and the host at that moment then takes the buzzer, so I reminded her of the highchairs.  She looks at me and says, &#34;oh, its a booth, you can&#39;t have highchairs and there is nothing else available.&#34;  I told her that when the other host took our name, he noted highchairs needed, hence a table.  She just kept saying well we have nothing else.  She did not even try to look to see if a table was becoming available or anything.  So I said never mind and walked right out of the restaurant.  Terrible management and customer service and the wait times are horrendous (this was at 9:30p).  We will stick to the one out in Garden City which is way more accommodating, bigger and wait times at night are not that ridiculous, especially for a party of four!  And to top it off, we had to pay for parking for no good reason since all we did was stand and wait for over an hour.

So it&#39;s my second time trying this place out. First time was in Las Vegas and since they opened up one near me I decided why not. Bad idea to come on Mother&#39;s Day. Super packed. An hour and a half wait turned into almost 2.5-3 hours. And it wasn&#39;t pleasing to wait over expected wait time. Once the expected wait time passed I decided to follow up to see how long we had to wait for. And they did say they were running alil over our wait time but said it would be another 30 mins more. We got there at 2 and sat down around 430. <br><br>The waitress was very nice wish I got her name. <br><br>Food was bland. The steak was alright. The mash potatoes were dry. The shrimp scampi had no flavor. The fish tacos were alright but the cilantro rice was cold and alil hard. And the beans were cold too. That was a hard pass. <br><br>Staff is nice but the waiting time for seats is ridiculous and the food didn&#39;t make up for it either. <br><br>Probably won&#39;t be coming back atleast to this location.

This is the worst experience I have ever had.  Not only did I spend 85+ for an ok meal but towards the end while my kids ate dessert I went to the restroom and had to hear two adults having sex in the next stall.  I flushed and they stopped. I quickly got up washed my hands and while existing they continued to have sex.  I proceeded to tell the manager how disappointed I was and also that my family was near the restroom which at any point the would&#39;ve been able to set the two adults walk out.  He told me there&#39;s nothing he can do.  At this point I told him this would be the last time I eat at the cheesecake factory. he proceeded to say well I&#39;ll comp your next meal. What an insult to customers especially ones like myself which go out to there establishment many times before. I&#39;m very disappointed in management staff and security.  Me and my family won&#39;t ever go there again.  And when I mean family I mean primary family extended family friends and co workers.  How would you feel if it were your child walking into a restroom and here what I heard total discuss

Pros: <br>-The cheesecakes<br>-Beautiful lay out and decor<br>Cons: <br>-Wait time is always ridiculous<br>-There are definitely not enough servers for how many tables they have. Our server clearly didn&#39;t have much time for us or any of the tables around us. All the servers just constantly look like theyre running and can&#39;t be bothered because theyre soo busy. And I don&#39;t really blame them, they were very sweet, they just all seemed very stressed and overworked.<br>-Several of the minor things we asked for we never got like extra lemon or dressing for the salad.<br>-So hectic. One of the staff who just brings out food kept literally stomping in our area and shouting everyone&#39;s orders and dropping them so loudly on everyones tables and stomping back out. Constantly. Again I know its because theyre so busy but its disturbing and causes a scene.. please slow down and quiet down a bit.. this isn&#39;t like a fast food cafeteria where you just shout peoples orders and plop their tray down on the table<br>-None of us really loved our food. Salmon was a bit dry. Orange chicken was mediocre. Chicken cesar salad was HUGE (like too big. nobody can eat that much salad.) but super bland. The fish tacos, although they didn&#39;t taste so fresh, were actually the most decent.

DO NOT come to this Cheesecake Factory. We arrived at 7:30 and it&#39;s 10:09 and we still do not have a table. When we arrived we were told the wait would be 1 hour or an hour and a half. 2 hours later we&#39;re still waiting. Let&#39;s be honest the service and food and Cheesecake Factory do not deserve a 2.5 hour wait nor the attitude from the front desk person and the manager that can&#39;t explain why we&#39;ve waited so long. After over a 2.5 hour wait we ended split up among two tables and the bar. Shitty shitty service. Avoid. If no stars could be awarded I wouldn&#39;t award any.
Worse experience ever they are sooo slow, the food has no flavor at all I being to other cheesecake factory and never had such a bad experice will never go back.

The worst experience by far. I ordered a steak and it was way overcooked. It was like eating cardboard. Ordered the buffalo chicken appetizer, it was disgusting. Went to the restroom and all three stalls had no toilet paper. The only plus was our server and the Asian lettuce wrap. Consider what this place charges what a big disappointment.

So my family and I decided to go here because we were shopping for my nieces school clothes and my boyfriend has never been here so we went.... I wish we would have gone to the food court because the experience we had was absolutely horrible... we waited 20 minutes which is fine because it&#39;s expected but my boyfriend went to the bar to get a beer and after waiting 10 minutes for the bartender to even acknowledge that he was sitting there (he was the only one at the bar BTW) he decided to join us in waiting so they finally called us and we sat and waited 20 minutes for a server to come over and she mentioned she is not our server but she felt sorry for us that we have been waiting there for so long that she came over.... ok took our drink orders and appetizer orders which took 15 minutes to get our drinks but my 4 year old niece waited 15 minutes for apple juice and when we finally got our nachos they were cold... by the way we never even got bread for starters no silverware NOTHING... we were treated like we were a bother at this point my boyfriend was so disappointed his hunger went away and he decided he didn&#39;t want anything anymore... our waiter finally arrived and told us sorry for him being late he was called into the office to get yelled at blah blah blah we then said we were unhappy with the service and don&#39;t want the nachos or anything so he called his manager over and he came over we complained he apologized and asked if we wanted our nachos reheated... we decided to order my niece food because she was saying how starving she was.... needless to say we spent 2 hours in this place asked for the check and was still charged for the nachos we sent back and didn&#39;t want... this place absolutely sucks and the service and MANAGER was even worst.... go to the food courts you&#39;ll enjoy it more... wish I can give this zero stars

It was my first time at the Cheesecake Factory. Friendly staff. We were seated right away. Service was quick. Only bad thing was my boyfriend ordered a coke, and he got a sprite instead. :( I love the food. We ordered the crab and artichoke dip and fried mac &amp; cheese as appetizers. Our tummies got filled up pretty quick from that. Our entrees were fettuccini alfredo with chicken lunch special and truffle-honey chicken. Loved my pasta. We couldn&#39;t finish the rest of the food- having two appetizers is very filling. We took the rest to go. I ordered a vanilla bean cheesecake to go with whipped cream. So good. Will come here again.

I wish there is review for no star.<br>The reception desk just does not respect large party. Even the manager also can not provide how she will handle a party of 8.<br>Party of 2 , the waiting time is 25 minutes but party of 8 after wait for two hours, still hand on the air. We move to Longhorn , the management is totally different.

OK where to begin.. I would give 1/2 a star if I could. First they tried to seat me where there was no air conditioning on an 80 degree day without asking. They move us to another table. Fine. We get greeted by the first waitress 1:10PM. She takes our drink order. Within minutes, she brings over another waitress. She explains that her allergies are bothering her and she is going to take a break. Not a prob. The 2nd waitress asks what we would like to eat. I ask her a couple of questions and explain that I can not eat any spicy food as well as explain my food allergies. <br>I ask if the BBQ Chicken Pizza was spicy she answers not to me but then again I am Mexican so nothing is spicy to me. Uh really??<br>Anyway I said how about the Pepperoni Pizza? She answers oh no that is not spicy at all.. I ordered that as a lunch special with a side salad. She tells me that it is a garden salad but for $1.00 more, I could upgrade to a Caesar Salad. I said sure, sounds great. My son orders a pasta dish.<br>It is now 2:00PM by the time the food comes.<br>I take a bite of the pizza and the pepperoni is spicy.<br>It took 10 minutes to get her attention. I tell her I am sorry but this is too spicy for me. She asks with attitude if I would like something else. I tell her no because I do not feel like waiting almost another hour for food. She says OK I will take it off the bill I said great. <br>At this point because of her attitude, she just really started pissing me off so I asked for a manager she&#39;s like OK I will get one for you. I wait 10 minutes nothing. Now the original waitress comes back to me and said is there a problem I said yes I would like to speak to a manager. Another 10 minutes goes by. Finally I asked someone else I&#39;d like to speak to a manager.
